analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las ma 'das pa'i chos kyi skus 'gro ba thams cad yongs su skyob pa'o //
translated: The dharmakƒÅya, which is not in parinirvƒÅ·πáa, protects all transmigrating beings.

analyzed: de lta bur gang gyur pa de ni tshad mar 'khrungs pa zhes bya'o //

analyzed: de la tshad ma grub pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gis dgos pa bstan to //

analyzed: lhag pas ni rang gi gzhung lugs bsdus pa'i rang bzhin du bstan to //

analyzed: de ltar tshigs su bcad pa'i don du gnas pa las kha cig rtsod par byed de /

analyzed: tshad mar gyur pa'i bcom ldan 'das ci'i phyir sgrub par byed / 'di ltar rig byed pa'am /
translated: Why is the Bhagavat, who is an authority, to be established?

original: de las skyes pa'i shes pa la gnod pa dang bral ba'i phyir tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: de las skyes pa'i shes pa la gnod pa dang bral ba'i phyir tshad ma yin te /
translated: Because the Vedas and the knowledge that arises from them are free from error.

original: mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa bzhin no //
translated: They are authorities, just like perception and inference.

original: gnod pa med pa'i shes pa ni tshad ma'o zhes gal te tshad ma'i mtshan nyid la rtsod pa de'i lan gdab par 'dod nas /
analyzed: gnod pa med pa'i shes pa ni tshad ma'o zhes gal te tshad ma'i mtshan nyid la rtsod pa de'i lan gdab par 'dod nas /
translated: If one wishes to respond to the argument about the definition of authority, saying that ‚Äúnonerroneous knowledge is an authority,‚Äù

original: rnam par 'grel pa mdzad pa thun mong gi mtshan nyid nye bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par 'grel pa mdzad pa thun mong gi mtshan nyid nye bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the common characteristics of the commentaries, he says:

original: tshad ma slu med can shes pa //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: tshad ma slu med can shes pa // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Valid cognition is non-deceptive cognition.

original: shes pa ni tshad ma ste /
analyzed: shes pa ni tshad ma ste /
translated: Cognition is valid cognition,

original: de yod na yongs su gcod pa 'grub pa'i phyir dang / dbang po la sogs pa la de bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yod na yongs su gcod pa 'grub pa'i phyir dang / dbang po la sogs pa la de bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because when it exists, ascertainment is established, and because it is the opposite of the senses, etc.

original: gang la slu ba med pa yod ba de'i shes pa yod pa de ni gdon mi za bar tshan ma ste /
analyzed: gang la slu ba med pa yod ba de'i shes pa yod pa de ni gdon mi za bar tshan ma ste /
translated: That cognition which exists in that which has non-deceptiveness, is undoubtedly valid cognition,

original: slu ba la de bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: slu ba la de bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because deceptiveness is the opposite of that.

original: gzhan du ma gal te dbang po la sogs pa tshad mar gyur na ni rab rib kyis sgribs pa'i dbang po yang tshad mar thal bar 'gyur ro //üîΩrab rib la sogs pa'i nyes pas nyams pa'i phyir ji ltar tshad mar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan du ma gal te dbang po la sogs pa tshad mar gyur na ni rab rib kyis sgribs pa'i dbang po yang tshad mar thal bar 'gyur ro // rab rib la sogs pa'i nyes pas nyams pa'i phyir ji ltar tshad mar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If the senses, etc. were valid cognition, then it would follow, absurdly, that even the senses of one who is afflicted with cataracts would be valid.üîΩHow can they be valid cognitions when they are impaired by such defects as cataracts?

original: dbang po las 'das pa'i phyir mig rab rib dang bcas par ji ltar shes /
analyzed: dbang po las 'das pa'i phyir mig rab rib dang bcas par ji ltar shes /
translated: How can the eye, which is beyond the senses, be afflicted with cataracts?

original: gal te slu bar byed pa'i shes pa skye bas skyon dang bcas par ston nges so zhes zer na /
analyzed: gal te slu bar byed pa'i shes pa skye bas skyon dang bcas par ston nges so zhes zer na /
translated: If you say that it is shown to be faulty because a deceptive consciousness arises,

original: de lta na 'o na ni slu bar byed pa dang brel bar mthong ba skyes pa nyid las rgyu dag par nges pa'i phyir slu ba med pa'i shes pa nyid tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ni slu bar byed pa dang brel bar mthong ba skyes pa nyid las rgyu dag par nges pa'i phyir slu ba med pa'i shes pa nyid tshad ma yin no //
translated: then, in that case, because the purity of the cause is ascertained from the mere arising of the seeing of the absence of deception, a nondeceptive consciousness itself is valid knowledge.

original: slu ba med pa smos pas kyang tshad ma'i mtshan nyid gzhan bzlog pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: slu ba med pa smos pas kyang tshad ma'i mtshan nyid gzhan bzlog pa nyid yin no //
translated: And because of the mention of nondeceptiveness, the definition of valid knowledge is just the opposite of that.

original: de'i phyir blo rtogs pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa ni tshad ma nyid du ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir blo rtogs pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa ni tshad ma nyid du ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, how could a cognition that has the nature of realization be valid knowledge?

original: gang gi phyir rtogs pa'i bdag nyid kho nar gyur pa tshad mar khas blangs pas zla ba gnyis su mthong ba @294b tshad mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rtogs pa'i bdag nyid kho nar gyur pa tshad mar khas blangs pas zla ba gnyis su mthong ba @294b tshad mar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because you accept that only that which has the nature of realization is valid knowledge, then seeing two moons would be valid knowledge.

original: 'on te gnod pa med pa'i rtogs pa tshad ma yin na gnod pa med pa'i shes pa nyid gang gi tshe mthong ba de'i skye ba'am /
analyzed: 'on te gnod pa med pa'i rtogs pa tshad ma yin na gnod pa med pa'i shes pa nyid gang gi tshe mthong ba de'i skye ba'am /
translated: But if a realization that is not undermined is valid knowledge, then when a nonundermined consciousness itself sees, it arises.

original: 'on te dus gzhan du gnod pa med pa'i shes pa skye /
analyzed: 'on te dus gzhan du gnod pa med pa'i shes pa skye /
translated: But if it is a nonerroneous consciousness that arises at another time,

original: de'i tshe ni gnod pa dang bral ba nyid du ma grub pas tshad ma'i mtshan nyid du ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i tshe ni gnod pa dang bral ba nyid du ma grub pas tshad ma'i mtshan nyid du ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: then at that time it is not established as being free from error, so how could it be a definition of valid knowledge?

original: dus gzhan du yang gnod pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nges pa'i thabs yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dus gzhan du yang gnod pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nges pa'i thabs yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And there is no way to ascertain that it is not erroneous at another time.

original: gzhan yang phyogs dang po khas len na /
analyzed: gzhan yang phyogs dang po khas len na /
translated: Moreover, if you accept the first position,

original: de'i tshe yang mig rab rib kyis nyams pas zla ba gnyis su mthong ba skyes pa'i tshe gnod pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i tshe yang mig rab rib kyis nyams pas zla ba gnyis su mthong ba skyes pa'i tshe gnod pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: then at that time, because the eye is impaired by cataracts, when the consciousness that sees two moons arises, it is not erroneous.

original: zla ba gnyis su mthong ba'i shes pa tshad mar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zla ba gnyis su mthong ba'i shes pa tshad mar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore it follows that the consciousness that sees two moons is valid knowledge.

original: 'on te dus gzhan du gnod pa can mthong bas zla ba gnyis su mthong ba'i shes pa tshad mi 'gyur na de'i tshe yang thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te dus gzhan du gnod pa can mthong bas zla ba gnyis su mthong ba'i shes pa tshad mi 'gyur na de'i tshe yang thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if you say that the consciousness that sees two moons is not valid knowledge because an erroneous consciousness is seen at another time, then there would be an infinite regress.

original: 'on te gnod pa can ni tshad ma yin pa'i phyir gzhan la mi ltos kyi log pa'i shes pa nyid ni gzhan gyis nges par 'gyur ba'i phyir tshad ma ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gnod pa can ni tshad ma yin pa'i phyir gzhan la mi ltos kyi log pa'i shes pa nyid ni gzhan gyis nges par 'gyur ba'i phyir tshad ma ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that a valid cognition is not invalidated, and so does not depend on another, but a wrong cognition is invalidated, and so is not a valid cognition,

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: then that is not so.

original: gnod pa can gyi tshad ma la gal te gnod pa med par nges na de'i tshe sngar gyi shes pa yang tshad ma ma yin par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gnod pa can gyi tshad ma la gal te gnod pa med par nges na de'i tshe sngar gyi shes pa yang tshad ma ma yin par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: If you ascertain that a valid cognition is not invalidated by another valid cognition, then the former cognition is not a valid cognition, but not otherwise.

original: 'on te gnod pa can la gnod pa ma mthong bas tshad ma yin na ni yongs su shes pa tsam gyis kyang tshad mar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te gnod pa can la gnod pa ma mthong bas tshad ma yin na ni yongs su shes pa tsam gyis kyang tshad mar mi 'gyur te /
translated: But if a valid cognition is a valid cognition because it does not see invalidation, then mere ascertainment would not be a valid cognition.

original: 'o na ci zhe na gnod pa ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na gnod pa ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: What then? Because it does not see invalidation.

original: de la gnod pa ma mthong ba tsam gyis kyang dus gzhan du gnod pa dang bral ba'o zhes bya bar nges pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la gnod pa ma mthong ba tsam gyis kyang dus gzhan du gnod pa dang bral ba'o zhes bya bar nges pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But merely not seeing invalidation does not exist in the least, because at another time, invalidation is not excluded.

original: 'on te gnod pa can de la gnod pa yod na ni de'i tshe /
analyzed: 'on te gnod pa can de la gnod pa yod na ni de'i tshe /
translated: But if that invalidating cognition has invalidation, then at that time,

original: dang po nyid kyi shes pa yang tshad mar 'gyur na de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dang po nyid kyi shes pa yang tshad mar 'gyur na de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: If the first cognition were valid, then it would not be reasonable.

original: de la yang gal te gnod pa yod na ni gnod pa srid pa'i phyir tshad mar nges pa med do //
analyzed: de la yang gal te gnod pa yod na ni gnod pa srid pa'i phyir tshad mar nges pa med do //
translated: If there is a fault in that, then it is not ascertained as valid because of the possibility of a fault.

original: 'on te rgyu'i nyes pa zla ba gnyis su mthong ba'i shes pa tshad mar 'gyur ba la gnod na ni rab rib la sogs pa'i skyon yongs su shes pa yang slu ba nyid kyi shes par 'gyur ba'i phyir slu ba med pa dang / slu ba dang bcas pa dag nyid tshad pa dang /üîΩcig shos su rnam par gzhan par rigs te /
analyzed: 'on te rgyu'i nyes pa zla ba gnyis su mthong ba'i shes pa tshad mar 'gyur ba la gnod na ni rab rib la sogs pa'i skyon yongs su shes pa yang slu ba nyid kyi shes par 'gyur ba'i phyir slu ba med pa dang / slu ba dang bcas pa dag nyid tshad pa dang / cig shos su rnam par gzhan par rigs te /
translated: If the fault lies in the cause of the cognition that sees two moons, then the cognition that fully understands the faults of cataracts and so on would be a deceptive cognition, and therefore it would be reasonable to distinguish valid and non-valid cognitions as non-deceptive and deceptive.

original: de'i phyir rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i shes pa ni tshad ma ma yin te slu ba med pa dang bral ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das nyid tshad mar gyur ba'o zhes 'bad pas sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur pa'i shes pa ni tshad ma ma yin te slu ba med pa dang bral ba'i phyir bcom ldan 'das nyid tshad mar gyur ba'o zhes 'bad pas sgrub par byed do //
translated: Therefore, the cognition that is the basis of dispute is not valid because it lacks non-deceptiveness. The Blessed One himself is valid, and this is established with effort.

original: 'on te slu ba med pas shes pa snga ma @295a //
analyzed: 'on te slu ba med pas shes pa snga ma @295a //
translated: If the previous cognition is non-deceptive,

original: tshad mar 'dod na slu ba med par shes pa nyid tshad ma yin nam tshad ma min /
analyzed: tshad mar 'dod na slu ba med par shes pa nyid tshad ma yin nam tshad ma min /
translated: If you assert that it is valid knowledge, then is the consciousness that is nondeceptive valid knowledge or not?

original: gal te tshad ma ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te tshad ma ma yin na /
translated: If it is not valid knowledge,

original: ji ltar don byed par gnas 'on te tshad ma yin na ni de'i tshe de la yang slu ba med par shes pa gzhan dang ldan pas tshad ma thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar don byed par gnas 'on te tshad ma yin na ni de'i tshe de la yang slu ba med par shes pa gzhan dang ldan pas tshad ma thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: then how does it perform a function? But if it is valid knowledge, then at that time, since it also possesses another consciousness that is nondeceptive, there would be an infinite regress of valid knowledge.

original: gzhan yang gal te slu ba med pa'i shes pa tshad mar khas blangs pa de'i tshe rmi lam du mthong ba dang dung dkar po la ser por shes pa yang don bya ba byed nus pa'i phyir tshad mar 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te slu ba med pa'i shes pa tshad mar khas blangs pa de'i tshe rmi lam du mthong ba dang dung dkar po la ser por shes pa yang don bya ba byed nus pa'i phyir tshad mar 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
translated: Moreover, if you accept that nondeceptive consciousness is valid knowledge, then at that time, since a consciousness that perceives something in a dream and a consciousness that knows a white conch to be yellow are able to perform the function of a valid knowledge, they would be valid knowledge.

original: de'i phyir don byed pa ru gnas pa ni mi slu ba yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir don byed pa ru gnas pa ni mi slu ba yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore it says, ‚ÄúNondeceptive consciousness is valid knowledge.‚Äù

original: don ni bsreg pa dang btso ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: don ni bsreg pa dang btso ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The object is burning, cooking, and so on.

original: byed pa ni sgrub pa ste /
analyzed: byed pa ni sgrub pa ste /
translated: The function is the accomplishment of that.

original: gnas pa ni khong du chud pa'am mi 'gyur ba nyid la bya'o //
analyzed: gnas pa ni khong du chud pa'am mi 'gyur ba nyid la bya'o //
translated: Abiding is to be taken as understanding or immutability.

original: 'di snyam du gang la tha dad pa'i don byed pa de la ji srid du tshad ma dang 'brel pa'i phyir dang / gang du tha mi dad pa'i don byed pa yod pa de nyid ni shin tu yang tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di snyam du gang la tha dad pa'i don byed pa de la ji srid du tshad ma dang 'brel pa'i phyir dang / gang du tha mi dad pa'i don byed pa yod pa de nyid ni shin tu yang tshad ma yin no //
translated: He thinks: ‚ÄúThat which has a different function is valid knowledge, because it is related to a valid cognition; and that which has an undifferentiated function is also valid knowledge.

original: 'di ltar slu ba med pa'i shes pa skyes pa de'i tshe don byed par khong du chud par 'gyur ba de bas na de nyid la skyes bu'i don thams cad yongs su grub pa'i phyir de la yongs su brtag pas dgos pa med do snyam du dgongs so
analyzed: 'di ltar slu ba med pa'i shes pa skyes pa de'i tshe don byed par khong du chud par 'gyur ba de bas na de nyid la skyes bu'i don thams cad yongs su grub pa'i phyir de la yongs su brtag pas dgos pa med do snyam du dgongs so
translated: When a non-deceptive cognition arises, one understands that it has a function. Therefore, since all the aims of a person are accomplished by that, there is no need to investigate it further.‚Äù

original: // 'dis ni dang po'i shes pa slu ba med par shes pa la ltos pa ji lta ba de bzhin slu ba med pa'i shes pa la ltos pas so zhes zer ba de bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: // 'dis ni dang po'i shes pa slu ba med par shes pa la ltos pa ji lta ba de bzhin slu ba med pa'i shes pa la ltos pas so zhes zer ba de bsal ba yin no //
translated: This shows that the first cognition is not valid knowledge, in dependence on a non-deceptive cognition.

original: don byed pa las mi 'gyur ba nyid do zhes bstan pas kyang rmi lam du mthong ba bsal ba yin te /
analyzed: don byed pa las mi 'gyur ba nyid do zhes bstan pas kyang rmi lam du mthong ba bsal ba yin te /
translated: It also shows that the dream example is not established, because it is not possible to have a function without a real thing.

original: de la don byed pa las 'gyur ba'i phyir 'di ltar rmi lam na brtag pa ma yin pa dang / ldog pa nyid du 'gyur gyi sad pa'i shes pa la ni de las bzlog pa yin no //
analyzed: de la don byed pa las 'gyur ba'i phyir 'di ltar rmi lam na brtag pa ma yin pa dang / ldog pa nyid du 'gyur gyi sad pa'i shes pa la ni de las bzlog pa yin no //
translated: Because it is the performance of a function that makes something a valid cognition, it is not the case that a cognition is invalidated in a dream, but it is the case that a cognition is invalidated when one awakens.

original: dung la ser por mthong ba nyid tshad ma ma yin te don bya ba byed pa dang brel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dung la ser por mthong ba nyid tshad ma ma yin te don bya ba byed pa dang brel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The cognition that perceives a conch as yellow is not a valid cognition because it does not perform the function of a valid cognition.

original: dbyibs bsgrub par bya ba'i don bya ba byed par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: dbyibs bsgrub par bya ba'i don bya ba byed par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But the shape of the conch performs the function of a valid cognition!

original: de la rjes su dpag pa nyid tshad mar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la rjes su dpag pa nyid tshad mar 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, inference would be a valid cognition.

original: 'di ltar snang ba'i khyad bar nyid ni de lta bur gyur pa'i dbyibs med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir dang / ser po sgrub pa'i don byed pa med pas mngon sum du ser po bzung ba la tshad ma ma yin no //üîΩyang na gal te gang gi tshe /
analyzed: 'di ltar snang ba'i khyad bar nyid ni de lta bur gyur pa'i dbyibs med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir dang / ser po sgrub pa'i don byed pa med pas mngon sum du ser po bzung ba la tshad ma ma yin no // yang na gal te gang gi tshe /
translated: Because the appearance of a particular shape does not occur without a particular shape, and because the function of establishing yellow does not exist, the direct perception that apprehends yellow is not a valid cognition.üîΩOr, if a nondeceptive cognition is not a valid cognition,

original: slu ba med pa'i shes pa tshad ma ma yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: slu ba med pa'i shes pa tshad ma ma yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: then a valid cognition is not a valid cognition.

original: shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa dang / @295b slu ba med pa nyid rang gi ngo bo yongs su gcod pa'i dus su gcod pa'i phyir rab tu brtag par bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'am /
analyzed: shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa dang / @295b slu ba med pa nyid rang gi ngo bo yongs su gcod pa'i dus su gcod pa'i phyir rab tu brtag par bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'am /
translated: and the nature of consciousness, and at the time of determining its nature, it is not to be doubted that it is nondeceptive.

original: 'on te rang gi ngo bo yongs su mi gcod na /
analyzed: 'on te rang gi ngo bo yongs su mi gcod na /
translated: But if it does not determine its own nature,

original: de'i tshe shes pa rang rig par mi 'gyur ro zhes rtsod par 'gyur du 'ong snyam nas /
analyzed: de'i tshe shes pa rang rig par mi 'gyur ro zhes rtsod par 'gyur du 'ong snyam nas /
translated: then at that time, consciousness would not be reflexive awareness.

original: don byed pa ru gnas pa ni mi slu ba yin te zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: don byed pa ru gnas pa ni mi slu ba yin te zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Thus, he says, ‚ÄúIt is nondeceptive in that it abides as a functional entity.‚Äù

original: des ni 'di skad du shes pa'i rang bzhin nyid la mi slu ba ma yin te don byed par khong du chud pa la mi slu ba yin no //
analyzed: des ni 'di skad du shes pa'i rang bzhin nyid la mi slu ba ma yin te don byed par khong du chud pa la mi slu ba yin no //
translated: This means that it is not that the nature of consciousness itself is nondeceptive; it is nondeceptive in that it is understood to be a functional entity.

original: mi slu ba dang 'brel pas slu ba med pa nyid do //
analyzed: mi slu ba dang 'brel pas slu ba med pa nyid do //
translated: It is nondeceptive because it is related to nondeception.

original: rang gi ngo bo 'ongs su gcod pa'i tshe shes pa don 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo 'ongs su gcod pa'i tshe shes pa don 'gyur ro //
translated: When it determines its own nature, consciousness is a functional entity.

original: dang brel ba ni ma yin no snyam du dgos so //
analyzed: dang brel ba ni ma yin no snyam du dgos so //
translated: It is not that it is not a functional entity.

original: de skad du yang 'bras bu mngon sum du ma 'gyur par rgyur nges pa med do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de skad du yang 'bras bu mngon sum du ma 'gyur par rgyur nges pa med do zhes bshad do //
translated: Thus, it is said that ‚Äúuntil the result is directly perceived, there is no certainty that it is a cause.

original: gal te don byed par gnas pa la slu ba med pa de'i tshe sgra'i shes pa dang khro bo mthong ba ni tshad mar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te don byed par gnas pa la slu ba med pa de'i tshe sgra'i shes pa dang khro bo mthong ba ni tshad mar mi 'gyur te /
translated: ‚Äù If the non-deceptive state of affairs that performs a function is not established, then the cognition of sound and the sight of a mirage would not be valid cognitions.

original: tha dad pa'i don byed pa med pa'i phyir mtshan nyid ma khyab pa'i skyon yod do snyam du sems na de'i phyir bsam ba rtogs par byed pas na sgra las byung ba'am zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i don byed pa med pa'i phyir mtshan nyid ma khyab pa'i skyon yod do snyam du sems na de'i phyir bsam ba rtogs par byed pas na sgra las byung ba'am zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: If you think that there is the fault of the non-pervasion of the definition because they do not perform a different function, then in order to understand that, it is said, ‚Äúbecause it is a cognition arisen from sound.‚Äù

original: sgra ni sgra'i dngos po ste sgra las byung ba ni sgra'i yul can gyi shes pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sgra ni sgra'i dngos po ste sgra las byung ba ni sgra'i yul can gyi shes pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Sound is the entity of sound. A cognition arisen from sound is a cognition that has sound as its object.

original: 'ong gi sgras ni khro bo la sogs pa mthong ba yang gzung ngo //
analyzed: 'ong gi sgras ni khro bo la sogs pa mthong ba yang gzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù includes the sight of a mirage and so on.

original: de la bsam pa ni 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de la bsam pa ni 'dod pa'o //
translated: Here, ‚Äúthought‚Äù is desire.

original: rtogs pa ni khong du chud par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs pa ni khong du chud par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúUnderstanding‚Äù is the cause of comprehension.

original: 'dir yang bsam pa'i yul gyis 'dod pa'i don ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang bsam pa'i yul gyis 'dod pa'i don ston pa'o //
translated: Here, the object of thought is the desired object.

original: des ni 'di skad du sgra'i shes pa ni tha mi dad pa'i don byed pa dang phrad par byed pas tshad ma ste /
analyzed: des ni 'di skad du sgra'i shes pa ni tha mi dad pa'i don byed pa dang phrad par byed pas tshad ma ste /
translated: This means that the consciousness of sound is a valid cognition because it is engaged in the performance of a non-different function.

original: 'di ltar dbyangs thos pa nyid don byed par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar dbyangs thos pa nyid don byed par 'dod pa'o //
translated: Thus, the mere hearing of sound is accepted as the performance of a function.

original: khra bo la sogs pa mthong ba yang khong du chud pa'i don byed do //
analyzed: khra bo la sogs pa mthong ba yang khong du chud pa'i don byed do //
translated: The seeing of a multicolored object, etc. is also the performance of a function.

original: don byed par gnas pa khyad par med par gzung bas ni slu ba med pa zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: don byed par gnas pa khyad par med par gzung bas ni slu ba med pa zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Since the performance of a function is apprehended without distinction, it is taught to be non-deceptive.

original: de'i phyir 'dis ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dis ni /
translated: Therefore, this refutes the following statement:

original: thos pa'i blo ni tshad ma min //
analyzed: thos pa'i blo ni tshad ma min //
translated: The cognition of sound is not a valid cognition,

original: cig shos dang ni 'brel med phyir //üîΩzhes bya ba de bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: cig shos dang ni 'brel med phyir // zhes bya ba de bsal ba yin no //
translated: Because it is not related to the other.

original: de lta mdo kyi gang la tha dad pa'i don byed pa de la don byed pa'i yul can gyi shes pa ni gzhan gyi yul can gyi tshad mas ji ltar rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: de lta mdo kyi gang la tha dad pa'i don byed pa de la don byed pa'i yul can gyi shes pa ni gzhan gyi yul can gyi tshad mas ji ltar rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: If that is not so, then how can the cognition of the performance of a function, which has a different object, be established by a valid cognition that has a different object?

original: der yang gzugs dang / reg pa dang chogs pa gcig la rag las pa'i phyir de de nyid du mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: der yang gzugs dang / reg pa dang chogs pa gcig la rag las pa'i phyir de de nyid du mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: Even there, form and touch are dependent on the same collection, so it is conceived to be just that.

original: @296a * // gang du mthong ba 'dzin pa nyid kyi don byed pa der de'i 'bras bus phrad pa'i rang bzhin ni gcig tu zhen pa yin te tshad ma ni kun du tha snyad la ltos pa'o zhes 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @296a * // gang du mthong ba 'dzin pa nyid kyi don byed pa der de'i 'bras bus phrad pa'i rang bzhin ni gcig tu zhen pa yin te tshad ma ni kun du tha snyad la ltos pa'o zhes 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Where there is seeing, the nature of the result of the object‚Äôs function is ascertained as one, because valid knowledge depends on conventional activity. This will be explained later.

original: gal te slu ba med pa tshad ma ma yin nam //
analyzed: gal te slu ba med pa tshad ma ma yin nam //
translated: If nondeceptive is not valid knowledge,

original: sgra las byung ba'i shes pa ni tshad mar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sgra las byung ba'i shes pa ni tshad mar mi 'gyur te /
translated: then knowledge derived from words would not be valid knowledge.

original: 'di ltar phyi rol gyi don de la mi slu ba med de 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar phyi rol gyi don de la mi slu ba med de 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In this way, external objects are not nondeceptive because they are not related.

original: 'on te bsam pa rtogs par byed pas sgra las byung ba tshad mar khas len gyi /
analyzed: 'on te bsam pa rtogs par byed pas sgra las byung ba tshad mar khas len gyi /
translated: But if it is accepted that knowledge derived from words is valid knowledge because it realizes the intention,

original: don la ma yin na de lta mdo kyi bsam pa ni tha dad pa'am /
analyzed: don la ma yin na de lta mdo kyi bsam pa ni tha dad pa'am /
translated: but not with regard to the object, then in that case, the intention is either different or not different from the object.

original: tha dad pa ma yin par don byed pa dang phrad par mi nus pa'i phyir ji ltar tshad ma yin /
analyzed: tha dad pa ma yin par don byed pa dang phrad par mi nus pa'i phyir ji ltar tshad ma yin /
translated: But it is not possible to realize the function of the object or to contact the object. So how can it be valid knowledge?

original: de la yang slob dpon gyis sgra las byung ba ni tshad ma gzhan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la yang slob dpon gyis sgra las byung ba ni tshad ma gzhan pa ma yin te /
translated: In this regard, the master says: Knowledge derived from words is not another type of valid knowledge.

original: rjes su dpag par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bas tshad ma nyid du smras so zhe na 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: rjes su dpag par bya ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bas tshad ma nyid du smras so zhe na 'dir smras pa /
translated: If you say that it is a means of valid cognition because it is an inference, we reply:

original: smra ba po yi byed pa'i yul //
analyzed: smra ba po yi byed pa'i yul //
translated: The object of the speaker‚Äôs intention

original: blo la snang ba'i don gang yin //
analyzed: blo la snang ba'i don gang yin //
translated: is the meaning that appears to the cognition.

original: de la sgra ni tshad yin gyi //
analyzed: de la sgra ni tshad yin gyi //
translated: The word is the means of valid cognition

original: don gyi de nyid rgyu can min //
analyzed: don gyi de nyid rgyu can min //
translated: with regard to that, but not with regard to the reality of the object.

original: smra ba po'i byed pa bsam pa'i yul gyi don gang yin pa de'i sgra'i shes pa la gsal ba ni rab tu snang ba ste /
analyzed: smra ba po'i byed pa bsam pa'i yul gyi don gang yin pa de'i sgra'i shes pa la gsal ba ni rab tu snang ba ste /
translated: The object of the speaker‚Äôs intention is the meaning that appears clearly to the cognition of the word.

original: sgra ni mngon par 'dod pa'i don de nyid la tshad ma yin gyi don gyi don de kho na nyid kyi rgyu can ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sgra ni mngon par 'dod pa'i don de nyid la tshad ma yin gyi don gyi don de kho na nyid kyi rgyu can ni ma yin no //
translated: The word is the means of valid cognition with regard to that very object that is intended, but it is not the cause of the reality of the object.

original: 'di'i don ni phyi rol gyi don la sgra tshad mar khas len pa ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang bsam pa la ste smra ba po'i rigs pa la mi slu ba grub pa yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: 'di'i don ni phyi rol gyi don la sgra tshad mar khas len pa ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang bsam pa la ste smra ba po'i rigs pa la mi slu ba grub pa yin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The meaning is that it is not accepted that the word is a means of valid cognition with regard to an external object, but rather with regard to the intention, the speaker‚Äôs reasoning, which is established as nondeceptive.

original: gal te de ltar mi slu bas tshad ma yin na sre ba'i shes pa yang de nyid 'di yin no zhes nges par zhugs pas skyes bu'i don 'grub par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te de ltar mi slu bas tshad ma yin na sre ba'i shes pa yang de nyid 'di yin no zhes nges par zhugs pas skyes bu'i don 'grub par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: If it is a valid cognition because it is nondeceptive, then the ascertaining consciousness that ascertains ‚ÄúThis is that very fire‚Äù would establish the person‚Äôs purpose.

original: ji ltar sre ba'i shes pa tshad ma ma yin /
analyzed: ji ltar sre ba'i shes pa tshad ma ma yin /
translated: How is the ascertaining consciousness not a valid cognition?

original: 'di ltar slu ba med pa dang / snga nas med pa'i don 'dzin pa ni tshad ma yin na 'dir yang cha shas can la sogs pa'i shes pa kun rdzob kyang tshad mar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar slu ba med pa dang / snga nas med pa'i don 'dzin pa ni tshad ma yin na 'dir yang cha shas can la sogs pa'i shes pa kun rdzob kyang tshad mar 'gyur te /
translated: If a valid cognition is a consciousness that is nondeceptive and apprehends an object that was not previously apprehended, then in this case, the conventional consciousness that apprehends a whole and so on would be a valid cognition,

original: de la yang mi slu ba mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yang mi slu ba mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is seen to be nondeceptive.üîΩIf you say that the ascertaining consciousness is not a valid cognition because it is not the immediate consequence of the deceptive consciousness,

original: 'on te sre ba'i shes pa zhugs par gyur pa'i de ma thag pa ma yin pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin te /üîΩ'dod pa nyid kyis chod pa'i phyir ro zhe na ni /
analyzed: 'on te sre ba'i shes pa zhugs par gyur pa'i de ma thag pa ma yin pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin te / 'dod pa nyid kyis chod pa'i phyir ro zhe na ni /
translated: then because of that assertion, the consciousness that apprehends a whole would not be a valid cognition, because it is separated from the deceptive consciousness.üîΩIf you say that the ascertaining consciousness is not a valid cognition because the object that it apprehends is very distant,

original: de lta na yang mthong ba ni shin tu chod pa'i phyir tshad mar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na yang mthong ba ni shin tu chod pa'i phyir tshad mar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then seeing would not be a valid cognition, because the object that it apprehends is very distant.

original: 'on te sre ba'i shes pa gtod par byed pa'i shes pa las skyes pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin na /
analyzed: 'on te sre ba'i shes pa gtod par byed pa'i shes pa las skyes pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin na /
translated: But if it is not a valid cognition because it arises from a cognition that is directed toward the object,

original: de bzhin du mthong ba yang rtogs pa med pa'i dbang po las skyes pa de nyid tshad mar mi 'gyur ro //üîΩde bas na gal te @296b rgyu gzhan nas gzhan du brtags pa de'i tshe gtod par byed pa ni tshad mar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du mthong ba yang rtogs pa med pa'i dbang po las skyes pa de nyid tshad mar mi 'gyur ro // de bas na gal te @296b rgyu gzhan nas gzhan du brtags pa de'i tshe gtod par byed pa ni tshad mar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then in the same way, seeing would not be a valid cognition because it arises from a sense faculty that does not understand the object.üîΩTherefore, if you imagine that the cause is different from the object, then the directing cognition would not be a valid cognition.üîΩThus, if you think that a conceptual cognition is not a valid cognition because it engages its object by way of a prior assisting factor,

original: de bas na tha snyad du phan 'dogs pa'i de ma thag par 'jug pas de'i tshe rtog pa dang bcas pa tshad mar mi 'gyur ro zhes sems na de'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na tha snyad du phan 'dogs pa'i de ma thag par 'jug pas de'i tshe rtog pa dang bcas pa tshad mar mi 'gyur ro zhes sems na de'i phyir /
translated: then we say:

original: gzung ba 'dzin phyir kun rdzob ni //
analyzed: gzung ba 'dzin phyir kun rdzob ni //
translated: Because it apprehends the object that is to be grasped,

original: mi 'dod blo ni tshad ma nyid //üîΩblang dang dor bya'i dngos po la //
analyzed: mi 'dod blo ni tshad ma nyid // blang dang dor bya'i dngos po la //
translated: the conventional is not asserted to be a valid cognition.üîΩBecause it is the principal factor in engaging

original: 'jug la de gtso nyid phyir ro //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'jug la de gtso nyid phyir ro // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: the entity that is to be adopted or discarded.

original: kun rdzob kyi shes pa ni tshad mar 'dod pa ma yin te gzung ba 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi shes pa ni tshad mar 'dod pa ma yin te gzung ba 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: We do not assert that a conventional cognition is a valid cognition because it apprehends the object that is to be grasped.

original: sre ba'i shes pa ni rtag pa la gcig tu mngon par zhen pas tshad mar khas len na /üîΩsre ba'i shes pas rtag pa nyid snga na med pa mthong ba ma yin te mthong pa'i dngos po nyid la des /
analyzed: sre ba'i shes pa ni rtag pa la gcig tu mngon par zhen pas tshad mar khas len na / sre ba'i shes pas rtag pa nyid snga na med pa mthong ba ma yin te mthong pa'i dngos po nyid la des /
translated: If you accept that the cognition of similarity is valid knowledge, then you are definitely attached to permanence.

original: mngon par zhen pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cognition of similarity does not see the nonexistence of permanence prior to the present, because it is definitely attached to the entity that is seen.

original: 'di ltar sre ba shes pa'i yul sngon gyi de dang gcig pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar sre ba shes pa'i yul sngon gyi de dang gcig pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: Thus, the object of the cognition of similarity is the same as the previous one.

original: da ltar byung ba la de nyid du log par rtogs pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba la de nyid du log par rtogs pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: It is not the case that it is understood to be the same in the present.

original: sngar gyi dngos po de yang sngon gyi rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: sngar gyi dngos po de yang sngon gyi rtogs pa ste /
translated: The previous entity is the previous cognition.

original: da ltar byung ba'i dus kyi dngos po dang bral ba dang / da ltar gyi dngos po ni da lta nyid du mthong bas sngon gyi dngos po dang bral par rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i dus kyi dngos po dang bral ba dang / da ltar gyi dngos po ni da lta nyid du mthong bas sngon gyi dngos po dang bral par rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The present entity is understood to be free from the previous entity because it is seen in the present.

original: des na mthong ba'i rjes su 'brangs pa'i nges pa'i shes pas mthong bas khong du chud pa nyid la nges pa yin te /
analyzed: des na mthong ba'i rjes su 'brangs pa'i nges pa'i shes pas mthong bas khong du chud pa nyid la nges pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, definite knowledge is definite in the understanding through seeing that follows seeing.

original: gzhan du na sngar shes pa med pa'i rtogs pa nges pa'i shes pa 'khrul par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na sngar shes pa med pa'i rtogs pa nges pa'i shes pa 'khrul par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would follow, absurdly, that the ascertainment of the realization of something that was previously unknown would be a mistaken consciousness.

original: mthong bas ni snga ma dang phyi ma'i rang bzhin tha dad par myong ba'i phyir la nges pas ni de la de nyid du gzhag pa'i phyir ji ltar 'khrul par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: mthong bas ni snga ma dang phyi ma'i rang bzhin tha dad par myong ba'i phyir la nges pas ni de la de nyid du gzhag pa'i phyir ji ltar 'khrul par mi 'gyur /
translated: How could it be mistaken? It is because seeing experiences the former and latter natures as different and because ascertaining them posits them as just that.

original: de'i phyir de nyid 'di yin no zhes pa ni shes pa'i shes pa nyid de /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid 'di yin no zhes pa ni shes pa'i shes pa nyid de /
translated: Therefore, the statement, ‚ÄúThat is this,‚Äù is the consciousness of consciousness.

original: gang gi phyir dang po mthong ba nyid kyi rjes su 'brangs nas lkog tu gyur pa'i rang bzhin la zhen pa'i phyir shes pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dang po mthong ba nyid kyi rjes su 'brangs nas lkog tu gyur pa'i rang bzhin la zhen pa'i phyir shes pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: Because it is the consciousness of consciousness, it is the consciousness of consciousness that, following after the first seeing, conceives of the hidden nature.

original: de ni da ltar gyi mthong ba'i stobs kis kyang da ltar ba la zhen nas de nyid 'di'o zhes shes pa'o //
analyzed: de ni da ltar gyi mthong ba'i stobs kis kyang da ltar ba la zhen nas de nyid 'di'o zhes shes pa'o //
translated: It is the consciousness that conceives of the present as that itself, conceiving of the present through the power of the present seeing.

original: de bas na rigs pa'i de nyid kyis cha shas can gyi shes pa bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na rigs pa'i de nyid kyis cha shas can gyi shes pa bkag pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the partless consciousness is refuted by that reasoning.

original: de la yang mig dang reg pa la skyes pa'i shes pa khas len na mig gi rnam par shes pa la ni kha dog gsal ba'i rang bzhin snang la /
analyzed: de la yang mig dang reg pa la skyes pa'i shes pa khas len na mig gi rnam par shes pa la ni kha dog gsal ba'i rang bzhin snang la /
translated: If you accept that the consciousness that arises from the eye and from contact is the consciousness that sees, then the visual consciousness would perceive the nature of the manifest color,

original: reg pa'i shes pa la ni tsha ba la sogs pa'i khyad par snang gi / de la kha dog dang / reg pa dang bral ba'i yan lag can gyi rdzas snang ba ni ma yin no //üîΩdes @297a * //
analyzed: reg pa'i shes pa la ni tsha ba la sogs pa'i khyad par snang gi / de la kha dog dang / reg pa dang bral ba'i yan lag can gyi rdzas snang ba ni ma yin no // des @297a * //
translated: and the consciousness of contact would perceive the particular, such as heat. But a substance that is the possessor of color and contact would not appear in that consciousness.

original: na mthong ba dang reg pa la zhen pa'i shes pa ni gang mthong ba de nyid reg pa'o zhes gzugs dang / reg par ldan pa'i cha shas can snang bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: na mthong ba dang reg pa la zhen pa'i shes pa ni gang mthong ba de nyid reg pa'o zhes gzugs dang / reg par ldan pa'i cha shas can snang bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the consciousness that is attached to what is seen and to what is touched would not perceive the possessor that has the parts of color and contact, because what is seen is not touched.

original: gal te gcig tu rtog pa'i shes pa tshad ma ma yin na de'i tshe snga ma dang / phyi ma dang bral ba'i da ltar byung ba'i 'dzin pa las rtog pa med pa mthong ba las ji ltar 'jug /'on te snga phyi ma mtshams su sbyar bas rjes su dran pa'i sgo nas 'jug par khas len na ni /
analyzed: gal te gcig tu rtog pa'i shes pa tshad ma ma yin na de'i tshe snga ma dang / phyi ma dang bral ba'i da ltar byung ba'i 'dzin pa las rtog pa med pa mthong ba las ji ltar 'jug /'on te snga phyi ma mtshams su sbyar bas rjes su dran pa'i sgo nas 'jug par khas len na ni /
translated: But if one accepts that one engages in the object through memory, by connecting the prior and subsequent parts,

original: 'di ltar mngon sum du snang ba las skyes bu 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar mngon sum du snang ba las skyes bu 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then a person would not engage in the object that appears in the present.

original: gzhan du gzung ba'i dngos po la 'jug pa yod pas sreg pa dang 'tshod pa nyams su myong bas kyang rgyun mi 'chad par 'jug par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan du gzung ba'i dngos po la 'jug pa yod pas sreg pa dang 'tshod pa nyams su myong bas kyang rgyun mi 'chad par 'jug par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if one engages in the object that is apprehended as different, then one would engage in the object without interruption, since one would experience the object being burned or cooked.

original: de'i phyir mthong ba'i dngos po la 'dod pa nyid kyis 'jug pa'i 'bras bu ni shes pas yin gyi de nyid du 'dzin pa sre ba'i shes pa la ni cung zad kyang dgos pa med de gzhan la tha snyad grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir mthong ba'i dngos po la 'dod pa nyid kyis 'jug pa'i 'bras bu ni shes pas yin gyi de nyid du 'dzin pa sre ba'i shes pa la ni cung zad kyang dgos pa med de gzhan la tha snyad grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, the result of engagement is the cognition of the object that is desired, but there is no need for a cognition that burns the apprehension of the object itself, because the object is established for another.

original: de lta na 'o na 'dod pa nyid kyis 'jug pa'i phyir tshad mar 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na 'dod pa nyid kyis 'jug pa'i phyir tshad mar 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then because it engages by way of desire, it would be a valid cognition.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi mthong ba'i dngos po la 'dod pas 'jug pa'i phyir mthong ba nyid tshad ma ma yin na de ltar na grogs dag mig phye bas gzugs mthong ba la 'jug pa yang tshad mar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi mthong ba'i dngos po la 'dod pas 'jug pa'i phyir mthong ba nyid tshad ma ma yin na de ltar na grogs dag mig phye bas gzugs mthong ba la 'jug pa yang tshad mar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: That is so, but because it engages by way of desire for the object seen, seeing itself is not a valid cognition. In that case, friends, even the engagement of seeing form by opening the eyes would not be a valid cognition.

original: gzung ba 'dzin pa 'dod pa'i tshad ma bzlog par mi nus te //
analyzed: gzung ba 'dzin pa 'dod pa'i tshad ma bzlog par mi nus te //
translated: It is impossible to refute the valid cognition that apprehends what is to be apprehended.

original: gang gi phyir mthong bas khong du chud pa nyid ni dran pas rtogs pa ma yin gyi dran pa'i yul du byas pa'i 'bras bu ni da ltar ba dang 'brel pa'i sa yul du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mthong bas khong du chud pa nyid ni dran pas rtogs pa ma yin gyi dran pa'i yul du byas pa'i 'bras bu ni da ltar ba dang 'brel pa'i sa yul du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that which is comprehended by seeing is not realized by memory, the object of memory is the object of the present, which is related to the object of the past.

original: yang na bzung ba 'dzin pa nyid kyang tha snyad kyi don byed pas dbang po la sogs pa ni tshad mar khas blangs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na bzung ba 'dzin pa nyid kyang tha snyad kyi don byed pas dbang po la sogs pa ni tshad mar khas blangs par 'gyur te /
translated: Or else, because the function of the object of conventional expression is accepted, the sense faculties and so on would be accepted as valid cognitions.

original: gnod pa med pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems na de ni yod pa ma yin te blo nyid tshad ma yin gyi dbang po dang 'dod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gnod pa med pa'i phyir ro snyam du sems na de ni yod pa ma yin te blo nyid tshad ma yin gyi dbang po dang 'dod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: If you think that it is not so because it is not damaged, that is not so, because the mind itself is the valid cognition, not the sense faculty and the desire.

original: ci ste zhe na /üîΩblang dang dor bya'i dngos po la //
analyzed: ci ste zhe na / blang dang dor bya'i dngos po la //
translated: Why is that?üîΩBecause it is the principal factor in engaging

original: 'jug la de gtso nyid yin phyir //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te ;
analyzed: 'jug la de gtso nyid yin phyir // zhes bya ba smos te ;
translated: in the things to be adopted and to be rejected.

original: blang dang dor bya'i dngos po la 'jug pa la blo gtso bo nyid yin te /
analyzed: blang dang dor bya'i dngos po la 'jug pa la blo gtso bo nyid yin te /
translated: Because it is the principal factor in engaging in the things to be adopted and to be rejected.

original: dbang po yod pa tsam gyis su yang 'jug pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po yod pa tsam gyis su yang 'jug pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For, without the mind, there is no engagement in anything, even if the sense faculty is present.

original: 'dod pa las nye bar 'jug pa yod du chug na yang /
analyzed: 'dod pa las nye bar 'jug pa yod du chug na yang /
translated: Even if engagement through desire is possible,

original: de ni 'jug pa'i yul nye bar ston pa med pa'i phyir gtso bo ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'jug pa'i yul nye bar ston pa med pa'i phyir gtso bo ma yin no //
translated: it is not the principal factor because it does not reveal the object of engagement.

original: ci ste de 'dod pa las @297b 'jug par 'gyur na de med pas 'jug par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ci ste de 'dod pa las @297b 'jug par 'gyur na de med pas 'jug par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: If it were to engage through desire, it would not engage in the absence of desire.

original: ci ste gtso bo ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste gtso bo ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it not the principal factor?

original: de lta na 'o na ni stobs dang ldan pa la sogs pa ma gtogs par 'jug pa mi dmigs pas nas pa la sogs pa tshad mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ni stobs dang ldan pa la sogs pa ma gtogs par 'jug pa mi dmigs pas nas pa la sogs pa tshad mar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is so, then since the non-observation of the powerful, etc. is not engaged, the weak, etc. would be valid cognitions.

original: gzhan yang ji ltar 'dod pa ma gtogs par mthong ba'i dngos po la 'jug par mi nus la de bzhin du 'dod pa yod pa las kyang mthong ba ma gtogs par so sor nges par 'jug par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir nus pa mtshungs par mthong ba yin no
analyzed: gzhan yang ji ltar 'dod pa ma gtogs par mthong ba'i dngos po la 'jug par mi nus la de bzhin du 'dod pa yod pa las kyang mthong ba ma gtogs par so sor nges par 'jug par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir nus pa mtshungs par mthong ba yin no
translated: Moreover, just as one is unable to engage the object of seeing except for what is desired, so too, except for what is desired, one is unable to engage the object of seeing individually. Therefore, seeing is equal in power.

original: // de lta bas na 'jug par 'gyur ba'i shes pa ni ci byed pa las gtso bo yin zhe na /
analyzed: // de lta bas na 'jug par 'gyur ba'i shes pa ni ci byed pa las gtso bo yin zhe na /
translated: Thus, is the consciousness that engages the object primary or is the object primary?

original: yul nye bar mthong ba'i phyir blo nyid gtso bo yin te 'dod pa ni tha snyad skyes pa tsam du zad do //
analyzed: yul nye bar mthong ba'i phyir blo nyid gtso bo yin te 'dod pa ni tha snyad skyes pa tsam du zad do //
translated: The mind is primary because the object is seen, for the desire is merely the arising of the convention.

original: de yang tshad ma yin na ha cang thal ches par bshad do //
analyzed: de yang tshad ma yin na ha cang thal ches par bshad do //
translated: Moreover, if that is a valid cognition, it is explained that it is utterly untenable.

original: yang bzlas te gzung ba 'dzin pa nyid ni tshad ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: yang bzlas te gzung ba 'dzin pa nyid ni tshad ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is said that the apprehension of the object that is grasped by repetition is valid cognition,

original: de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te /
translated: that is illogical.

original: gang gi phyir gzung ba 'dzin ba ni lhag pa mi byed pa'i phyir don med pa nyid de 'bras bu med pa'i tshad ma bsam par 'os pa ma yin la 'jug pa'i yul nye bar ston pas na blo nyid tha snyad la gtso bor 'gyur gyi dbang po
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzung ba 'dzin ba ni lhag pa mi byed pa'i phyir don med pa nyid de 'bras bu med pa'i tshad ma bsam par 'os pa ma yin la 'jug pa'i yul nye bar ston pas na blo nyid tha snyad la gtso bor 'gyur gyi dbang po
translated: Because the object of apprehension is not enhanced, the sense faculty is not a valid cognition because it is meaningless, since a non-resultant valid cognition is not worthy of consideration. The mind itself is primary in terms of conventional usage because it reveals the object of engagement.

original: dang 'dod pa'i shes pa ni tshad ma ma yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: dang 'dod pa'i shes pa ni tshad ma ma yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: The sense consciousnesses are not valid cognitions.

original: gal te yang tshad ma'i 'bras bu 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid can skal ba'i dbang po la ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te yang tshad ma'i 'bras bu 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid can skal ba'i dbang po la ma yin te /
translated: Even though the result of valid cognition is not the sense faculty, which is characterized by engagement,

original: 'bras bu de dang 'brel bas /
analyzed: 'bras bu de dang 'brel bas /
translated: it is connected with that result.

original: mig la sogs pa tshad ma ma yin gyi /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa tshad ma ma yin gyi /
translated: Therefore the eye and so on are not valid cognitions.

original: 'on kyang tshad ma'i 'bras bu ma chod pa rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid de skyed par byed pas na tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang tshad ma'i 'bras bu ma chod pa rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid de skyed par byed pas na tshad ma yin no //
translated: However, they are valid cognitions because they generate the result of valid cognition, which is characterized by the realization of an object that is not obstructed.

original: rtogs pa'i 'bras bu 'byung zhing bskyed pa ni tshad ma'i bya ba yin pas 'jug pa nyid la phan 'dogs par byed pas dbang po ni de bzhin du tshad ma'o snyam du sems na /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i 'bras bu 'byung zhing bskyed pa ni tshad ma'i bya ba yin pas 'jug pa nyid la phan 'dogs par byed pas dbang po ni de bzhin du tshad ma'o snyam du sems na /
translated: The result of realization arises and is generated by the activity of valid knowledge. Therefore, since it benefits the engagement itself, the sense faculty is valid knowledge in the same way.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone says:

original: yul can rnam pa tha dad phyir //
analyzed: yul can rnam pa tha dad phyir //
translated: Because the subject has different aspects,

original: blo rtogs tha dad pa yin pas //
analyzed: blo rtogs tha dad pa yin pas //
translated: the realization of awareness is different.

original: yul nyid kyi rnam par ni yul gyi rnam pa ste /
analyzed: yul nyid kyi rnam par ni yul gyi rnam pa ste /
translated: The aspect of the object is the aspect of the object.

original: de'i rnam pa nyid dam /
analyzed: de'i rnam pa nyid dam /
translated: That very aspect

original: yul rtogs pa'i rang bzhin de nyid tha dad pa'i blos te shes pa'i rtogs pa nyid tha dad pa de bas na blo ni tshad ma'o zhes bya bar snyegs so //
analyzed: yul rtogs pa'i rang bzhin de nyid tha dad pa'i blos te shes pa'i rtogs pa nyid tha dad pa de bas na blo ni tshad ma'o zhes bya bar snyegs so //
translated: is the nature of the realization of the object. That very awareness that is different realizes it. Therefore, awareness is valid knowledge.

original: 'di ltar mig la sogs pa bems po yin pas tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar mig la sogs pa bems po yin pas tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: In this way, since the eye and so on are insentient, they are not valid knowledge.

original: 'on te gsal ba ma yin yang dbang po la sogs pa ni shes pa skyed par byed pas tshad ma yin na de'i tshe bdag dang / yul dag kyang shes pa skyed pa'i phyir tshad mar 'gyur @298a * //
analyzed: 'on te gsal ba ma yin yang dbang po la sogs pa ni shes pa skyed par byed pas tshad ma yin na de'i tshe bdag dang / yul dag kyang shes pa skyed pa'i phyir tshad mar 'gyur @298a * //
translated: But if the sense faculties and so on are valid knowledge because they generate consciousness even though they are not clear, then at that time the self and objects would also be valid knowledge because they generate consciousness.

original: ro ; / byed pa po dang las kyi mtshan nyid dang mi mthun pa'i shes pa la byed pa yod na de tshad ma ma yin nam /
analyzed: ro ; / byed pa po dang las kyi mtshan nyid dang mi mthun pa'i shes pa la byed pa yod na de tshad ma ma yin nam /
translated: If a cognition that is not in conformity with the characteristics of an agent and action has an object, is it not a valid cognition?

original: skyes bu ni byed pa po yin la /
analyzed: skyes bu ni byed pa po yin la /
translated: A person is an agent,

original: las ni yul nyid de dag ni tshad ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: las ni yul nyid de dag ni tshad ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: and the object is the action. Since they are valid cognitions, they are valid cognitions.

original: gal te de lta na las de nyid yul du ji ltar shes /
analyzed: gal te de lta na las de nyid yul du ji ltar shes /
translated: If that is so, how does that action itself become the object?

original: rnam par shes pa la snang bas so zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la snang bas so zhe na /
translated: It is because it appears to consciousness.

original: 'o na ni mthong ba nyid kyang yul mthong ba'i phyir de nyid tshad mar rigs pa yin gyi mig la sogs pa ni mthong ba las chod pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: 'o na ni mthong ba nyid kyang yul mthong ba'i phyir de nyid tshad mar rigs pa yin gyi mig la sogs pa ni mthong ba las chod pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: If that is so, since seeing itself sees the object, it is reasonable that it alone is a valid cognition. The eye and so on are not valid cognitions because they are obstructed from seeing.

original: ci ste yang yul gyi rnam pa tha dad pas rtogs pa tha dad de /
analyzed: ci ste yang yul gyi rnam pa tha dad pas rtogs pa tha dad de /
translated: If, on the other hand, the object is different, the realization is different.

original: gang zhig tha dad pas 'bras bu tha dad par 'gyur ba de ni de'i sgrub byed dam pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig tha dad pas 'bras bu tha dad par 'gyur ba de ni de'i sgrub byed dam pa'o //
translated: That which is different and causes a different effect is the best proof.

original: sgrub byed dam pa yang tshad ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sgrub byed dam pa yang tshad ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the best proof is a valid cognition,

original: de'i rnam pa yongs su gcod par byed pas /
analyzed: de'i rnam pa yongs su gcod par byed pas /
translated: it is the valid cognition that determines its aspect.

original: byed pa po nyid de dbang dag pa dang / ma dag pa las rtogs pa tha dad pa'i phyir ji ltar thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir rtogs pa tha dad par nus pas na rnam pa ni shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i phyir blo nyid tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: byed pa po nyid de dbang dag pa dang / ma dag pa las rtogs pa tha dad pa'i phyir ji ltar thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir rtogs pa tha dad par nus pas na rnam pa ni shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i phyir blo nyid tshad ma yin no //
translated: Because the cognition is different from the pure and impure faculties, how can the cognition be different without being non-common? Therefore, the aspect is of the nature of cognition, and thus cognition itself is valid knowledge.

original: de ltar na 'gyur mod kyi dbang po yang dag pa dang / ma dag pa las rtogs pa tha dad pa'i phyir ji ltar sgrub byed min zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na 'gyur mod kyi dbang po yang dag pa dang / ma dag pa las rtogs pa tha dad pa'i phyir ji ltar sgrub byed min zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then since the cognition is different from the pure and impure faculties, how can the faculty not be the establishing factor?

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: de yod na 'di yod pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de yod na 'di yod pa'i phyir //
translated: Because if that exists, this exists.

original: de'i rnam pa yod pa nyid la yongs su gcod pa 'di yod par rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa yod pa nyid la yongs su gcod pa 'di yod par rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the existence of the aspect is established as the existence of the determination.

original: des ni 'di skad du ston par 'gyur te rnam pa tha dad pa nyid kyis blo tha dad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des ni 'di skad du ston par 'gyur te rnam pa tha dad pa nyid kyis blo tha dad par 'gyur te /
translated: This is what is being shown: The cognition becomes different due to the difference in aspects.

original: mig la sogs pa ni 'di ltar rang gi ngo bo dag pa dang / ma dag pa tha dad par gyur pas rtogs pa tha dad pa nyid du gyur kyang /üîΩde ltar thams cad la yod pa yin pas tshad mar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa ni 'di ltar rang gi ngo bo dag pa dang / ma dag pa tha dad par gyur pas rtogs pa tha dad pa nyid du gyur kyang / de ltar thams cad la yod pa yin pas tshad mar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The eye and so on are not valid cognitions because they are not valid with respect to all objects of knowledge, since they are not valid with respect to their own entities.üîΩThe eye and so on are not valid cognitions because they are not valid with respect to all objects of knowledge, since they are not valid with respect to their own entities.üîΩThe eye and so on are not valid cognitions because they are not valid with respect to all objects of knowledge, since they are not valid with respect to their own entities.üîΩThe eye and so on are not valid cognitions because they are not valid with respect to all objects of knowledge, since they are not valid with respect to their own entities.üîΩThe eye and so on are not valid cognitions because they are not valid with respect to all objects of knowledge, since they are not valid with respect to their own entities.

original: 'di ltar mig la sogs pas sbyangs pa'i mig la sngon po dang / ser po la sogs pa'i shes pa tha dad pa dmigs par 'gyur ba de ni dbang po tha dad pas ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar sgrub byed nyid du 'gyur /üîΩyang na gal te dbang po ni nges par rtogs pa'i sgrub byed ma yin pas rgyu mtshan ma yin te rnam pas chod pa'i phyir ro ;üîΩ/ de'i tshe yul ltar snang ba yang shes pa tha dad par nges par byed pa ma yin pas tshad ma yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: 'di ltar mig la sogs pas sbyangs pa'i mig la sngon po dang / ser po la sogs pa'i shes pa tha dad pa dmigs par 'gyur ba de ni dbang po tha dad pas ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar sgrub byed nyid du 'gyur / yang na gal te dbang po ni nges par rtogs pa'i sgrub byed ma yin pas rgyu mtshan ma yin te rnam pas chod pa'i phyir ro ; / de'i tshe yul ltar snang ba yang shes pa tha dad par nges par byed pa ma yin pas tshad ma yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: The eye and so on are not valid cognitions because they are not valid with respect to all objects of knowledge, since they are not valid with respect to their own entities.üîΩThe eye and so on are not valid cognitions because they are not valid with respect to all objects of knowledge, since they are not valid with respect to their own entities.üîΩThe eye and so on are not valid cognitions because they are not valid with respect to all objects of knowledge, since they are not valid with respect to their own entities.

original: de'i phyir / de yod na ni yod phyir ro //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / de yod na ni yod phyir ro //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The eye and so on are not valid cognitions because they are not valid with respect to all objects of knowledge, since they are not valid with respect to their own entities.

original: 'dis ni 'di snyam du sngon po la sogs pa'i gzugs kyi rnam par skyes pa na nges par khong du chud par 'gyur te rnam @298b pa ni rtogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir ro snyam du dgongs so //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di snyam du sngon po la sogs pa'i gzugs kyi rnam par skyes pa na nges par khong du chud par 'gyur te rnam @298b pa ni rtogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi phyir ro snyam du dgongs so //
translated: This means that when a consciousness is produced in the aspect of a form such as blue, it definitely becomes an understanding, because the aspect is the nature of the understanding.

original: de lta na 'o na ni tha dad pa med pa'i phyir tshad ma'i 'bras bu yod par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ni tha dad pa med pa'i phyir tshad ma'i 'bras bu yod par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then since the result is not different from the valid knowledge, how can the result of valid knowledge exist?

original: tshad ma las tha dad pa'i 'bras bu ni med do //
analyzed: tshad ma las tha dad pa'i 'bras bu ni med do //
translated: The result is not different from the valid knowledge.

original: 'on kyang shes pa nyid sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pas tshad mar 'dod la rtogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis ni 'bras bu yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang shes pa nyid sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pas tshad mar 'dod la rtogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis ni 'bras bu yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: However, consciousness itself is asserted to be valid knowledge in the aspect of blue and so on, and the nature of the understanding is to be known as the result.

original: ci ste phyogs mthong ba las de dang phrad par ji ltar shes pa yin te mngon sum gyi shes pas mi slu ba mthong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: ci ste phyogs mthong ba las de dang phrad par ji ltar shes pa yin te mngon sum gyi shes pas mi slu ba mthong ba ma yin te /
translated: If one knows that it is in contact with that object from seeing a part of it, then it is not that the direct perception is not seen without error.

original: de dang nye ba'i sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa tsam snang ba'i phyir mi slu ba dang cig shos kyi shes pa tha dad par byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de dang nye ba'i sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa tsam snang ba'i phyir mi slu ba dang cig shos kyi shes pa tha dad par byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Because only the aspect of the blue, etc., which is similar to that appears, it is not that the non-deceptive and the other cognition are differentiated.

original: gzhan du na shes pa skyes pa'i dus nyid du phrad pa dang cig shos nges pa'i phyir gang yang 'khrul pa med pa dang bzlog pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na shes pa skyes pa'i dus nyid du phrad pa dang cig shos nges pa'i phyir gang yang 'khrul pa med pa dang bzlog pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, at the very time that the cognition arises, there would be contact with the other, and there would be no error, because the opposite would be seen.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi gal te don med na mi 'byung ba'i rigs pa nyid tshad mar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi gal te don med na mi 'byung ba'i rigs pa nyid tshad mar 'gyur te /
translated: This is so, but if the reason that it does not occur without an object is itself a valid cognition,

original: khong du chud pa'i rang bzhin la rtogs par gyur pa de dang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: khong du chud pa'i rang bzhin la rtogs par gyur pa de dang tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: then it is because it is not different from the understanding that has the nature of comprehension.

original: 'khrul pa'i rgyu yod pa nyid kyis kyang la lar nges pa ma yin pa nyid kyis de la ni gzhan las tshad ma yin gyi gang du phrad pa la shin tu goms pas 'khrul pa spangs nas shes pa 'jug pa can de ru ji lta ba'i nyams su
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i rgyu yod pa nyid kyis kyang la lar nges pa ma yin pa nyid kyis de la ni gzhan las tshad ma yin gyi gang du phrad pa la shin tu goms pas 'khrul pa spangs nas shes pa 'jug pa can de ru ji lta ba'i nyams su
translated: Even if the cause of error exists, it is not ascertained in some cases, so in that case it is valid cognition from another. But where there is engagement of cognition that has abandoned error through complete habituation to contact, how could it be valid cognition there?

original: myong ba skyed pa'i phyir rang nyid tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: myong ba skyed pa'i phyir rang nyid tshad ma yin no //
translated: It is a valid cognition because it produces an experience.

original: de bas na don med na mi 'byung ba ni don dang phrad pa la rag las pas rnam par gzhag pa'am /
analyzed: de bas na don med na mi 'byung ba ni don dang phrad pa la rag las pas rnam par gzhag pa'am /
translated: Therefore, if an object does not exist, the cognition that does not occur without it is posited as depending on contact with the object,

original: da ltar gyi snang ba la sogs pa'i yul la ltos pa yin te /
analyzed: da ltar gyi snang ba la sogs pa'i yul la ltos pa yin te /
translated: or it is dependent on the object that is presently appearing, and so on.

original: de la sngon du yod pas yongs su 'dzin par byed do zhes zer na de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la sngon du yod pas yongs su 'dzin par byed do zhes zer na de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: If you say that it apprehends the object that existed previously, that is illogical.

original: don dang phrad par snang ba med na de med na mi 'byung ba mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dang phrad par snang ba med na de med na mi 'byung ba mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if the appearance of contact with the object does not exist, the cognition that does not occur without it does not apprehend it.

original: ci ste de'i tshe phrad par bya ba snang ba ma yin yang de med na mi 'byung ba nyid ni shes pa'i rang bzhin yin pas ji ltar mi shes she na /
analyzed: ci ste de'i tshe phrad par bya ba snang ba ma yin yang de med na mi 'byung ba nyid ni shes pa'i rang bzhin yin pas ji ltar mi shes she na /
translated: But if at that time the appearance of contact with the object does not exist, how can the nature of the cognition, which is the fact that it does not occur without it, be known?

original: de la smras pa /üîΩslu ba med pa ma bzung bar //üîΩmed na mi 'byung ba 'dzin no //
analyzed: de la smras pa / slu ba med pa ma bzung bar // med na mi 'byung ba 'dzin no //
translated: In response to that, it is said:

original: zhes gal te rtog na /
analyzed: zhes gal te rtog na /
translated: If you think that the cognition apprehends the fact that it does not occur without it without apprehending the nondeceptive object,üîΩthenüîΩif you think that the cognition apprehends the fact that it does not occur without it without apprehending the nondeceptive object,üîΩthen

original: phrad pa pa la bye brag med pa de'i tshe 'dod pa'i don byed pa la slu ba med pa bzhin du mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu nus pa 'dzin pa'i shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phrad pa pa la bye brag med pa de'i tshe 'dod pa'i don byed pa la slu ba med pa bzhin du mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu nus pa 'dzin pa'i shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If there is no distinction between the two, then just as there is no deception in the performance of the desired object, so there would be no deception in the cognition apprehending the potential of the undesired result.

original: de'i phyir shes pa la rang gi ngo bo nyid snang bar 'gyur gyi phrad pa'i don med na mi 'byung ba nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir shes pa la rang gi ngo bo nyid snang bar 'gyur gyi phrad pa'i don med na mi 'byung ba nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the nature of the cognition itself would appear, but it would not be the case that the object that is the basis of the appearance is not necessary.

original: 'on te phyogs gnyis pa khas len par @299a * //
analyzed: 'on te phyogs gnyis pa khas len par @299a * //
translated: But if you accept the second position,

original: byed na de'i tshe mdun na gnas pa'i don med na mi 'byung ba nyid kyi zla ba la rnam pa gnyis su mthong ba de yang tshad mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byed na de'i tshe mdun na gnas pa'i don med na mi 'byung ba nyid kyi zla ba la rnam pa gnyis su mthong ba de yang tshad mar 'gyur ro //
translated: then the cognition of two moons, which does not arise in the absence of the object that is the basis of the appearance, would be valid knowledge.

original: 'on te don byed par mthong ba las sngar gyi shes pa tshad mar nges par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te don byed par mthong ba las sngar gyi shes pa tshad mar nges par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the previous cognition is ascertained as valid knowledge from seeing the performance of the object,

original: de lta mod kyi gcig la gcig brten pa'i nyes par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi gcig la gcig brten pa'i nyes par 'gyur te /
translated: then that is so, but there is the fault of mutual dependence.

original: tshad ma nges par 'jug pa de las don bya ba byed par rtogs pa de bas na shes pa snga ma tshad ma yin pa'i phyir 'khor lo 'khor ba bzhin du 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshad ma nges par 'jug pa de las don bya ba byed par rtogs pa de bas na shes pa snga ma tshad ma yin pa'i phyir 'khor lo 'khor ba bzhin du 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the former cognition is valid, it engages in the way a wheel turns.

original: gzhan yang don byed par mthong ba ni btso ba dang / sreg pa la sogs par snang ba dang / sgrub byed snang ba'i yul snga ma'i gzugs la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir yul tha dad pas tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang don byed par mthong ba ni btso ba dang / sreg pa la sogs par snang ba dang / sgrub byed snang ba'i yul snga ma'i gzugs la sogs pa yin pa'i phyir yul tha dad pas tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, seeing something as functional is not a valid cognition because it is a different object, such as seeing something as something to be cooked or burned, or seeing it as the object of an earlier cognition.

original: 'on te don byed pa'i shes pa nyid yul gcig pa de lta na yang don mtshungs pa'i phyir ji ltar shes pa snga ma la the tshom za bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te don byed pa'i shes pa nyid yul gcig pa de lta na yang don mtshungs pa'i phyir ji ltar shes pa snga ma la the tshom za bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If seeing something as functional is the same object, then how can the former cognition be doubted, since the object is the same?

original: gzhan yang mi slu ba'i shes pa skyes pa'i tshig shes pa snga ma med pa de bas na shes pa snga ma'i yul med pa can la byed pas du spyis 'byung ba'i shes pa ji ltar tshad mar thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang mi slu ba'i shes pa skyes pa'i tshig shes pa snga ma med pa de bas na shes pa snga ma'i yul med pa can la byed pas du spyis 'byung ba'i shes pa ji ltar tshad mar thob par 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, the former cognition does not exist when a nondeceptive cognition arises. Therefore, since it is the object of a cognition that does not exist, how can the cognition that arises from many causes be established as valid?

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow, absurdly, that all inferential cognitions would be valid cognitions.

original: 'on te / rjes su dpag pa don byed pa'i rtags las skyes pa'i yul med na yang shes pa snga mas tshad mar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: 'on te / rjes su dpag pa don byed pa'i rtags las skyes pa'i yul med na yang shes pa snga mas tshad mar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: If you say that even though the object of the inferential cognition does not exist, the previous cognition is still a valid cognition,

original: du ba yod pas me yod bya ba bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: du ba yod pas me yod bya ba bzhin no zhe na /
translated: then it would follow, absurdly, that even though there is smoke there is fire.

original: rjes su dpag pa de yang ji ltar tshad ma yin par nges par byed /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa de yang ji ltar tshad ma yin par nges par byed /
translated: How do you ascertain that the inferential cognition is a valid cognition?

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi rjes su dpag pa ni tshad mar rang nyid kyis nges pa ste 'brel pa nges pa'i rtags kyi stobs las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi rjes su dpag pa ni tshad mar rang nyid kyis nges pa ste 'brel pa nges pa'i rtags kyi stobs las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is true that this is so, but the inferential cognition is ascertained to be a valid cognition by itself because it arises from a reason that is ascertained to be related.

original: mngon sum la ni 'khrul pa'i tshogs kyis g-yogs par mthong ba'i phyir tshad mar gzhan gyis rtogs par byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: mngon sum la ni 'khrul pa'i tshogs kyis g-yogs par mthong ba'i phyir tshad mar gzhan gyis rtogs par byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But in the case of direct perception, since it is seen to be covered by a host of errors, it is ascertained to be a valid cognition by another cognition.

original: de ni mi bden te 'di ltar rang gi rtags nges pa mngon sum gyis yin nam /
analyzed: de ni mi bden te 'di ltar rang gi rtags nges pa mngon sum gyis yin nam /
translated: This is not correct. Is the ascertainment of the reason by direct perception or by inference?

original: rjes su dpag pa las yin gal te mngon sum gyis yin na de'i tshe mngon sum gyi rtags nges pa de bas na de la rjes su dpag pa dang / rjes su dpag pa las mngon sum tshad med nges pas gsal par gcig la gcig brten par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa las yin gal te mngon sum gyis yin na de'i tshe mngon sum gyi rtags nges pa de bas na de la rjes su dpag pa dang / rjes su dpag pa las mngon sum tshad med nges pas gsal par gcig la gcig brten par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is by direct perception, then the sign of direct perception is ascertained. Therefore, inference is based on that, and direct valid knowledge is ascertained from inference. Thus, it is clear that they are mutually dependent.

original: 'on te rjes su dpag pa las rtags nges pa yin na /
analyzed: 'on te rjes su dpag pa las rtags nges pa yin na /
translated: But if the sign is ascertained by inference,

original: de'i tshe rjes su dpag pa rtags gzhan la brten pas thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe rjes su dpag pa rtags gzhan la brten pas thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: then since inference is based on another sign, there would be an infinite regress.

original: gzhan yang gal te 'ga' zhig tu me'i gzugs @299b mthong ba las sreg pa la sogs pa'i don nges par byed do zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te 'ga' zhig tu me'i gzugs @299b mthong ba las sreg pa la sogs pa'i don nges par byed do zhe na /
translated: Moreover, if the meaning of burning, etc. is ascertained from seeing the form of fire in some cases,

original: de lta mod kyi gzhan dag tu yang de ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi gzhan dag tu yang de ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: how could it be so in other cases?

original: de'i don mthong bar byed pa nyid tshad ma snga mas yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i don mthong bar byed pa nyid tshad ma snga mas yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is argued that the prior valid knowledge makes one see the meaning of that,

original: gang du sngar don byed par snang ba ni tshad mas grub pa ste /
analyzed: gang du sngar don byed par snang ba ni tshad mas grub pa ste /
translated: where the prior appearance of the meaning is established by valid knowledge,

original: gang tshad mas med na mi 'byung ba des don byed par nges so //
analyzed: gang tshad mas med na mi 'byung ba des don byed par nges so //
translated: that which is not produced without valid knowledge ascertains the meaning.

original: gang du don byed pa de tshad ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gang du don byed pa de tshad ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if it is said that whatever performs a function is valid knowledge,

original: 'dir don byed pa tshad mar ma grub pa las mthong ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'dir don byed pa tshad mar ma grub pa las mthong ba ma yin nam /
translated: then isn‚Äôt it the case that the performance of a function is not established as valid knowledge?

original: tshad mar ma grub pa la nges par don dang phrad pa med pa'i phyir ji ltar de la don byed pa tshad ma yin /üîΩde lta mod kyi /
analyzed: tshad mar ma grub pa la nges par don dang phrad pa med pa'i phyir ji ltar de la don byed pa tshad ma yin / de lta mod kyi /
