translated: Since that which is not established as valid knowledge does not definitely encounter an object, how can the performance of a function be valid knowledge?

original: 'on kyang nges par don byed pa dang phrad pa med pa'i phyir ji ltar tshad ma de la mi slu ba ma grub pa yin /
analyzed: 'on kyang nges par don byed pa dang phrad pa med pa'i phyir ji ltar tshad ma de la mi slu ba ma grub pa yin /
translated: But still, since it does not definitely encounter the performance of a function, how can it be established that that valid knowledge is nondeceptive?

original: de'i phyir rang bzhin tsam bzung ba las tshad mar nges pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang bzhin tsam bzung ba las tshad mar nges pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore it is not that valid knowledge is ascertained from merely apprehending the nature of the object.

original: shin tu goms par bya ba las gzugs kyi khyad par rig pa nyid las slu ba med par nges so zhes bshad pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: shin tu goms par bya ba las gzugs kyi khyad par rig pa nyid las slu ba med par nges so zhes bshad pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it explained that from the knowledge of the specific features of form through the process of thorough familiarization, nondeceptiveness is ascertained?

original: de ni rig pa ma yin te /üîΩgoms pa de mngon sum gyis rtogs pa la yin nam /
analyzed: de ni rig pa ma yin te / goms pa de mngon sum gyis rtogs pa la yin nam /
translated: That is not knowledge.

original: rjes su dpag pas rtogs pa la 'jug pa yin /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas rtogs pa la 'jug pa yin /
translated: Is the realization of that familiarization through direct perception or is it through inference?

original: de la rjes su dpag pas shes pa la ni gal te goms par gyur pa las don byed pa ma 'khrul par gzugs kyi khyad par rig pa'i phyir de'i tshe rjes su dpag pa yang mngon sum med na mi 'jug pa'i phyir gcig la gcig brten par 'gyur
analyzed: de la rjes su dpag pas shes pa la ni gal te goms par gyur pa las don byed pa ma 'khrul par gzugs kyi khyad par rig pa'i phyir de'i tshe rjes su dpag pa yang mngon sum med na mi 'jug pa'i phyir gcig la gcig brten par 'gyur
translated: In that case, since inference does not engage its object without direct perception, they would be mutually dependent.

original: ro // 'on te mngon sum gyi yul du byas pa'i me'i gzugs mthong na /
analyzed: ro // 'on te mngon sum gyi yul du byas pa'i me'i gzugs mthong na /
translated: But if one sees the form of fire that is made into the object of direct perception,

original: btso ba dang sreg pa la sogs par snang ba yang goms par byed na gang gi tshe gzugs mthong ba'i de ma thag tu don byed pa nyams su myong bas de nyid nges pa yod pa yin pas yul gzhan du yang de bzhin du gzugs don byed pa
analyzed: btso ba dang sreg pa la sogs par snang ba yang goms par byed na gang gi tshe gzugs mthong ba'i de ma thag tu don byed pa nyams su myong bas de nyid nges pa yod pa yin pas yul gzhan du yang de bzhin du gzugs don byed pa
translated: and if one becomes familiar with it appearing to burn and cook, then when one sees its form, one would experience its function.

original: med na mi 'byung ba ji ltar mi nges /
analyzed: med na mi 'byung ba ji ltar mi nges /
translated: Since it is ascertained to exist, how could one not ascertain that form that is not different from it also has a function?

original: thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa'i mngon sum du yul dang dus thams cad du 'gro ba dang lhan cig spyod pa dang / nye bar ston pa ma yin pa de bas na mngon sum ni slu ba med pa nges par byed pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa'i mngon sum du yul dang dus thams cad du 'gro ba dang lhan cig spyod pa dang / nye bar ston pa ma yin pa de bas na mngon sum ni slu ba med pa nges par byed pa ma yin zhing /
translated: Direct perception does not pervade all objects and times, nor does it accompany all objects and times, nor does it reveal all objects and times. Therefore, direct perception is not a nondeceptive, definitive cognition.

original: rjes su dpag pas kyang nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas kyang nges pa ma yin no //
translated: Inference also is not a definitive cognition.

original: des na rang nyid tshad ma yin par rigs so snyam du sems na /
analyzed: des na rang nyid tshad ma yin par rigs so snyam du sems na /
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable that one‚Äôs own mind is a valid cognition.‚Äù

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: rang las rang gi ngo bos rtogs //
analyzed: rang las rang gi ngo bos rtogs //
translated: It is understood by itself through its own nature.

original: tha snyad las ni tshad ma nyid //
analyzed: tha snyad las ni tshad ma nyid //
translated: Validity is from convention.

original: ces bya ba la rang mngon sum gyi ngo bo nyid thun mong ma yin pa dang / rang nyid kyis nyams su myong ba yin gyi tshad @300a * //üîΩma ma yin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba la rang mngon sum gyi ngo bo nyid thun mong ma yin pa dang / rang nyid kyis nyams su myong ba yin gyi tshad @300a * // ma ma yin no //
translated: Here, the nature of direct perception is not shared, and it is experienced by itself, but it is not a valid cognition.

original: 'di la tshad ma slu ba med pa nyid du brjod pa yang de la snang ba ni ma yin par bshad do //
analyzed: 'di la tshad ma slu ba med pa nyid du brjod pa yang de la snang ba ni ma yin par bshad do //
translated: Here, a valid cognition is said to be nondeceptive, and it is explained that what appears to it is not real.

original: 'on te rtogs par byed pa nyid tshad ma yin la /
analyzed: 'on te rtogs par byed pa nyid tshad ma yin la /
translated: Or, if that which causes understanding is a valid cognition,

original: rang nyid las rtogs pa ste de ni tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: rang nyid las rtogs pa ste de ni tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: But that is not a valid cognition.

original: gang gi phyir spyod pa pa'i lta bas shes pa lkog tu gyur pa yin na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir spyod pa pa'i lta bas shes pa lkog tu gyur pa yin na /
translated: Because the view of the Carvakas is that consciousness is hidden from itself,

original: ji ltar tshad ma de rang gis grub /
analyzed: ji ltar tshad ma de rang gis grub /
translated: how can a valid cognition be established by itself?

original: ci ste yang shes pa skyes pas tshad ma nyams su myong ba yin te don nyams su myong ba las gzhan du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci ste yang shes pa skyes pas tshad ma nyams su myong ba yin te don nyams su myong ba las gzhan du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If consciousness is produced, it is the experience of a valid cognition, because it is not tenable that it is the experience of an object.

original: shes pa khong du chud nas phyis mi slu bar nges pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir rang nyid du brjod pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa khong du chud nas phyis mi slu bar nges pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir rang nyid du brjod pa'o //
translated: It is said that it is itself because it is not ascertained to be nondeceptive after the understanding of consciousness.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gal te slu ba med pa'i mtshan nyid ni tshad mar khas len pa de lta na rang khong du ma chud kyang don yongs su gcod par byed par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gal te slu ba med pa'i mtshan nyid ni tshad mar khas len pa de lta na rang khong du ma chud kyang don yongs su gcod par byed par 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore, if one accepts that the definition of a valid cognition is nondeceptive, then even if it is not understood by itself, it would ascertain its object.

original: phyis ni don gyis go bar rtogs pa'i phyir nyes pa ci yang med do zhe na /
analyzed: phyis ni don gyis go bar rtogs pa'i phyir nyes pa ci yang med do zhe na /
translated: And later, because it is understood through the object, there is no fault at all.

original: de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te /
translated: That is not correct.

original: rang nyid tshad mar khas len na 'khrul pa'i shes pa yang rang gi don 'dzin par byed pa ni gzhan la mi ltos pas rang nyid kyis tshad ma ma yin pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang nyid tshad mar khas len na 'khrul pa'i shes pa yang rang gi don 'dzin par byed pa ni gzhan la mi ltos pas rang nyid kyis tshad ma ma yin pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one accepts that it is a valid cognition, then a mistaken consciousness apprehending its object would not depend on another, and so it would obtain validity by itself.

original: de nyid smras pa /üîΩtshad ma yin pa don la ni //
analyzed: de nyid smras pa / tshad ma yin pa don la ni //
translated: BhƒÅviveka says this:üîΩIf a valid cognition

original: 'dzin par byed na rang nyid las //
analyzed: 'dzin par byed na rang nyid las //
translated: apprehends an object, it is valid by itself.

original: zhes so // 'on te de la gnod pa yod pas log pa nyid du bzung bas ni bzlog pa'i phyir gzhan las tshad ma ma yin par gzhag go zhe na /
analyzed: zhes so // 'on te de la gnod pa yod pas log pa nyid du bzung bas ni bzlog pa'i phyir gzhan las tshad ma ma yin par gzhag go zhe na /
translated: If it is said, ‚ÄúIt is apprehended as mistaken because it is undermined, and so it is posited as not being a valid cognition in regard to another,‚Äù

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: gnod par bya ba nyid dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnod par bya ba nyid dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is free from being that which is undermined.

original: de yang 'di ltar shes pa la gnod dam /
analyzed: de yang 'di ltar shes pa la gnod dam /
translated: Moreover, is it the consciousness that is undermined?

original: yul la gnod par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: yul la gnod par 'gyur grang na /
translated: Or is it the object that is undermined?

original: de la shes pa la gnod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la shes pa la gnod pa ma yin te /
translated: In that regard, it is not the consciousness that is undermined,

original: de'i shes pa skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i shes pa skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because its consciousness has arisen.

original: yul la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yul la ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the object,

original: yul ni shes pa la brten nas rang gi ngo bo snang ba'i phyir de la cis gnod par 'gyur /
analyzed: yul ni shes pa la brten nas rang gi ngo bo snang ba'i phyir de la cis gnod par 'gyur /
translated: because the object appears to the consciousness in dependence on the consciousness. How could it be undermined?

original: 'on te 'khrul pa'i shes pa la snang ba'i yul de la don byed pa mi 'thob pa'i phyir rdzun pa zhes brjod do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te 'khrul pa'i shes pa la snang ba'i yul de la don byed pa mi 'thob pa'i phyir rdzun pa zhes brjod do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the object that appears to a mistaken consciousness is called false because it does not perform a function,

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: that is not logical.

original: gang gi phyir de la don byed pa mi 'thob tu chug na yang de lta mod kyi sngar bzung ba mthong ba de la ci zhig tu 'gyur na gang gis brdzun pa zhes /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de la don byed pa mi 'thob tu chug na yang de lta mod kyi sngar bzung ba mthong ba de la ci zhig tu 'gyur na gang gis brdzun pa zhes /
translated: Even if it is granted that it does not perform a function, what would be the point of saying that it is false, since it is seen to be apprehended as it was before?

original: dngos po gzhan du gyur pa snang ba dang bral bas ni sngar gyi snang ba mi bden par rigs pa ni ma yin te thal ches pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po gzhan du gyur pa snang ba dang bral bas ni sngar gyi snang ba mi bden par rigs pa ni ma yin te thal ches pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not logical that the previous appearance is false because of the absence of an appearance of a different object, because that is too extreme.

original: 'on te don gyi bya ba byed pa nyid dang bral ba ji ltar bden zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te don gyi bya ba byed pa nyid dang bral ba ji ltar bden zhe na /
translated: But if you ask, ‚ÄúHow can something be true if it is devoid of performing the function of an object?‚Äù

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid snang ba nyams su myong ba'i phyir @300b ro ;
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid snang ba nyams su myong ba'i phyir @300b ro ;
translated: It is because its own nature appears and is experienced.

original: ; de la gang gi phyir tha dad pa'i don byed pa nyid med kyang rang gi ngo bo nyid snang ba ni yod de gang du yang gnod pa yod pa ma yin pas so //
analyzed: ; de la gang gi phyir tha dad pa'i don byed pa nyid med kyang rang gi ngo bo nyid snang ba ni yod de gang du yang gnod pa yod pa ma yin pas so //
translated: Even though it does not perform a different function, its own nature appears, and since there is no contradiction, it exists.

original: gzhan yang gnod pa can gyis bzung ba la ni log pa'i shes pa nyid ldog pa med pa'i phyir gzhan las tshad ma ma yin pa de'i tshe tshad ma yang gzhan las ma nges na 'jig rten pa mi 'jug pa'i phyir /üîΩde yang gzhan las yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang gnod pa can gyis bzung ba la ni log pa'i shes pa nyid ldog pa med pa'i phyir gzhan las tshad ma ma yin pa de'i tshe tshad ma yang gzhan las ma nges na 'jig rten pa mi 'jug pa'i phyir / de yang gzhan las yin no //
translated: If it is not ascertained with respect to others, then the world would not engage in it.

original: de bas na gal te slu ba med pa nyid tshad ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: de bas na gal te slu ba med pa nyid tshad ma yin pa'am /
translated: Therefore, if nondeceptive cognition is valid cognition,

original: rtogs pa'i khyad par tshad mar 'dod pa de lta mod kyi gzhan la ma ltos pa nyid tshad ma yin no zhes zer ba de bsal ba yin te /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i khyad par tshad mar 'dod pa de lta mod kyi gzhan la ma ltos pa nyid tshad ma yin no zhes zer ba de bsal ba yin te /
translated: or if a specific understanding is asserted to be valid cognition, then it is just as we have said: valid cognition is not dependent on others.

original: yongs su shes pa ma gtogs par 'jug pa'i yan lag med pa ni 'bras bu la phan mi 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su shes pa ma gtogs par 'jug pa'i yan lag med pa ni 'bras bu la phan mi 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But this is refuted because, apart from the understanding, there is no other factor that engages in the object, since it does not benefit the result.

original: 'on te dngos po la ltos nas rang nyid tshad ma yin no zhes brjod na de ji ltar shes pa yin /
analyzed: 'on te dngos po la ltos nas rang nyid tshad ma yin no zhes brjod na de ji ltar shes pa yin /
translated: But if you say that it is valid cognition in dependence on the object, how is that known?

original: gang gi phyir don yongs su gcod par nus pa'i mtshan nyid tshad ma yin na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir don yongs su gcod par nus pa'i mtshan nyid tshad ma yin na /
translated: If valid cognition is defined as that which is able to comprehend the object,üîΩthen it is not tenable that it is valid cognition in dependence on the object.

original: nus pa ni shes pa las sngar yod pa ma yin te rten med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nus pa ni shes pa las sngar yod pa ma yin te rten med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The potency does not exist prior to consciousness, because there is no basis for it.

original: mthong ba dang lhan cig skye ba yang ma yin te /üîΩde'i tshe ni gang du de byed par rnam par gzhag skye ba las phyis de'i nus pa 'byung ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: mthong ba dang lhan cig skye ba yang ma yin te / de'i tshe ni gang du de byed par rnam par gzhag skye ba las phyis de'i nus pa 'byung ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor does it arise simultaneously with seeing,üîΩbecause at that time, what would it be that is posited as its agent?

original: de'i tshe shes pa nyid skad cig ma yin pas yod pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i tshe shes pa nyid skad cig ma yin pas yod pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Nor does the potency arise after seeing, because at that time, consciousness itself is not existent, since it is momentary.

original: de lta na 'o na ni phyin ci log gi don yongs su gcod par nus pa yang rang nyid yin pas tshad ma ma yin pa yang rang nyid kyis thob par 'gyur ro /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ni phyin ci log gi don yongs su gcod par nus pa yang rang nyid yin pas tshad ma ma yin pa yang rang nyid kyis thob par 'gyur ro /
translated: If that is so, then the object of error would be ascertained by itself, and thus the nonvalid cognition would be established by itself.

original: 'on te rab rib kyi nyes pa rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa 'jug pas gzhan las tshad ma ma yin par khas len na de lta na ni grogs dag yon tan can gyi rgyu yod pa dang / med pa'i rjes su 'jug pas gzhan la tshad mar khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'on te rab rib kyi nyes pa rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa 'jug pas gzhan las tshad ma ma yin par khas len na de lta na ni grogs dag yon tan can gyi rgyu yod pa dang / med pa'i rjes su 'jug pas gzhan la tshad mar khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: But if you accept that it is nonvalid cognition in relation to another, because of the presence and absence of the fault of the eye disease, then in that case, the friend would be accepted as valid cognition in relation to another, because of the presence and absence of the cause of the good qualities.

original: 'on te yon tan can gyi rgyu ma gtogs par yang rgyu tsam las rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma skye ba mthong na de la yon tan can gyi byed pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te yon tan can gyi rgyu ma gtogs par yang rgyu tsam las rjes su dpag pa'i tshad ma skye ba mthong na de la yon tan can gyi byed pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if one sees that an inference arises from a mere cause, without the cause having the property, then the cause having the property would be without activity.

original: de lta na yang nyes pa'i rgyu ma gtogs par yang rgyu tsam gyis bskyed pa'i the tshom za ba'i shes pa dang / nya phyis la dung du mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta na yang nyes pa'i rgyu ma gtogs par yang rgyu tsam gyis bskyed pa'i the tshom za ba'i shes pa dang / nya phyis la dung du mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: And even so, because of the doubt-producing cognition that is produced by a mere cause, without the cause having the fault, and because of the cognition of mother-of-pearl as silver,

original: tshad ma ma yin pa la nyes pa'i byed pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshad ma ma yin pa la nyes pa'i byed pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: non-authoritativeness would be without the activity of the fault.

original: 'on te de la the tshom za ba dang / phyin ci log gi shes pa mthong bas blo g-yer bag can ma yin par dpag go zhe na de lta mod kyi 'on @301a * //
analyzed: 'on te de la the tshom za ba dang / phyin ci log gi shes pa mthong bas blo g-yer bag can ma yin par dpag go zhe na de lta mod kyi 'on @301a * //
translated: But if one infers that the mind is not confused because one sees doubt and erroneous cognition there, that is so, but still,

original: kyang rjes su dpag pa tshad mar mthong ba las rtags kyi yon tan gsal bar nges par dag go //
analyzed: kyang rjes su dpag pa tshad mar mthong ba las rtags kyi yon tan gsal bar nges par dag go //
translated: from seeing inference as authoritative, the property of the reason is ascertained with clarity.

original: de lta bas na nges pa ma gtogs par rtags las shes pa skye ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na nges pa ma gtogs par rtags las shes pa skye ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, except for certainty, knowledge does not arise from the reason.

original: de'i phyir rgyu'i yon tan sngon du song ba nyid ni tshad ma yin par gzhag go //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu'i yon tan sngon du song ba nyid ni tshad ma yin par gzhag go //
translated: Therefore, the prior existence of the cause is established as the valid means of knowledge.

original: yon tan gyi byed pa skyon las bzlog pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: yon tan gyi byed pa skyon las bzlog pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt the function of a quality the opposite of a fault?

original: tshad ma la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma la ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not for a valid means of knowledge.

original: 'o na tshad ma ma yin pa der yang nyes pas byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'o na tshad ma ma yin pa der yang nyes pas byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Well then, isn‚Äôt the function of an invalid means of knowledge also the opposite of a fault?

original: yon tan log pa'o zhes bya bar ci ste rtog par mi byed /
analyzed: yon tan log pa'o zhes bya bar ci ste rtog par mi byed /
translated: Why not imagine that the opposite of a quality is a fault?

original: des na yod pa la ltos nas rang nyid tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: des na yod pa la ltos nas rang nyid tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, in dependence on existence, it is not itself a valid means of knowledge.

original: gzhan yang gal te nus pa rgyu med na ci ste de thams cad du 'jug par mi 'gyur te rgyu med na yul la sogs pa nges pa mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te nus pa rgyu med na ci ste de thams cad du 'jug par mi 'gyur te rgyu med na yul la sogs pa nges pa mi 'thad do //
translated: Moreover, if potency is without a cause, why doesn‚Äôt it occur everywhere? If there is no cause, it is untenable that it is restricted to a particular place.

original: nus pa ni chos ma yin nam /
analyzed: nus pa ni chos ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt potency a quality?

original: chos kyang chos can ma gtogs par mi 'byung bas shes pa'i khyad par nyid 'ga' zhig la brten pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: chos kyang chos can ma gtogs par mi 'byung bas shes pa'i khyad par nyid 'ga' zhig la brten pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Since a quality does not occur without a substratum, it is based on a particular consciousness.

original: de lta mod kyi 'on kyang nus pa ni rgyu med pa'i chos can gyi dbang du 'gyur bar mi rigs te /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi 'on kyang nus pa ni rgyu med pa'i chos can gyi dbang du 'gyur bar mi rigs te /
translated: That is so, but it is not tenable that potency is a quality that is without a cause.

original: phan 'dogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not benefit.

original: 'di ltar nus pa ni dngos po las gzhan na med de /
analyzed: 'di ltar nus pa ni dngos po las gzhan na med de /
translated: Thus, potency does not exist apart from the thing,

original: gang gi dngos po'i 'bras bur 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gi dngos po'i 'bras bur 'gyur /
translated: because it would be the effect of the thing.

original: nus pa 'bras bu ma yin na 'brel pa ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: nus pa 'bras bu ma yin na 'brel pa ma grub pa yin no //
translated: If potency is not the effect, then the relation is not established.

original: gal te nus pa tha dad pa dang / so sor nges pa'i rdzas kyi dngos po yin na /üîΩde'i tshe de yod na yod pa'i phyir yod pa khyad par can grub pa dang / gzhan du yang rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa 'jug pa rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir dngos po ltos pa'am /
analyzed: gal te nus pa tha dad pa dang / so sor nges pa'i rdzas kyi dngos po yin na / de'i tshe de yod na yod pa'i phyir yod pa khyad par can grub pa dang / gzhan du yang rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa 'jug pa rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir dngos po ltos pa'am /
translated: If potency is a different, discrete, substantial thing,

original: nges pa la ltos pa gnyis srid pas rang las tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: nges pa la ltos pa gnyis srid pas rang las tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: then, because it exists when that exists, the existence of a distinctive thing is established, and because the characteristics of cause and effect are subsumed in the relation of going and coming, and in the relation of dependence, it is impossible for a thing to be a valid cognition in relation to itself.

original: de lta bas na don byed pa mthong bas tshad mar rtogs pa de'i tshe yang btso ba dang / sreg pa la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo snang ba de la sngar mthong ba sngon du mi byed pa'i phyir de la ji ltar tshad mar 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta bas na don byed pa mthong bas tshad mar rtogs pa de'i tshe yang btso ba dang / sreg pa la sogs pa'i rang gi ngo bo snang ba de la sngar mthong ba sngon du mi byed pa'i phyir de la ji ltar tshad mar 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, when one understands that seeing the performance of an object‚Äôs function is valid cognition, then at that time, since one does not first see the appearance of the object‚Äôs own nature, such as that of being cooked or burned, how could it be valid cognition?

original: sreg pa la sogs pa tshor ba'i de ma thag par dran pa skye bas tshad mar 'jog pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: sreg pa la sogs pa tshor ba'i de ma thag par dran pa skye bas tshad mar 'jog pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it posited as valid cognition because memory arises immediately after the feeling of being burned and so on?

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is illogical.

original: dran pa yang mthong ba'i rjes su 'brangs nas skye la /
analyzed: dran pa yang mthong ba'i rjes su 'brangs nas skye la /
translated: Memory arises in dependence on seeing.

original: mthong ba ni snga phyi'i dngos por rang gi rang bzhin snang bar nges pa nyid yin pa de bas na dran pas ni don byed pa dang 'brel pa mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: mthong ba ni snga phyi'i dngos por rang gi rang bzhin snang bar nges pa nyid yin pa de bas na dran pas ni don byed pa dang 'brel pa mi mthong ngo //
translated: And seeing definitely appears as the object‚Äôs own nature in the past and future. Therefore memory does not see the connection with the performance of an object‚Äôs function.

original: gal te mthong pas khong du ma chud pa nyid 'brel par sgro @301b 'dogs na ni 'khrul par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te mthong pas khong du ma chud pa nyid 'brel par sgro @301b 'dogs na ni 'khrul par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If seeing were to superimpose a connection that it does not comprehend, then it would follow that it is mistaken.

original: gang yang dran pa ni rang gi ngo bo nyid la gnas pa mi gsal ba'i rnam pa myong ba des na der yang rang gi ngo bo rtogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang yang dran pa ni rang gi ngo bo nyid la gnas pa mi gsal ba'i rnam pa myong ba des na der yang rang gi ngo bo rtogs pa nyid do //
translated: And memory, which is the experience of an unclear form that is grounded in its own nature, is also the realization of its own nature.

original: 'on te mi slu ba nyid rjes su dpag pas myong na /
analyzed: 'on te mi slu ba nyid rjes su dpag pas myong na /
translated: But if nondeception is experienced through inference,

original: der yang yongs su gsal ba ma yin pa nyid kyi dngos po myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: der yang yongs su gsal ba ma yin pa nyid kyi dngos po myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then there too it is a thing that is not fully clear that is experienced.

original: yang rjes su dpag pa mngon sum ma yin par mi 'byung ba de bas na 'brel pa 'dzin pa ni mngon sum nyid yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: yang rjes su dpag pa mngon sum ma yin par mi 'byung ba de bas na 'brel pa 'dzin pa ni mngon sum nyid yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: Moreover, since inference does not occur without perception, it is taught that the apprehension of the relation is perception itself.

original: des ni rang gi ngo bo nyid thams cad rig par snang gi tshad ma ni ma yin pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid rang gis rtogs pa'o zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: des ni rang gi ngo bo nyid thams cad rig par snang gi tshad ma ni ma yin pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid rang gis rtogs pa'o zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: Therefore, since it appears to be the awareness of all its own nature, but is not a valid cognition, it is established that the nature is realized by itself.

original: de lta na tshad ma ni tshad ma yin pa las log par ji ltar shes she na /üîΩde'i phyir / tshad ma tha snyad las yin no //
analyzed: de lta na tshad ma ni tshad ma yin pa las log par ji ltar shes she na / de'i phyir / tshad ma tha snyad las yin no //
translated: In that case, how is it known that valid cognition is the opposite of invalid cognition?üîΩTherefore it is said:

original: zhes smos pa la /
analyzed: zhes smos pa la /
translated: Valid cognition is from convention.

original: des ni 'di skad du ston par 'gyur te tshad ma ni kun du tha snyad pa'o //
analyzed: des ni 'di skad du ston par 'gyur te tshad ma ni kun du tha snyad pa'o //
translated: This is what is being taught: ‚ÄúValid cognition is conventional.

original: tha snyad ni ji lta ji ltar rnam par brtags pa de lta de ltar med pa ste /
analyzed: tha snyad ni ji lta ji ltar rnam par brtags pa de lta de ltar med pa ste /
translated: Convention is whatever is imagined, and it does not exist in reality.

original: 'khor ba gang du yang don dam par na med pas grol pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: 'khor ba gang du yang don dam par na med pas grol pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba nyid do zhe na /
translated: Since samsara does not exist in reality anywhere, it follows that it is liberation.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir te zhig 'khor ba ni tha snyad du grub par yod la dpyad na stong pa yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: de'i phyir te zhig 'khor ba ni tha snyad du grub par yod la dpyad na stong pa yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: Therefore, samsara is established as existing conventionally, but when analyzed, it is empty.

original: tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa'i cha yang tha snyad du yod pa'o //
analyzed: tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa'i cha yang tha snyad du yod pa'o //
translated: In the same way, the aspects of valid cognition and invalid cognition exist conventionally.

original: 'o na don dam pa la tshad ma med do zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na don dam pa la tshad ma med do zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúBut there is no valid cognition in the ultimate.‚Äù

original: de de bzhin te /
analyzed: de de bzhin te /
translated: That is so.

original: tshad ma gang yin pa ni kun rdzob tu yin no zhes smras so //üîΩgal te yang don dam pa'i tshad ma mngon sum las sam /
analyzed: tshad ma gang yin pa ni kun rdzob tu yin no zhes smras so // gal te yang don dam pa'i tshad ma mngon sum las sam /
translated: We say that whatever is valid cognition is conventional.

original: rjes su dpag pa las yin na /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa las yin na /
translated: If valid cognition is direct perception or inference,

original: tha snyad ces pa'i tshig ci ste brjod ce na /
analyzed: tha snyad ces pa'i tshig ci ste brjod ce na /
translated: why use the word ‚Äúconventional‚Äù?

original: de'i phyir tshad ma tha snyad las yin no zhes pa la tha snyad du grub pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i stobs kyis nges par shes pas mngon par 'dod pa'i don byed pa ni sgrub par byed pa nyid du 'jug cing goms pa phul du byung ba'i tshe /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshad ma tha snyad las yin no zhes pa la tha snyad du grub pa'i rjes su dpag pa'i stobs kyis nges par shes pas mngon par 'dod pa'i don byed pa ni sgrub par byed pa nyid du 'jug cing goms pa phul du byung ba'i tshe /
translated: When one is certain through the power of inference that is established conventionally, one engages in the performance of the desired function. When one has become very familiar with that,

original: rjes su dpag pa med par yang shes pa 'jug pa'i phyir mngon sum yang tshad mar brjod do //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa med par yang shes pa 'jug pa'i phyir mngon sum yang tshad mar brjod do //
translated: one engages in the performance of the desired function even without inference. Therefore, perception is also said to be valid cognition.

original: 'di ltar sreg pa la sogs pa'i don byed 'dod pas ba lang la sogs pa yang sems shing sreg pa la sogs par dmigs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sreg pa la sogs pa'i don byed 'dod pas ba lang la sogs pa yang sems shing sreg pa la sogs par dmigs te /
translated: Thus, one who desires to perform the function of burning, etc., thinks of the cow, etc., and observes the burning, etc.

original: cig car sreg pa la sogs pa dang / ba lang la sogs pa la rtog pa 'jug pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir rtog pa med pa'i shes pa nyid der 'jug par byed pa'o //
analyzed: cig car sreg pa la sogs pa dang / ba lang la sogs pa la rtog pa 'jug pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir rtog pa med pa'i shes pa nyid der 'jug par byed pa'o //
translated: Since the thought that simultaneously conceives of the burning, etc., and the cow, etc., does not engage, the nonconceptual consciousness engages in that.

original: yang na tha snyad ni don byed pa'i shes bas tshad mar @302a * //
analyzed: yang na tha snyad ni don byed pa'i shes bas tshad mar @302a * //
translated: Or, the conventional is valid cognition through the consciousness that performs a function.

original: rtogs pa'o // yang na 'dis tha snyad 'dogs par byed pas tha snyad ni rjes su dpag pa ste /
analyzed: rtogs pa'o // yang na 'dis tha snyad 'dogs par byed pas tha snyad ni rjes su dpag pa ste /
translated: Or else, it is a convention because it causes the designation of a convention, and that is inference.

original: des na tshad ma'o //
analyzed: des na tshad ma'o //
translated: Therefore, it is a valid cognition.

original: 'di ltar de lta bu'i shes pa ni slu ba med pa nyid du shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar de lta bu'i shes pa ni slu ba med pa nyid du shes pa'o //
translated: Thus, such a cognition is known to be non-deceptive.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni 'brel pa nges par bzung ba las 'jug pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni 'brel pa nges par bzung ba las 'jug pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt inference engaged by the ascertainment of a relation?

original: 'brel pa 'dzin pa ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma nyid de /
analyzed: 'brel pa 'dzin pa ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma nyid de /
translated: The ascertainment of a relation is a valid cognition of direct perception,

original: rjes su dpag pa las thug pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa las thug pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because there would be an infinite regress if it were inference.

original: de tshad ma yin par yang rjes su dpog pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de tshad ma yin par yang rjes su dpog pa'i phyir /
translated: And because it is inferred that it is a valid cognition,

original: gcig la gcig brten pa'i nyes pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gcig la gcig brten pa'i nyes pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: there would be the fault of mutual dependence.

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not reasonable,

original: gang gi phyir 'brel pa nges par 'dzin pa ni gzhan dag tu mngon sum dang mi dmigs pas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'brel pa nges par 'dzin pa ni gzhan dag tu mngon sum dang mi dmigs pas so //
translated: because the ascertainment of a relation is elsewhere by direct perception and non-apprehension.

original: 'dir yang gzugs la sogs pa'i snang ba yod na sred pa la sogs pa'i dgos pa mthong bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'dir yang gzugs la sogs pa'i snang ba yod na sred pa la sogs pa'i dgos pa mthong bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: And here, if there is an appearance of form and so on, the need for craving and so on is seen.

original: de med na dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de med na dmigs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it does not exist, it is not an object.

original: de bas na yod pa dang med par 'jug pas 'brel pa 'dzin pa'i phyir 'dir rjes su dpag pa la ci ste thug pa med par 'gyur /
analyzed: de bas na yod pa dang med par 'jug pas 'brel pa 'dzin pa'i phyir 'dir rjes su dpag pa la ci ste thug pa med par 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, since it is engaged in existence and nonexistence, it is related to the object. Why would there be an infinite regress here in inference?

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa nges pas ni gdon mi za bar bskyed bya skyed byed kyi mtshan nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa nges pas ni gdon mi za bar bskyed bya skyed byed kyi mtshan nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Since there is a determination of positive and negative concomitance, it is necessarily the case that there is a relation of producer and produced.

original: gzhan du na tha snyad rgyun chad par brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na tha snyad rgyun chad par brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would be said that conventional usage is interrupted.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is so.

original: mthong ba ni reg pa nyams su myong ba la da ltar gyi dus su myong ba phrad pa'i rang bzhin can snang ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mthong ba ni reg pa nyams su myong ba la da ltar gyi dus su myong ba phrad pa'i rang bzhin can snang ba ni ma yin te /
translated: But seeing is not the experience of contact that is experienced in the present moment, which has the nature of contact.

original: rang gis mthong bas yul du byas pa'i sngon po la sogs pa las rgyud gzhan pa 'dzin pa nyid kyi nges pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gis mthong bas yul du byas pa'i sngon po la sogs pa las rgyud gzhan pa 'dzin pa nyid kyi nges pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not a determination that the object of perception, such as blue, is apprehended by a different continuum from the one that sees it.

original: de bas na reg pa la sogs pa'i shes pas gzugs kyi yul la tshad mar ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bas na reg pa la sogs pa'i shes pas gzugs kyi yul la tshad mar ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, how could the consciousness of contact and so on be valid cognition regarding the object of form?

original: yul tha dad par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: yul tha dad par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Thus it is taught that the object would be different.

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: But that is not logical,

original: gzugs dang / rig pa dag la de nyid du gcig par tha snyad rnam par 'jog pa der yang yul la sogs pa tha mi dad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzugs dang / rig pa dag la de nyid du gcig par tha snyad rnam par 'jog pa der yang yul la sogs pa tha mi dad pa'i phyir /
translated: because in the case of form and cognition, when they are conventionally posited as the same in reality, they are not different objects and so on.

original: gcig tu mngon par zhen pa yin te /
analyzed: gcig tu mngon par zhen pa yin te /
translated: Therefore it is conceived to be one.

original: mthong ba gang yin pa de nyid dang phrad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mthong ba gang yin pa de nyid dang phrad pa'i phyir /
translated: Because that which is seen is itself contact,

original: phrad pa ni sngar mthong ba de dang lhan cig rgyud gcig la 'jug pa'i phyir dang / don gcig la 'jug pa'i phyir mngon par zhen pa la ltos nas tshad ma yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: phrad pa ni sngar mthong ba de dang lhan cig rgyud gcig la 'jug pa'i phyir dang / don gcig la 'jug pa'i phyir mngon par zhen pa la ltos nas tshad ma yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: contact is taught to be valid cognition in dependence on conception, because it engages in the same continuum as that which was previously seen and because it engages the same object.

original: phrad par byed pa tshad ma ma yin nam /üîΩde yang ci ste don byed pa'i shes pas byed dam /
analyzed: phrad par byed pa tshad ma ma yin nam / de yang ci ste don byed pa'i shes pas byed dam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt that which causes contact valid cognition?

original: 'on te mi byed par khas blang bar bya /
analyzed: 'on te mi byed par khas blang bar bya /
translated: And should that be accepted as produced by a consciousness that performs its object‚Äôs function or not?

original: de la gal @302b te phyogs gnyis pa ltar na /
analyzed: de la gal @302b te phyogs gnyis pa ltar na /
translated: If the latter,

original: de'i tshe don byed pa'i shes pa ma gtogs par mthong ba ji ltar de skyed pa yin /
analyzed: de'i tshe don byed pa'i shes pa ma gtogs par mthong ba ji ltar de skyed pa yin /
translated: At that time, how could seeing generate the object-ascertaining cognition, unless the object-ascertaining cognition were already present?

original: 'on te dang po ltar na de ltar na yang mthong ba'i dngos po ni gang gi tshe don byed par dmigs par byed pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: 'on te dang po ltar na de ltar na yang mthong ba'i dngos po ni gang gi tshe don byed par dmigs par byed pa de'i tshe /
translated: But if it is the first case, then when the object of seeing is observed to perform a function,

original: don byed par shes pa pos ji ltar phrad par shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: don byed par shes pa pos ji ltar phrad par shes par bya zhe na /
translated: how could the observer of the object‚Äôs functioning know that it has come into contact with the object-ascertaining cognition?

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, some say:

original: gal te thams las byung ba la ni ma 'ongs pa la tshad ma'i byed pa med pas the tshom za'o //
analyzed: gal te thams las byung ba la ni ma 'ongs pa la tshad ma'i byed pa med pas the tshom za'o //
translated: If it arises from all, since the future does not have the activity of valid knowledge, there is doubt.

original: da lta na yang thams nges pa'i phyir de nyid tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: da lta na yang thams nges pa'i phyir de nyid tshad ma yin no //
translated: But since the present is ascertained, it is valid knowledge.

original: 'di ltar mthong bas ni thams shes par bya'i don byed par bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar mthong bas ni thams shes par bya'i don byed par bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: In this way, seeing is for the sake of knowing all, but not for the sake of performing a function.

original: rgyu gzhan dang 'brel pa las sreg pa la sogs pa byed par ji ltar shes par byed pa nyid du nus /
analyzed: rgyu gzhan dang 'brel pa las sreg pa la sogs pa byed par ji ltar shes par byed pa nyid du nus /
translated: How could it be possible for it to be the cause of the activity of burning and so on?

original: thabs nges par gyur na thabs las byung ba la the tshom za ba 'jug pa yang mthong ste /
analyzed: thabs nges par gyur na thabs las byung ba la the tshom za ba 'jug pa yang mthong ste /
translated: When the means is ascertained, it is seen that doubt about what arises from the means is engaged.

original: so nam byed pa na 'khor las byed pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: so nam byed pa na 'khor las byed pa lta bu'o //
translated: When one is engaged in farming, one is like a worker in a wheel.

original: de lta bas na 'khor lo lta bu'i skyon mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na 'khor lo lta bu'i skyon mi 'jug ste /
translated: Therefore, the fault of a wheel does not apply.

original: 'di ltar sgrub byed nges pa'i don la dang po zhugs pa ni tshad ma nges pa ma gtogs pa yang srid pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar sgrub byed nges pa'i don la dang po zhugs pa ni tshad ma nges pa ma gtogs pa yang srid pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is possible that one who is engaged in the definitive meaning for the first time is not certain about the valid cognition.

original: slu pa med pa nyid kyis sngar bzung ba la goms pa'i stobs kyis 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: slu pa med pa nyid kyis sngar bzung ba la goms pa'i stobs kyis 'jug pa yin te /
translated: However, by the power of being accustomed to what was previously apprehended, one engages in the nondeceptive valid cognition.

original: de'i rigs yin pa'i phyir ro /üîΩ// / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa las /
analyzed: de'i rigs yin pa'i phyir ro / // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa las /
translated: Because it is of that type.

original: bam po gnyis pa /
analyzed: bam po gnyis pa /
translated: From the Commentary on the Differentiation of Valid Cognition.

original: gal te yang tshad ma nges pa nyid thams cad du tha snyad pa yin na gcig la gcig brten par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te yang tshad ma nges pa nyid thams cad du tha snyad pa yin na gcig la gcig brten par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If valid cognition is certain in all cases, it would be mutually dependent.

original: de yang med de /
analyzed: de yang med de /
translated: That is also not the case.

original: 'ga' zhig thams cad don du gnyer ba med par yang slu ba med pa dang po'i dus su nges pa ste /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig thams cad don du gnyer ba med par yang slu ba med pa dang po'i dus su nges pa ste /
translated: Even without anyone seeking it, the nondeceptive valid cognition is certain from the beginning.

original: 'di ltar grang ba dang ldan pa 'ga' zhig me nye par gnyer te de der me'i rang bzhin sreg pa la sogs pa'i don byed pa'i 'brel pa dpyod par byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar grang ba dang ldan pa 'ga' zhig me nye par gnyer te de der me'i rang bzhin sreg pa la sogs pa'i don byed pa'i 'brel pa dpyod par byed do //
translated: In this way, someone who is cold seeks out fire, and he analyzes the connection between the fire and its function of burning, etc.

original: de bzhin du ji ltar me'i phyogs su 'gro ba des ji zhig ltar 'brel pa shes pas thams cad du tshad mas nges par 'dzin pa can 'jug par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du ji ltar me'i phyogs su 'gro ba des ji zhig ltar 'brel pa shes pas thams cad du tshad mas nges par 'dzin pa can 'jug par byed pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, the one who goes to the side of fire, somehow knowing the connection, engages in the activity of apprehending the object by means of a valid cognition.

original: 'on te yang don byed pa ni /
analyzed: 'on te yang don byed pa ni /
translated: But if the object‚Äôs function

original: dus dang rnam pa thams cad du rjes su 'gro ba ma 'khrul pa'i rang bzhin gyis ma yin nam /
analyzed: dus dang rnam pa thams cad du rjes su 'gro ba ma 'khrul pa'i rang bzhin gyis ma yin nam /
translated: is not the nature of something that always and everywhere follows without error,

original: de ji ltar khong du chud par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ji ltar khong du chud par 'gyur te /
translated: how could it be understood?

original: gang du ma 'khrul ba nyams su myong ba de nyid du 'gyur gyi yul la sogs pa gzhan du ni shes pa'i byed pa med pas ji ltar nges pa yin te /
analyzed: gang du ma 'khrul ba nyams su myong ba de nyid du 'gyur gyi yul la sogs pa gzhan du ni shes pa'i byed pa med pas ji ltar nges pa yin te /
translated: It would be just that where non-error is experienced, but there is no activity of consciousness in another place, etc. So how could it be ascertained?

original: gang du don byed pa nyams su myong ba der yang sreg pa la sogs pa 'ba' zhig nyams su myong @303a * //
analyzed: gang du don byed pa nyams su myong ba der yang sreg pa la sogs pa 'ba' zhig nyams su myong @303a * //
translated: Even where the object‚Äôs function is experienced, only burning, etc. is experienced.

original: ba'i phyir / snga ma'i shes pa don byed par mthong bas slu ba med pa nyid ji ltar khong du chud par 'gyur /
analyzed: ba'i phyir / snga ma'i shes pa don byed par mthong bas slu ba med pa nyid ji ltar khong du chud par 'gyur /
translated: How can one understand that the former cognition is nondeceptive, since one sees that it is productive of an object?

original: 'di ltar de'i shes pa 'das pa de'i tshe dgos par rigs pa'i dus na ni med la /
analyzed: 'di ltar de'i shes pa 'das pa de'i tshe dgos par rigs pa'i dus na ni med la /
translated: Thus, when the cognition of that object is required, it does not exist at that time.

original: gang du gzugs dang reg pa'i rig pa dag lhan cig 'byung ba yin pa de'i tshe yang phan tshun log pa'i yul tsam rtogs pa'i phyir tshad mar nges pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang du gzugs dang reg pa'i rig pa dag lhan cig 'byung ba yin pa de'i tshe yang phan tshun log pa'i yul tsam rtogs pa'i phyir tshad mar nges pa ni ma yin no //
translated: And when the cognition of form and the cognition of contact occur together, they are not ascertained as valid cognitions because they merely understand the object that is the reciprocal of the other.

original: 'on te don byed pa'i shes pa rtags las byung ba ni ma yin zhing /
analyzed: 'on te don byed pa'i shes pa rtags las byung ba ni ma yin zhing /
translated: Moreover, the cognition that is productive of an object does not arise from a sign.

original: snga ma'i shes pa tshad mar mngon sum gyis rtogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: snga ma'i shes pa tshad mar mngon sum gyis rtogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Nor is the former cognition ascertained as a valid cognition by direct perception,

original: sngar mthong ba 'das pa'i phyir dang / gsal ba nye bar gyur ba ma gtogs par nar son pa'i tshad ma mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar mthong ba 'das pa'i phyir dang / gsal ba nye bar gyur ba ma gtogs par nar son pa'i tshad ma mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the former perception has passed away and because, except for the clear and present, one does not know the valid cognition of the past.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is it?

original: sreg pa la sogs pa myong bas tshad ma la the tshom za ba bsal to //
analyzed: sreg pa la sogs pa myong bas tshad ma la the tshom za ba bsal to //
translated: The doubt about the validity of the cognition of burning, etc., is removed by the experience.

original: tshad ma ni don med na mi 'byung ba nyid de yang rang nyid las yin no zhe na /
analyzed: tshad ma ni don med na mi 'byung ba nyid de yang rang nyid las yin no zhe na /
translated: A means of valid knowledge is that which does not occur when the object does not exist. And that is from itself.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: the tshom bzlog pa tsam la rtogs pa sngon du 'gro ba dag 'jug pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: the tshom bzlog pa tsam la rtogs pa sngon du 'gro ba dag 'jug pa ni ma yin te /
translated: One does not engage in the mere reversal of doubt, but rather in the prior understanding.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pas so //
analyzed: mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pas so //
translated: By direct perception and inference.

original: de la gal te mngon sum nyid kyis 'jug na de'i tshe mngon sum kho nas tshad mar nges so zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la gal te mngon sum nyid kyis 'jug na de'i tshe mngon sum kho nas tshad mar nges so zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one engages by direct perception alone, then at that time it is taught that one is ascertained by direct perception alone as a means of valid knowledge.

original: de bzhin du rjes su dpag pas kyang nges par gdon mi za bar khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du rjes su dpag pas kyang nges par gdon mi za bar khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: In the same way, one should undoubtedly understand by inference as well.

original: gzhan du na nges pa ma gtogs par the tshom ji ltar ldog par 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan du na nges pa ma gtogs par the tshom ji ltar ldog par 'gyur /
translated: Otherwise, how could doubt be reversed except by ascertainment?

original: gal te yang don bya ba byed pa las the tshom ldog na gdon mi za bar don byed pa rtags yin no //
analyzed: gal te yang don bya ba byed pa las the tshom ldog na gdon mi za bar don byed pa rtags yin no //
translated: And if doubt is reversed from the performance of the function of the object, then undoubtedly the performance of the function of the object is the reason.

original: gang gi phyir sgro btags pa'i the tshom bzlog pa nyid rjes su dpag pa nyid de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sgro btags pa'i the tshom bzlog pa nyid rjes su dpag pa nyid de /
translated: Because the mere reversal of doubt that superimposes is inference itself.

original: der yang 'brel pa nges pa med na med do zhes brjod do //
analyzed: der yang 'brel pa nges pa med na med do zhes brjod do //
translated: And if there is no ascertained relation there, then there is no such thing.

original: de'i phyir tshad ma tha snyad kyis yin no zhes smras te /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshad ma tha snyad kyis yin no zhes smras te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that the valid cognition is conventional.

original: des ni 'di skad du gang 'brel pa 'dzin pa de ni tha snyad du btags pas rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog par 'gyur bar gzhag gi yod pa dang med par gyur pa nyid mngon sum gyis grub pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: des ni 'di skad du gang 'brel pa 'dzin pa de ni tha snyad du btags pas rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog par 'gyur bar gzhag gi yod pa dang med par gyur pa nyid mngon sum gyis grub pa ni ma yin te /
translated: This means that whatever apprehends a relation is posited as having a positive and negative concomitance by means of a conventional designation, but it is not that existence and nonexistence are established by direct perception.

original: de la snga phyi 'jug pa med pas so //üîΩder don byed pa'i shes pa tshad ma ni tha mi dad par don byed pa myong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la snga phyi 'jug pa med pas so // der don byed pa'i shes pa tshad ma ni tha mi dad par don byed pa myong ba'i phyir /
translated: This is because there is no temporal sequence in that.

original: de'i bdag nyid kyi 'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kyi 'brel pa yin no //
translated: In that case, the valid cognition that is the cognition of the functioning object is the relation of identity because it experiences the functioning object without differentiation.

original: gang du shes pa la shin tu brtan par gnas pas nges pa der yang sngar gyi shes pa la gnas pa gang yin pa de nyid don byed pa'i rang bzhin gyis tha snyad pa'i lam 'jug ste /
analyzed: gang du shes pa la shin tu brtan par gnas pas nges pa der yang sngar gyi shes pa la gnas pa gang yin pa de nyid don byed pa'i rang bzhin gyis tha snyad pa'i lam 'jug ste /
translated: And wherever there is a very firm abiding in the cognition, there is also the engagement in the path of the conventional by means of the former abiding in the cognition, which has the nature of functioning objects.

original: des na btags nas de'i bdag @303b nyid ces bya bar ston gyi /
analyzed: des na btags nas de'i bdag @303b nyid ces bya bar ston gyi /
translated: Therefore, it is taught that it is the relation of identity by means of designation.

original: don dam par ni bskyed bya skyed byed kho na'i 'brel pa ste /
analyzed: don dam par ni bskyed bya skyed byed kho na'i 'brel pa ste /
translated: In the ultimate, the relationship is that of producer and produced.

original: sgrub pa dang / don byed pa dag gi phyir tshad ma tha snyad las so zhes bya bar gnas so zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: sgrub pa dang / don byed pa dag gi phyir tshad ma tha snyad las so zhes bya bar gnas so zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: Thus, the treatise is composed for the sake of establishing valid knowledge and for the sake of accomplishing one's goals.

original: gal te de ltar tha snyad kyis tshad mar rnam par 'jog pa yin na de'i bstan bcos kyis ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: gal te de ltar tha snyad kyis tshad mar rnam par 'jog pa yin na de'i bstan bcos kyis ci zhig bya ste /
translated: If valid knowledge is posited conventionally, what is the use of this treatise?

original: 'di ltar bstan bcos kyi bshad pa yang tha snyad las tshad ma khong du chud pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar bstan bcos kyi bshad pa yang tha snyad las tshad ma khong du chud pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: For the explanation of this treatise is for the sake of understanding valid knowledge from the conventional.

original: 'dir bstan bcos rmongs pa zhes smras te /
analyzed: 'dir bstan bcos rmongs pa zhes smras te /
translated: Here, the treatise is called the dispeller of confusion.

original: rmongs pa ni sgro btags pa'o //
analyzed: rmongs pa ni sgro btags pa'o //
translated: Confusion is superimposition.

original: bzlog pa ni 'dis bzlog pa yin no /
analyzed: bzlog pa ni 'dis bzlog pa yin no /
translated: This is the dispeller of that.

original: 'di'i dgongs pa ni gal te tha snyad kyis phyin ci ma log pa'i tshad ma'i rgyur gyur pa'i bstan bcos kyi phan tshun 'gal bar tshad ma'i mtshan nyid bstan pa sel bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i dgongs pa ni gal te tha snyad kyis phyin ci ma log pa'i tshad ma'i rgyur gyur pa'i bstan bcos kyi phan tshun 'gal bar tshad ma'i mtshan nyid bstan pa sel bar byed pa yin te /
translated: The intention is this: If valid knowledge is posited conventionally, the treatise that is the cause of unmistaken valid knowledge dispels the superimposition that the definition of valid knowledge is mutually contradictory.

original: de bas na phyin ci log tu sgro btags pa rnam par bcad pa'i phyir bstan bcos byas so //
analyzed: de bas na phyin ci log tu sgro btags pa rnam par bcad pa'i phyir bstan bcos byas so //
translated: Therefore, the treatise was composed in order to eliminate the superimposition of error.

original: 'on kyang tshad ma'i mtshan nyid bstan bcos las bshad pa la 'bras bu med de /
analyzed: 'on kyang tshad ma'i mtshan nyid bstan bcos las bshad pa la 'bras bu med de /
translated: However, the explanation of the definition of valid cognition in the treatise is fruitless,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung rab nyid las rmongs pa ldog gi gzhan las ni ma yin no zhes bya ba de bsal bar ldog nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung rab nyid las rmongs pa ldog gi gzhan las ni ma yin no zhes bya ba de bsal bar ldog nas /
translated: because it is only the scriptures of the BhagavƒÅn that eliminate confusion, not others.

original: mi shes don gyi gsal byed pa'ang //
analyzed: mi shes don gyi gsal byed pa'ang //
translated: [The definition of valid cognition] is also an elucidator of the meaning for the ignorant.

original: zhes smras so //
analyzed: zhes smras so //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: 'on kyang tshad ma'i mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: 'on kyang tshad ma'i mtshan nyid ni /
translated: However, the definition of valid cognition

original: mi shes don gyi gsal byed 'di yin te /
analyzed: mi shes don gyi gsal byed 'di yin te /
translated: is this elucidator of the meaning for the ignorant.

original: 'dis gsal bar byed bas ma bzung ba'i don 'dzin pa'i shes pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩmi shes pa nyid smos pas der kun rdzob kyi cha shas can gyi shes pa la sogs pa bstsal to //
analyzed: 'dis gsal bar byed bas ma bzung ba'i don 'dzin pa'i shes pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // mi shes pa nyid smos pas der kun rdzob kyi cha shas can gyi shes pa la sogs pa bstsal to //
translated: It is a consciousness that apprehends an object not already apprehended, because it elucidates it.üîΩBy mentioning ignorant, it excludes a consciousness that has a portion of conventional [knowledge].

original: don smos pas ni don med par snang ba dung la ser por shes pa bstsal to //
analyzed: don smos pas ni don med par snang ba dung la ser por shes pa bstsal to //
translated: By mentioning meaning, it excludes a consciousness that appears without an object, such as the cognition of yellow in a conch.

original: gsal byed ces smos pa ni dbang po la sogs pa la de'i gsal bar byed pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal byed ces smos pa ni dbang po la sogs pa la de'i gsal bar byed pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term ‚Äúrevealer‚Äù is mentioned because the sense faculties and so on do not have the nature of revealing.

original: slu ba med pa smos pa ma gtogs par zla ba gnyis mthong bar gyur pa yang tshad mar thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: slu ba med pa smos pa ma gtogs par zla ba gnyis mthong bar gyur pa yang tshad mar thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: If the term ‚Äúnondeceptive‚Äù is omitted, then the perception of two moons would also be a valid cognition.

original: 'o na te don smos pas de gsal ba yin na /
analyzed: 'o na te don smos pas de gsal ba yin na /
translated: If the object is specified, then

original: de la don dang bral ba ji ltar rtogs /
analyzed: de la don dang bral ba ji ltar rtogs /
translated: how can one conceive of that which is devoid of an object?

original: mi slu ba las yin na /
analyzed: mi slu ba las yin na /
translated: If it is due to nondeceptiveness,

original: 'o na de nyid slu ba med pa tshad ma'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de nyid slu ba med pa tshad ma'i mtshan nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then nondeceptiveness itself would be the definition of valid knowledge.

original: de ni bden pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bden pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not so,

original: bsam par bya ba mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam par bya ba mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the object of comprehension is not the definition.

original: gal te bsam par bya ba yang //
analyzed: gal te bsam par bya ba yang //
translated: If the object of comprehension

original: tshad ma'i mtshan nyid mi slu ba nyid yin na /
analyzed: tshad ma'i mtshan nyid mi slu ba nyid yin na /
translated: is the definition of valid knowledge,

original: de'i tshe dngos po la sogs pa yang mtshan nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe dngos po la sogs pa yang mtshan nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: then things and so on would also be the definition.

original: de lta @304a * //
analyzed: de lta @304a * //
translated: Therefore,

original: bas na gang dngos su byung ba de ni mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: bas na gang dngos su byung ba de ni mtshan nyid de /
translated: that which actually occurs is the definition.

original: gzhan du shugs las byung ba ni ma yin no /
analyzed: gzhan du shugs las byung ba ni ma yin no /
translated: But it is not that it is indirectly.

original: ci ste yang dngos po ni tshad ma'i mtshan nyid la mngon sum du grogs byed pa ma yin yang /
analyzed: ci ste yang dngos po ni tshad ma'i mtshan nyid la mngon sum du grogs byed pa ma yin yang /
translated: But if you think that although a thing is not a direct helper of the definition of valid cognition,

original: gzhan nas gzhan du brgyud pa yang yin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gzhan nas gzhan du brgyud pa yang yin pa ma yin nam /
translated: is it not that it is indirectly?

original: dngos po yang tshad ma khong du chud pa la phan 'dogs so zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po yang tshad ma khong du chud pa la phan 'dogs so zhe na /
translated: And that a thing also helps the understanding of valid cognition?

original: de lta na yang mi shes pa'i don smos pas ni gzung ba 'dzin pa'i shes pa bstsal ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de lta na yang mi shes pa'i don smos pas ni gzung ba 'dzin pa'i shes pa bstsal ba yin gyi /
translated: Even so, by mentioning the object of non-error, the apprehension of the object of non-knowledge is excluded,

original: mi slu ba smos pas sel ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mi slu ba smos pas sel ba ni ma yin te /
translated: but it is not excluded by mentioning non-deception,

original: kun rdzob dang / cha shas can la slu ba med pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun rdzob dang / cha shas can la slu ba med pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the deceptive and the non-deceptive are seen in the relative and in the whole.

original: slu ba med pa'i shes pa kho nas de'i don nyid du byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: slu ba med pa'i shes pa kho nas de'i don nyid du byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not that the object of non-deceptive cognition alone is the object of that,

original: gzhan du yang mthong ba dang 'brel pas mi slu ba srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du yang mthong ba dang 'brel pas mi slu ba srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because non-deception is possible even in another, since it is related to seeing.

original: yang na don ni don dam pa la brjod de mi shes pa'i don gsal bar byed pa ni don dam pa rtogs pa la bshad do //
analyzed: yang na don ni don dam pa la brjod de mi shes pa'i don gsal bar byed pa ni don dam pa rtogs pa la bshad do //
translated: Or else, ‚Äúobject‚Äù refers to the ultimate, and ‚Äúclarifying the object‚Äù is explained as the realization of the ultimate.

original: don dam pa ni gnyis su med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: don dam pa ni gnyis su med pa kho na'o //
translated: The ultimate is nondual.

original: phyir rol gyi tshul la yang 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi shes pa ni /
analyzed: phyir rol gyi tshul la yang 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi shes pa ni /
translated: In the system of the opponent, the knowledge of the four noble truths

original: don dam pa'i tshad ma'i mtshan nyid du brjod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam pa'i tshad ma'i mtshan nyid du brjod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: is not described as the definition of valid knowledge in regard to the ultimate.

original: gzhan gyi ni kun rdzob yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ni kun rdzob yin no //
translated: The opponent‚Äôs position is that the ultimate is a conventional object.

original: gal te mi shes pa nyid kyi don gsal ba tshad ma yin na ni spyi'i shes pa ste /
analyzed: gal te mi shes pa nyid kyi don gsal ba tshad ma yin na ni spyi'i shes pa ste /
translated: If the clarification of the object that is not known were valid knowledge, then the knowledge of universals,

original: rigs la sogs pa'i shes pa yang /
analyzed: rigs la sogs pa'i shes pa yang /
translated: such as the knowledge of the class of phenomena,

original: gtod par byed pa'i shes pas ma mthong ba mthong ba'i phyir tshad mar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gtod par byed pa'i shes pas ma mthong ba mthong ba'i phyir tshad mar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: would also be valid knowledge, because the knowledge that is directed toward the object sees what was not seen by the knowledge that is directed toward the object.üîΩIt cannot be said that the knowledge of the class of phenomena is memory, because the knowledge that is directed toward the object does not realize the class of phenomena.

original: de'i shes pa ni dran pa'o zhes brjod par mi nus te gtod ba'i shes pas rigs ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes pa de bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i shes pa ni dran pa'o zhes brjod par mi nus te gtod ba'i shes pas rigs ma rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes pa de bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate this, it is said:

original: rang gi ngo bo rtogs las gzhan //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo rtogs las gzhan //
translated: Apart from the realization of its own nature,

original: spyi yi shes pa'ang thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: spyi yi shes pa'ang thob par 'gyur //
translated: And also obtain knowledge of universals.

original: zhes smos pa la /
analyzed: zhes smos pa la /
translated: In response to that,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis rang gi ngo bo rtogs pa las gzhan te dus phyis spyi'i yul gyi shes pa skye ba dang yin pa'i shes pa de tshad mar thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar 'brel to zhe na /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis rang gi ngo bo rtogs pa las gzhan te dus phyis spyi'i yul gyi shes pa skye ba dang yin pa'i shes pa de tshad mar thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar 'brel to zhe na /
translated: it is connected to the statement: ‚ÄúThe knowledge of a universal object that arises later, which is different from the knowledge of the intrinsic reality of an object by way of its own characteristics, is obtained as valid knowledge.‚Äù

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: rang gi mtshan nyid mi shes na //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid mi shes na //
translated: If one does not know the object‚Äôs own characteristics,

original: shes pa gang yin bsams pa las //
analyzed: shes pa gang yin bsams pa las //
translated: what is the knowledge that is thought?

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: In response to that,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid mi shes pa shes pa ni don byed pa'i shes pa skyes pa gang yin pa de tshad ma yin no zhes bya bar bsams nas /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid mi shes pa shes pa ni don byed pa'i shes pa skyes pa gang yin pa de tshad ma yin no zhes bya bar bsams nas /
translated: it is thought that the knowledge that does not know the object‚Äôs own characteristics is the knowledge that produces the object‚Äôs function and that is valid knowledge.

original: spyi'i shes pa ni tshad mar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar snyegs so //
analyzed: spyi'i shes pa ni tshad mar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar snyegs so //
translated: The implication is that knowledge of a universal does not become valid knowledge.

original: gtod par byed pa'i shes pas khong du chud pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni spyi'i shes pas ma @304b rtogs pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: gtod par byed pa'i shes pas khong du chud pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni spyi'i shes pas ma @304b rtogs pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: Because the knowledge that ascertains does not comprehend the object‚Äôs own characteristics, it is not valid knowledge.

original: spyi snga na med pa 'dzin pa'i phyir ma yin nam /
analyzed: spyi snga na med pa 'dzin pa'i phyir ma yin nam /
translated: Is it not because it apprehends a universal that has not existed previously?

original: ci ste tshad ma ma yin na /
analyzed: ci ste tshad ma ma yin na /
translated: If it is not a valid cognition,

original: khong du chud pa'i mtshan nyid 'dzin pa ni gnod pa'i shes pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khong du chud pa'i mtshan nyid 'dzin pa ni gnod pa'i shes pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: then the apprehension of the characteristic of understanding is free from the cognition of harm.

original: de lta na mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: de lta na mtshan nyid ni /
translated: In that case, the characteristic

original: de la sngon med don shes pa //
analyzed: de la sngon med don shes pa //
translated: is ascertained as the cognition of a previously non-existent object,

original: nges te gnod pa spangs ba dang // skyon med pa las skyes pa ni //
analyzed: nges te gnod pa spangs ba dang // skyon med pa las skyes pa ni //
translated: free from harm, and arisen from a faultless cause.

original: tshad mar 'jig rten pa 'dod do //
analyzed: tshad mar 'jig rten pa 'dod do //
translated: The world accepts this as valid cognition.

original: zhes zer ba de 'dir bzlog par bya ba'i phyir /üîΩrang gi mtshan nyid dpyad phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes zer ba de 'dir bzlog par bya ba'i phyir / rang gi mtshan nyid dpyad phyir ro //
translated: In order to refute that here,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: it is said: Because of analyzing its own characteristic.

original: yod pa nyid dang / med pa nyid kyi gzhal bya mthong ba'i shes pa ni tshad mar brjod do //
analyzed: yod pa nyid dang / med pa nyid kyi gzhal bya mthong ba'i shes pa ni tshad mar brjod do //
translated: The cognition that sees the object of existence and non-existence is called valid cognition.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid la yod pa nyid dang / med pa nyid dpyod de /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid la yod pa nyid dang / med pa nyid dpyod de /
translated: It analyzes existence and non-existence in terms of its own characteristic,

original: don byed pa sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don byed pa sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it establishes the performance of an object's function.

original: spyi la ni sreg pa la sogs pa'i byed pa dang bral ba'i phyir des tshad ma la phan 'dogs pa med do //üîΩspyi'i shes pa ni sngar med pa'i don bzung ba las tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: spyi la ni sreg pa la sogs pa'i byed pa dang bral ba'i phyir des tshad ma la phan 'dogs pa med do // spyi'i shes pa ni sngar med pa'i don bzung ba las tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: But the universal is not a basis for valid cognition, because it is devoid of the activity of burning, etc.

original: thal ches pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: thal ches pa'i phyir te /
translated: The cognition of the universal is not a valid cognition, because it apprehends an object that was not previously perceived.üîΩThis is absurd,

original: 'di ltar zla ba gnyis su mthong ba yang sngar med pa 'dzin pas tshad mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar zla ba gnyis su mthong ba yang sngar med pa 'dzin pas tshad mar 'gyur ro //
translated: because even the perception of two moons would be a valid cognition, since it apprehends something that was not previously perceived.

original: 'on te de la gnod pa mthong bas tshad ma ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te de la gnod pa mthong bas tshad ma ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that it is not a valid cognition because it is contradicted,

original: 'on na ni gnod pa can gyis kyang don byed pa'i dngos po dang bral ba shes par byed pa'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid rten par dpyod do //
analyzed: 'on na ni gnod pa can gyis kyang don byed pa'i dngos po dang bral ba shes par byed pa'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid rten par dpyod do //
translated: then, since the contradictory cognition also makes one understand that the object is devoid of the capacity to perform a function, it would be a valid cognition with regard to the particular.

original: de lta ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de lta ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is true,

original: spyi'i shes pa ni de nyid 'di yin no zhes nges pas rang gi mtshan nyid la 'jug go zhe na /
analyzed: spyi'i shes pa ni de nyid 'di yin no zhes nges pas rang gi mtshan nyid la 'jug go zhe na /
translated: but the cognition of the universal engages the particular, because it ascertains that this is just that.

original: ci zhig ltar spyi'i zhe na pa ma gtogs par mthong ba nyid las 'jug pa yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: ci zhig ltar spyi'i zhe na pa ma gtogs par mthong ba nyid las 'jug pa yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: How is it that, apart from the cognition of the universal, there is no engagement of the particular?

original: mthong ba las ma gtogs par ni spyi'i shes pas mi 'jug pa'i phyir mthong ba nyid tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba las ma gtogs par ni spyi'i shes pas mi 'jug pa'i phyir mthong ba nyid tshad ma yin no //
translated: Because it is not engaged by a cognition of the universal, the seeing itself is the valid cognition.

original: gzhan yang spyi'i shes pa rigs la 'jug par 'gyur ram /
analyzed: gzhan yang spyi'i shes pa rigs la 'jug par 'gyur ram /
translated: Moreover, is the cognition of the universal engaged with the class or

original: rang gi mtshan nyid la yin /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid la yin /
translated: with the particular?

original: de la / de rigs la ni ma yin te //
analyzed: de la / de rigs la ni ma yin te //
translated: It is not with the class,

original: spyi yi dgos pa shes pa dang // brjod pa ni rang gi rtogs pa tsam du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi yi dgos pa shes pa dang // brjod pa ni rang gi rtogs pa tsam du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the purpose of the universal is the cognition and the expression of it, which are merely one‚Äôs own understanding.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid la yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid la yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it with the particular,

original: de gtod par byed pa'i shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gtod par byed pa'i shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the object of the cognition that is directed to it.

original: 'on te spyi'i shes pa'i yul rang gi mtshan nyid yin na /
analyzed: 'on te spyi'i shes pa'i yul rang gi mtshan nyid yin na /
translated: But if the object of the cognition of the universal is the particular,

original: de lta mod kyi gzung ba 'dzin pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin te dag par mthong ba'i shas pa nyid spyi dang ldan par khyod 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta mod kyi gzung ba 'dzin pa'i phyir tshad ma ma yin te dag par mthong ba'i shas pa nyid spyi dang ldan par khyod 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then, even though it is so, it is not a valid cognition because it apprehends the universal, which you accept as being seen clearly.

original: de ltar yang rnam par mi rtog pa'i blos /üîΩdngos po gnyis @305a * //
analyzed: de ltar yang rnam par mi rtog pa'i blos / dngos po gnyis @305a * //
translated: Thus, the nonconceptual cognitionüîΩdoes not apprehend the two things,

original: su yang 'dzin pa yin zhes smras so //
analyzed: su yang 'dzin pa yin zhes smras so //
translated: the object and the cognition of the object.

original: gang gi tshe yang don dam pa'i tshad ma'i mtshan nyid du 'dod pa de'i tshe rang rig pa'i ngo bo nyid khong du chud pa las de las gzhan pa'i spyi gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa ni mngon par zhen pa ni yang dag par rig par khong du ma chud pa ni gzung ba dang /üîΩ'dzin pa len pa'i phyir tshad mar 'gyur bar blta bar bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe yang don dam pa'i tshad ma'i mtshan nyid du 'dod pa de'i tshe rang rig pa'i ngo bo nyid khong du chud pa las de las gzhan pa'i spyi gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa ni mngon par zhen pa ni yang dag par rig par khong du ma chud pa ni gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa len pa'i phyir tshad mar 'gyur bar blta bar bya'o zhe na /
translated: When you assert that the definition of valid knowledge is ultimate, then at that time, other than comprehending the nature of reflexive awareness, you should view the apprehension of a generality and the conception of subject and object as valid knowledge because they apprehend subject and object.üîΩBut if you assert that the definition of valid knowledge is conventional, then at that time, other than comprehending the nature of reflexive awareness, you should view the apprehension of a generality and the conception of subject and object as invalid knowledge because they apprehend subject and object.

original: shes pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid mi shes par shes par shes pa gang mngon du 'dzin pa de ni tshad ma ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs pas 'dzin pa la sogs par 'byung ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid mi shes par shes par shes pa gang mngon du 'dzin pa de ni tshad ma ma yin no zhes bya bar dgongs pas 'dzin pa la sogs par 'byung ba ni ma yin no //
translated: But this is not the intention of the treatise because it is not the case that the arising of the conception of subject and object is invalid knowledge.

original: 'o na ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis phyi rol gyi don gsung ba mdzad ce na /üîΩgdul bya'i skye bo'i dor phyir rol gyi don la mngon par zhen pa gzung bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis phyi rol gyi don gsung ba mdzad ce na / gdul bya'i skye bo'i dor phyir rol gyi don la mngon par zhen pa gzung bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: But if that is so, how could the Bhagavat teach external objects?üîΩHe taught external objects in order to lead trainees who are attached to external objects to the apprehension of objects.

original: phyi rol gyi don du bstan te /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don du bstan te /
translated: He taught external objects in order to lead trainees who are attached to external objects to the apprehension of objects.

original: don dam pa la ni gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa dang bral bas rang rig pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: don dam pa la ni gzung ba dang / 'dzin pa dang bral bas rang rig pa nyid yin no //
translated: But in the ultimate sense, it is self-cognition, because it is free from the grasped and the grasper.

original: de nyid gang las shes she na //
analyzed: de nyid gang las shes she na //
translated: From what is it known?

original: rang gi mtshan nyid dpyad pa las te /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid dpyad pa las te /
translated: From the examination of its own characteristic.

original: dpyad nas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po thams cad nyams par 'gyur bas gnyis su med do //
analyzed: dpyad nas gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po thams cad nyams par 'gyur bas gnyis su med do //
translated: Having examined, all things of the grasped and the grasper are lost, and so there is no duality.
