original: de nyid gnyis su med par dpyad pa'i phyir gsung rab ma lus pa la 'jug par bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid gnyis su med par dpyad pa'i phyir gsung rab ma lus pa la 'jug par bya ste /
translated: In order to examine that very non-duality, one should enter into all the scriptures.

original: phyi rol gyi don lhag par bshad pa ni drang ba'i don nyid do //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don lhag par bshad pa ni drang ba'i don nyid do //

analyzed: dper na me yis bskyed pa'i du ba me ma rtogs par skye ba ma yin te /

original: 'bras bu nyid ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu nyid ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that it is not an effect.

original: de bzhin du dbyibs ni ji ltar sems ma rtogs par 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du dbyibs ni ji ltar sems ma rtogs par 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: In the same way, how could shape arise without the mind being known?

original: 'dir de bzlog pa'i phyir /üîΩbyin rlob yod med rjes 'jug can //üîΩbkod sogs ci 'dra bar grub la //
analyzed: 'dir de bzlog pa'i phyir / byin rlob yod med rjes 'jug can // bkod sogs ci 'dra bar grub la //
translated: Here, in order to refute that, it is said:üîΩThe existence or non-existence of supernormal knowledge is inferred from the shape, etc.

original: de la rjes su dpog gang yin //
analyzed: de la rjes su dpog gang yin //
translated: How is it established?

original: de ni rigs pa nyid yin no //üîΩzhes bya ba la 'bras bu nyid tsam mam /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa nyid yin no // zhes bya ba la 'bras bu nyid tsam mam /
translated: That is precisely the reasoning.

original: dbyibs nyid tsam gyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dbyibs nyid tsam gyis ni ma yin te /
translated: Here, it is not merely the effect itself or merely the shape,

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i rgyu mtshan rtogs pa'i rtags med na ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i rgyu mtshan rtogs pa'i rtags med na ma yin no //
translated: but without the sign of understanding the intended reason, it is not.

original: 'on kyang bkod pa la sogs pa ci 'dra bar nges pa ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang bkod pa la sogs pa ci 'dra bar nges pa ste /
translated: However, it is ascertained as to what kind of arrangement, etc. there is.

original: 'bras bu ni byin gyis rlob pa yod pa dang med ba dag gi rjes su 'jug cing rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa la rag las pa ste de dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni byin gyis rlob pa yod pa dang med ba dag gi rjes su 'jug cing rjes su 'gro ba dang / ldog pa la rag las pa ste de dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The effect is that which is dependent on the presence or absence of the consecration, and which follows and conforms to it, and is dependent on its cessation.

original: de bas na bkod pa la sogs pa nges pa las gang blo dang ldan pa'i rgyu sngon du song ba nyid yang thog la sogs pa la rjes su dpog pa de ni rigs pa ste mdzes pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na bkod pa la sogs pa nges pa las gang blo dang ldan pa'i rgyu sngon du song ba nyid yang thog la sogs pa la rjes su dpog pa de ni rigs pa ste mdzes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable and fitting that the intelligent should infer the prior existence of a cause in the case of a mansion, etc.,

original: 'di ltar don byed par ma mthong bar yang /
analyzed: 'di ltar don byed par ma mthong bar yang /
translated: For, even though one does not see the performance of an action,

original: yang thog la sogs pa mthong ba'i phyir blo yis byas pa yin par dpag gi //
analyzed: yang thog la sogs pa mthong ba'i phyir blo yis byas pa yin par dpag gi //
translated: one infers that it is the work of an intelligent agent because of seeing the mansion, etc.

original: ri la sogs pa'i dbyibs kyi khyad par yod pa ni sems kyis bskyed pa nyid du mthong ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ri la sogs pa'i dbyibs kyi khyad par yod pa ni sems kyis bskyed pa nyid du mthong ba ni ma yin no //
translated: But one does not see the existence of a configuration of a mountain, etc., as the product of an intelligent agent.

original: de lta ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de lta ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is true, but

original: gang gi phyir ri la sogs pa'i dbyibs mthong bar gyur kyang /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ri la sogs pa'i dbyibs mthong bar gyur kyang /
translated: even though one sees the configuration of a mountain, etc.,

original: sems kyis bskyed pa nyid du nges par 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sems kyis bskyed pa nyid du nges par 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
translated: one does not ascertain that it is the product of an intelligent agent.

original: de lta bas na bsgrub par bya ba ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na bsgrub par bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore, the object to be established is like the following example.

original: dper na yod pa'i don mthong yang /
analyzed: dper na yod pa'i don mthong yang /
translated: For example, although one sees an existent object,

original: mi rtag pa nyid du ma nges pas rjes su dpog pa bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid du ma nges pas rjes su dpog pa bzhin no zhe na /
translated: one does not ascertain impermanence, and so one infers.

original: @309a * // yod pa la sogs pa'i rtags nges pa ni 'brel pa nges par 'dzin pa med pa las mi rtag pa la sogs pa nges pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'dir 'khrul par rigs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: @309a * // yod pa la sogs pa'i rtags nges pa ni 'brel pa nges par 'dzin pa med pa las mi rtag pa la sogs pa nges pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'dir 'khrul par rigs pa ma yin nam /
translated: If the ascertainment of the reason such as existence does not depend on the ascertainment of the relation, then impermanence and so on are not ascertained. So is it not reasonable to be mistaken here?

original: 'di ni ra la sogs pa'i dbyibs rigs pa la blo dang ldan pa'i rgyu med na mi 'byung pa dbyibs kyi khyad par dran par yod na ci'i phyir rjes su dpog pa 'byung ba ma yin /
analyzed: 'di ni ra la sogs pa'i dbyibs rigs pa la blo dang ldan pa'i rgyu med na mi 'byung pa dbyibs kyi khyad par dran par yod na ci'i phyir rjes su dpog pa 'byung ba ma yin /
translated: If the memory of the specific shape of a cow and so on exists, why does inference not arise in the absence of the cause of the intelligent one?

original: tshig gis kyang tshul gsum dran par byed de de ni sngon du yod par nges pa 'gro na /
analyzed: tshig gis kyang tshul gsum dran par byed de de ni sngon du yod par nges pa 'gro na /
translated: Words also remind one of the three modes, and if it is ascertained that they exist prior to that,

original: de yod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de yod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: then they do not exist.

original: dbyibs kyi khyad par ni byed pa po med par 'byung pas ma grub po //
analyzed: dbyibs kyi khyad par ni byed pa po med par 'byung pas ma grub po //
translated: The specific shape arises without an agent, so it is not established.

original: de dag gi ni dbyibs kyi khyad par rtags ma yin par bstan no //
analyzed: de dag gi ni dbyibs kyi khyad par rtags ma yin par bstan no //
translated: The specific shape of those is not the reason.üîΩEven though that is so, if the general shape, which is devoid of the specific, exists as the reason, then the specific is not the reason, because it is devoid of the pervasion.

original: de ltar 'gyur mod kyi khyad par spangs pa'i spyi dbyibs kyi rtags yod na khyad par ni rtags ma yin pa'i phyir te rjes su 'gro ba dang bral bas so snyam du sems na de'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur mod kyi khyad par spangs pa'i spyi dbyibs kyi rtags yod na khyad par ni rtags ma yin pa'i phyir te rjes su 'gro ba dang bral bas so snyam du sems na de'i phyir /
translated: If you think that, then to respond to that, it says:

original: dngos tha dad la rab grub pa //
analyzed: dngos tha dad la rab grub pa //
translated: The general reason is well established

original: sgra mtshungs pas tha dad med phyir //
analyzed: sgra mtshungs pas tha dad med phyir //
translated: for different things, because of the absence of difference due to the similarity of the word.

original: rjes dpog rigs pa ma yin te //
analyzed: rjes dpog rigs pa ma yin te //
translated: Inference is not reasonable

original: rdzas sngon po las me dpog bzhin //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rdzas sngon po las me dpog bzhin // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: like inferring fire from a previous substance.

original: spyi'i rtags de nyid kyang pa sgrub bya med na mi 'byung ba dang / 'brel pa med pas yang dngos po tha dad pa la ste /
analyzed: spyi'i rtags de nyid kyang pa sgrub bya med na mi 'byung ba dang / 'brel pa med pas yang dngos po tha dad pa la ste /
translated: That general reason is also established for different things, because of the absence of a connection with the absence of the object of affirmation.

original: yod pa'i khyad par bum pa la sogs pa la sems las skyes par grub kyi /
analyzed: yod pa'i khyad par bum pa la sogs pa la sems las skyes par grub kyi /
translated: The difference of existence, such as a pot, is established as being produced from mind.

original: ri la sogs pa la rjes su dpog pa ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ri la sogs pa la rjes su dpog pa ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is not reasonable to infer that a mountain and so on is produced from mind.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sgra mtshungs pa ste /
analyzed: sgra mtshungs pa ste /
translated: Because of the similarity of the word.

original: mngon par brjod pa mtshungs pas gang tha mi dad pa ni rnam pa gcig tu shes pa ste dbyibs mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par brjod pa mtshungs pas gang tha mi dad pa ni rnam pa gcig tu shes pa ste dbyibs mtshungs pa'o //
translated: The cognition of a single aspect is the cognition of a single shape, by reason of the similarity of the verbal expression.

original: de ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: dper na sngon por mtshungs pa'i rdzas ni me dpog pa'i rtags ma yin te /
analyzed: dper na sngon por mtshungs pa'i rdzas ni me dpog pa'i rtags ma yin te /
translated: A substance similar to blue is not a reason for inferring fire.

original: me nges par 'dod pa la sngon po'i khyad par nges par gzung bar byas na me med na mi 'byung ba'i dngos po nyid gang yin pa de rtogs par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: me nges par 'dod pa la sngon po'i khyad par nges par gzung bar byas na me med na mi 'byung ba'i dngos po nyid gang yin pa de rtogs par byed pa yin no //
translated: But if one takes into account the particular, blue, which is certainly perceived when fire is perceived, then the fact of being invariably concomitant with fire is established.

original: sngon po nyid tsam mtshungs pa ni khang pa skya bo la 'ang yod pa'i phyir rtogs par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sngon po nyid tsam mtshungs pa ni khang pa skya bo la 'ang yod pa'i phyir rtogs par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: The mere similarity of blue is not a reason for inferring fire, for a white house can also be blue.

original: rdzas sngon po la mi rjes su dpog pa la gnod pa yod de /
analyzed: rdzas sngon po la mi rjes su dpog pa la gnod pa yod de /
translated: But the substance blue is not a reason for inferring fire, for there is an obstacle.

original: de dang 'gal ba'i mkhar skya bo la sogs pa mthong ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba'i mkhar skya bo la sogs pa mthong ba ma yin nam /
translated: Has one not seen a white house, which is not blue, but which is similar to the blue substance?

original: dbyibs mtshungs pa 'di la sems las skyes pa nyid du dpog pa la gnod pa ma mthong ba'i phyir de ji ltar rjes su dpog pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: dbyibs mtshungs pa 'di la sems las skyes pa nyid du dpog pa la gnod pa ma mthong ba'i phyir de ji ltar rjes su dpog pa yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it that you do not see a contradiction in inferring that the shape of a mound is produced by mind?

original: 'dir smras pa /üîΩde lta min na rdza mkhan @309b gyis //üîΩbum pa la sogs 'jim pa yi //
analyzed: 'dir smras pa / de lta min na rdza mkhan @309b gyis // bum pa la sogs 'jim pa yi //
translated: Here we say:üîΩIf it were not so,üîΩthen because a potter makes some change in clay,

original: 'gyur ba 'ga' zhig byed pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'gyur ba 'ga' zhig byed pa'i phyir //
translated: a mound would be produced by a potter.

original: grog mkhar yang byas des grub 'gyur //üîΩgnod pa med pa nyid kyis rjes su dpog pa skye ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: grog mkhar yang byas des grub 'gyur // gnod pa med pa nyid kyis rjes su dpog pa skye ba ni ma yin te /
translated: That would be established by that.

original: 'on kyang 'brel pa nges pa las so //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'brel pa nges pa las so //
translated: Inference does not arise from the mere absence of contradiction, but from the ascertainment of a connection.

original: gzhan du 'brel pa nges pa ma gtogs par dbyibs mtshungs pa las sems kyis byas pa nyid du rjes su dpog na /
analyzed: gzhan du 'brel pa nges pa ma gtogs par dbyibs mtshungs pa las sems kyis byas pa nyid du rjes su dpog na /
translated: Otherwise, if you infer that a mound is produced by mind from the similarity of shape, without ascertaining a connection,

original: rdza mkhan gyis 'ga' zhig tu 'jim pa'i 'gyur ba bum pa la sogs pa byas pa na grogs mkhar la rdza mkhan gyis bum pa bzhin byas par dpog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rdza mkhan gyis 'ga' zhig tu 'jim pa'i 'gyur ba bum pa la sogs pa byas pa na grogs mkhar la rdza mkhan gyis bum pa bzhin byas par dpog par 'gyur te /
translated: then when a potter makes some change in clay, such as a pot, you would infer that a mound is produced by a potter, like a pot.

original: 'jim pa'i 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jim pa'i 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is a change in clay.

original: 'di snyam du dgongs te grog mkhar la rdza mkhan gyis bskyed pa nyid la gnod pa ma mthong bas rjes su dpag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di snyam du dgongs te grog mkhar la rdza mkhan gyis bskyed pa nyid la gnod pa ma mthong bas rjes su dpag par 'gyur ro //
translated: The master thinks this and says: ‚ÄúSince we do not see any harm in the inference that an anthill is generated by an artisan,

original: rdza mkhan gyis byas pa las byung bar ma mthong ba nyid gnod pa can ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: rdza mkhan gyis byas pa las byung bar ma mthong ba nyid gnod pa can ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: is it not the case that we do not see any harm in the inference that a tree is generated by God?‚Äù

original: de lta mod kyi /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi /
translated: This is so,

original: 'on kyang ljon shing la sogs pa sems las byung ba nyid du ma dmigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on kyang ljon shing la sogs pa sems las byung ba nyid du ma dmigs pa'i phyir /
translated: but since we do not see that trees and so on arise from mind,

original: dbang phyug gis byas pa nyid la ji ltar gnod pa med pa yin /
analyzed: dbang phyug gis byas pa nyid la ji ltar gnod pa med pa yin /
translated: how can we not see any harm in the inference that they are created by God?

original: de lta na 'o na ni dmigs par ma gyur pa'i las kyis kyang ji ltar nus pa yin zhe na /üîΩ'gro ba sna tshogs par mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ni dmigs par ma gyur pa'i las kyis kyang ji ltar nus pa yin zhe na / 'gro ba sna tshogs par mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: If that is so, then how can we infer the existence of karma that is not observed?

original: las yod par bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: las yod par bshad par bya'o //
translated: We can explain that karma exists because we see the variety of migrating beings.

original: de'i phyir dbyibs mtshungs pa ni rtags ma yin te 'brel ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: de'i phyir dbyibs mtshungs pa ni rtags ma yin te 'brel ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: Therefore, shape is not a logical reason for God‚Äôs existence because it is not related to God.

original: 'di ni 'bras bu dang mtshungs pa'i ltag chod ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'di ni 'bras bu dang mtshungs pa'i ltag chod ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt this a sophistry that is similar to the consequence of the opponent?

original: dper na brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba nyid du rtogs pa 'di ci ste brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba dngos po yin nam /
analyzed: dper na brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba nyid du rtogs pa 'di ci ste brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba dngos po yin nam /
translated: For example, if you realize that something arises as soon as it is sought, is that arising as soon as it is sought a thing?

original: 'on te shes pa yin /
analyzed: 'on te shes pa yin /
translated: For example, if you think that the self is realized to be that which arises immediately upon the exertion of effort, is that which arises immediately upon the exertion of effort a thing or is it consciousness?

original: de la brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba dngos po yin na ni ma grub pa ste /
analyzed: de la brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba dngos po yin na ni ma grub pa ste /
translated: If it is a thing, it is not established.

original: rtag pa nyid du khas blangs pa las rgyu yod pa dang ldan pa ni rtag pa'o zhes smras pas so //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid du khas blangs pa las rgyu yod pa dang ldan pa ni rtag pa'o zhes smras pas so //
translated: Because you have accepted that it is permanent, and you have said that that which possesses a cause is impermanent.

original: 'on te gsal bar byas pas ni brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba nyid yin pa de lta na yang mi rtag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te gsal bar byas pas ni brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba nyid yin pa de lta na yang mi rtag pa ma yin te /
translated: But if it is the manifestation of that which arises immediately upon the exertion of effort, then it is not impermanent,

original: rtsol bas yod pa nyid du gsal bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsol bas yod pa nyid du gsal bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the exertion manifests its existence.

original: ji ltar sgron mas bum pa gsal bar byed pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar sgron mas bum pa gsal bar byed pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like a lamp manifesting a pot.

original: de bzhin du dbyibs kyi khyad par 'dir yang yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du dbyibs kyi khyad par 'dir yang yin te /
translated: In the same way, the particular shape is here.

original: ci bum pa la yod pa'i dbyibs yin nam /
analyzed: ci bum pa la yod pa'i dbyibs yin nam /
translated: But if you think that the shape exists in the pot,

original: 'on te sa la sogs pa'i yin zhes rtogs pa ni 'bras bu dang mtshungs pa'i ltag chod yin @310a * //üîΩno zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te sa la sogs pa'i yin zhes rtogs pa ni 'bras bu dang mtshungs pa'i ltag chod yin @310a * //üîΩno zhe na /
translated: or in earth and so on, this is a futile rejoinder similar to the conclusion.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, it is said:

original: bsgrub bya'i rjes 'gro phyir 'bras bu //
analyzed: bsgrub bya'i rjes 'gro phyir 'bras bu //
translated: Because it follows the object of attainment, it is the result.

original: spyis kyang sgrub par byed yin na //
analyzed: spyis kyang sgrub par byed yin na //
translated: Even the general is the proof.

original: 'brel pa can ni tha dad pas //
analyzed: 'brel pa can ni tha dad pas //
translated: Because the related is different,

original: tha dad skyon brjod 'bras mtshungs 'dod //
analyzed: tha dad skyon brjod 'bras mtshungs 'dod //
translated: The fault of being different is said to be the same as the result.

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: Here it is said:

original: spyis kyang rtsol ba las byung ba'i 'bras bu byed kyi yul la skyon gang yin pa de ni 'bras bu mtshungs par 'dod do //
analyzed: spyis kyang rtsol ba las byung ba'i 'bras bu byed kyi yul la skyon gang yin pa de ni 'bras bu mtshungs par 'dod do //
translated: Even the general is the result that arises from effort. Whatever fault there is in the object, that is said to be the same as the result.

original: skyon ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: skyon ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What kind of fault?

original: tha dad par brjod pa'i skyon te /
analyzed: tha dad par brjod pa'i skyon te /
translated: The fault of being expressed as different.

original: tha dad par brjod pa ni bkod pa ste /üîΩ'bras bu zhes bya ba ci mngon par gsal ba la gnas pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: tha dad par brjod pa ni bkod pa ste / 'bras bu zhes bya ba ci mngon par gsal ba la gnas pa ma yin nam /
translated: Being expressed as different is the arrangement.

original: 'on te skye ba la gnas pa yin zhes 'brel pa can tha dad pa las tha dad par brjod pa'i skyon gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: 'on te skye ba la gnas pa yin zhes 'brel pa can tha dad pa las tha dad par brjod pa'i skyon gang yin pa de ni /
translated: Is the so-called result based on manifestation, or is it based on arising? Whatever fault there is in expressing the related as different, that is said to be the same as the result.

original: 'bras bu mtshungs par 'dod kyi yang dag pa'i skyon ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu mtshungs par 'dod kyi yang dag pa'i skyon ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the fault of reality.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bsgrub bya'i ste /
analyzed: bsgrub bya'i ste /
translated: Because of the object of attainment.

original: mi rtag pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir te khyab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir te khyab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is pervaded by impermanence.

original: 'di'i don ni 'bras bu rtsol ba las byung ba nyid ni gal te skya ba la gnas sam mngon par gsal ba la gnas pa de lta na yang rtsol ba'i de ma thag tu byung ba nyid spyir rtag pa la mi srid do //
analyzed: 'di'i don ni 'bras bu rtsol ba las byung ba nyid ni gal te skya ba la gnas sam mngon par gsal ba la gnas pa de lta na yang rtsol ba'i de ma thag tu byung ba nyid spyir rtag pa la mi srid do //
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: If the effect arises from exertion, whether it is in the process of arising or has already arisen, in general, it is impossible for it to be permanent.

original: ji ltar yang rtag pa dang 'gal ba'i rtsol ba las byung ba nyid ji lta ba de bzhin du le'u bzhi pa las rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar yang rtag pa dang 'gal ba'i rtsol ba las byung ba nyid ji lta ba de bzhin du le'u bzhi pa las rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Just as it is, in general, impossible for it to be permanent, in the same way, it is impossible for it to be permanent and to arise from exertion, which is incompatible with permanence. This should be understood from the fourth chapter.

original: de lta bas na spyi gzung ba'i rtsol ba las byung ba nyid 'brel pa tha dad pas /
analyzed: de lta bas na spyi gzung ba'i rtsol ba las byung ba nyid 'brel pa tha dad pas /
translated: Thus, the fact that the universal is produced by the exertion of apprehending it is a different relation than the relation of the universal and the particulars.

original: tha dad pas brjod pa ni ltag chod nyid yin te /
analyzed: tha dad pas brjod pa ni ltag chod nyid yin te /
translated: Therefore, the statement that they are different is just nonsense.

original: gal te yang rtsol ba las byung ba'i shes pa dang rtag pa la sogs pa 'gal ba med ba de'i tshe ma nges pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gal te yang rtsol ba las byung ba'i shes pa dang rtag pa la sogs pa 'gal ba med ba de'i tshe ma nges pa nyid yin no //
translated: Moreover, if there is no contradiction between the cognition produced by exertion and permanence, then it is indeterminate.

original: gal te blo sngon du byed pa'i rjes su 'gro ba'i shes pa yod pa ni ma yin pa de lta na yang dbyibs kyi sgra brjod par bya ba nyid kyi rjes su 'gro ba nyid de /

translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes water, etc., and they are the causes of the generation of the sprout, etc.

original: rang bzhin ma gyur pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin ma gyur pa ni ma yin te /
translated: They are not causes without changing their nature.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sa la sogs pa de sbyangs pa na /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa de sbyangs pa na /
translated: When the earth, etc. are refined,

original: 'bras s'a lu la sogs pa btab na /
analyzed: 'bras s'a lu la sogs pa btab na /
translated: if rice, etc. are planted,

original: myu gu'i khyad par gzhan dang / gzhan gyi rang bzhin mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: myu gu'i khyad par gzhan dang / gzhan gyi rang bzhin mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: the special features of the sprouts are seen to be different, and different in nature.

original: gal te sa la sogs pa ma gyur pa nyid myu gu'i rgyu yin na de'i khyad par la ltos pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te sa la sogs pa ma gyur pa nyid myu gu'i rgyu yin na de'i khyad par la ltos pa ma yin no //
translated: If the earth, etc. were not transformed, they would not be the cause of the sprout, and would not depend on its special features.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: ji ltar yul dad dbang po yis //
analyzed: ji ltar yul dad dbang po yis //
translated: Just as the collection of object and sense faculty

original: tshogs pa khyad med blo rgyu yin //
analyzed: tshogs pa khyad med blo rgyu yin //
translated: is the cause of cognition, without distinction.

original: de ltar 'di yin zhe na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ltar 'di yin zhe na zhes bya ba la /
translated: If it is like that, it is said.

original: ji ltar mig phye na gzhan dang gzhan mthong ba de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa'i yul gzhan dang gzhan mthong bar 'gyur gyi de la gzhan dang gzhan du 'byung ba'i 'bras bu 'gyur bar dpog pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar mig phye na gzhan dang gzhan mthong ba de bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa'i yul gzhan dang gzhan mthong bar 'gyur gyi de la gzhan dang gzhan du 'byung ba'i 'bras bu 'gyur bar dpog pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Just as when the eye is open, another and another is seen, in the same way, another and another object such as form is seen, but the result arising as another and another is not inferred in that.

original: de ltar mi 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin 'phrog byed ni sa gsum skyed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar mi 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin 'phrog byed ni sa gsum skyed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If the nature of not being like that is taken away, it is the production of the three worlds.

original: mig de la'ang khyad par yod phyir ro //
analyzed: mig de la'ang khyad par yod phyir ro //
translated: Because there is a distinction in that eye.

original: zhes bya ba la mig la sogs pa de la yang khyad par yod pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la mig la sogs pa de la yang khyad par yod pa yin te /
translated: In response to this, there is a difference in the eye and so on.

original: 'di ltar @314a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar @314a * //
translated: Thus,üîΩa clear or unclear cognition arises from a specific form that is a nearby or distant object.

original: gzugs kyi khyad par yul nye ba dang ring ba las gsal ba dang / mi gsal ba'i rig pa skye ba de bzhin du mig cung zad zum pa las mi gsal bar snang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gzugs kyi khyad par yul nye ba dang ring ba las gsal ba dang / mi gsal ba'i rig pa skye ba de bzhin du mig cung zad zum pa las mi gsal bar snang ba'i phyir /
translated: In the same way, an unclear appearance arises from slightly closing the eyes.

original: mig la sogs pa'i khyad par phul du byung bar rnam par shes pa las grub pa yin no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i khyad par phul du byung bar rnam par shes pa las grub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the eye and so on are established from a superior consciousness.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur ba mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur ba mod kyi /
translated: This is how it is.

original: mig la sogs pa la gnas pa'i byad par mngon sum las 'das pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa la gnas pa'i byad par mngon sum las 'das pa'i phyir /
translated: But since the eye and so on are not established by direct perception,

original: ji ltar nges pa yod pa yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar nges pa yod pa yin te /
translated: how can they be ascertained?

original: gang gis na de tha dad pas 'bras bu tha dad par bya zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis na de tha dad pas 'bras bu tha dad par bya zhe na /
translated: By what are they differentiated so that the effect is differentiated?

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: so so so sor nus med rnams //
analyzed: so so so sor nus med rnams //
translated: Individually, they are not capable.

original: rgyun la phul byung med pa na //
analyzed: rgyun la phul byung med pa na //
translated: When there is no superiority in the continuum,

original: tshogs pa yod na 'ang nus med 'gyur //
analyzed: tshogs pa yod na 'ang nus med 'gyur //
translated: even when there is a collection, they are incapable.

original: de'i phyir phul byung gyur pa yin //
analyzed: de'i phyir phul byung gyur pa yin //
translated: Therefore, there is superiority.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here it is said:

original: gang gi phyir mig la sogs pa rnams so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mig la sogs pa rnams so //
translated: because of the eye, etc.

original: so sor ni nus pa med pas mig la sogs pa'i rig pa ni rang bzhin so sor nges par skye ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: so sor ni nus pa med pas mig la sogs pa'i rig pa ni rang bzhin so sor nges par skye ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Since each is not capable, the awareness of the eye, etc. does not arise with a nature that is individually determined,

original: yul gyi rnam pa rtogs pa'i rang bzhin ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //üîΩtshogs pa yod na yang rgyun phul du byung ba ste /
analyzed: yul gyi rnam pa rtogs pa'i rang bzhin ma mthong ba'i phyir ro // tshogs pa yod na yang rgyun phul du byung ba ste /
translated: because the nature of the understanding of the form of the object is not seen.

original: khyad par du gyur pa med na nus pa med par gyur te gnas skabs so so ba bzhin no //
analyzed: khyad par du gyur pa med na nus pa med par gyur te gnas skabs so so ba bzhin no //
translated: Even when the collection exists, if there is no excellence of the continuum, there is no capability, as in the case of each individual state.

original: mthong bas dbang po 'grub pa de bzhin du mig la sogs pa rnams la phul du byung ba grub pa yin no //
analyzed: mthong bas dbang po 'grub pa de bzhin du mig la sogs pa rnams la phul du byung ba grub pa yin no //
translated: The establishment of the sense faculties by seeing is just like the establishment of the excellence of the eye, etc.

original: 'di'i dgongs pa ni ji ltar 'bras bu mthong bas dbang po la sogs pa yod pa de bzhin du 'bras bu'i khyad par mthong ba las phul du byung ba nges so //
analyzed: 'di'i dgongs pa ni ji ltar 'bras bu mthong bas dbang po la sogs pa yod pa de bzhin du 'bras bu'i khyad par mthong ba las phul du byung ba nges so //
translated: The intention is that just as the existence of the sense faculties, etc. is seen by seeing the effect, in the same way, excellence is ascertained from seeing the excellence of the effect.

original: de phyir so sor nus med gang //
analyzed: de phyir so sor nus med gang //
translated: Therefore, that which is not capable individually

original: tshogs la yon tan srid 'gyur ba //
analyzed: tshogs la yon tan srid 'gyur ba //
translated: may have the possibility of a quality in the collection.

original: de dag rgyu yin dbang phyug sogs //
analyzed: de dag rgyu yin dbang phyug sogs //
translated: Those are the causes, not God, etc.

original: ma yin khyad par med phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin khyad par med phyir ro //
translated: No, because there is no difference.

original: zhes bya ba la /üîΩgang gi phyir de ltar tshogs pa na yang phul du byung ba ma rtogs par 'bras bu skyed pa med de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la / gang gi phyir de ltar tshogs pa na yang phul du byung ba ma rtogs par 'bras bu skyed pa med de /
translated: In response to that, it is said:

original: de'i phyir so sor mi nus pa gang yin pa mig la sogs pa rnams la yon tan srid par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir so sor mi nus pa gang yin pa mig la sogs pa rnams la yon tan srid par 'gyur te /
translated: Because in that way, even when the collection exists, the effect is not produced without realizing the superior, therefore, the qualities of the eye and so on, which are individually incapable, are possible.

original: grogs byed pa 'am nye bar sdud par skyed pa'o //
analyzed: grogs byed pa 'am nye bar sdud par skyed pa'o //
translated: They are either assisting or they are produced by the collection.

original: sdud pa'i che dbang phyug la sogs pa tha dad pa med pas rgyu ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: sdud pa'i che dbang phyug la sogs pa tha dad pa med pas rgyu ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Since the collection, such as ƒ™≈õvara, is not different, it is not a cause.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni dus dang phyogs rnams bzung ngo //üîΩde lta bu 'dis ni dbang phyug la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma dad /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni dus dang phyogs rnams bzung ngo // de lta bu 'dis ni dbang phyug la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma dad /
translated: The term ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes time and directions.

original: don byed pa la sogs pa'i sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma med par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: don byed pa la sogs pa'i sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma med par bstan pa yin no //
translated: In this way, this teaches that there is no valid cognition that contradicts ƒ™≈õvara and that there is no valid cognition that establishes the performance of function and so on.

original: ji ltar rtag pa'i tshad ma la rgyu dang rtags med @314b pa de bzhin du mi rtag pa'i tshad ma la yang de bzhin du med pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: ji ltar rtag pa'i tshad ma la rgyu dang rtags med @314b pa de bzhin du mi rtag pa'i tshad ma la yang de bzhin du med pa ma yin nam /
translated: Just as there is no cause or reason for a permanent valid cognition, is it not the case that there is no such thing for an impermanent valid cognition?

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: Because:

original: lkog gyur don shes tshad ma yin //
analyzed: lkog gyur don shes tshad ma yin //
translated: Valid cognition knows hidden objects.

original: de la sgrub byed med pa'i phyir //üîΩ'jug par byed pa yod min zhes //
analyzed: de la sgrub byed med pa'i phyir // 'jug par byed pa yod min zhes //
translated: Because there is no proof of that.

original: kha cig rab tu rjod par byed //
analyzed: kha cig rab tu rjod par byed //
translated: Some say: ‚ÄúThere is no engagement.‚Äù

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: In this regard,

original: tshad ma ni lkog tu gyur pa ste /
analyzed: tshad ma ni lkog tu gyur pa ste /
translated: valid cognition is hidden,

original: dbang po las 'das pa thams cad rig par khas len na de yang dbang po las 'das pa'i rig pa sgrub par byed pa'i gtan tshigs gang yin pa de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po las 'das pa thams cad rig par khas len na de yang dbang po las 'das pa'i rig pa sgrub par byed pa'i gtan tshigs gang yin pa de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because if it is accepted that all that is beyond the senses is known, then there is no logical proof that establishes the knowledge of that which is beyond the senses.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa sgrub pa'i yul la 'jug pa mi srid do zhes kha cig rjod par byed de /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa sgrub pa'i yul la 'jug pa mi srid do zhes kha cig rjod par byed de /
translated: Some say: ‚ÄúIt is impossible to engage the object that is established as omniscience.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar thams cad mkhyen pa'i gtan tshigs med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar thams cad mkhyen pa'i gtan tshigs med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no logical proof of omniscience.

original: 'di ltar gdon mi za ba thams cad shes pa rtogs pa'i rgyu nges pa ma dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gdon mi za ba thams cad shes pa rtogs pa'i rgyu nges pa ma dmigs pa yin te /
translated: Thus, the cause of the realization of omniscience is definitely not observed.

original: gang sngags la sogs pa dmigs pa de ni grub pa'i mtha' thams cad la thun mong ba'i phyir gtan tshigs nyid do zhes bya bar nges pa ni ma yin la /
analyzed: gang sngags la sogs pa dmigs pa de ni grub pa'i mtha' thams cad la thun mong ba'i phyir gtan tshigs nyid do zhes bya bar nges pa ni ma yin la /
translated: Since the mantra, etc., are objects of observation, they are not ascertained to be reasons, because they are common to all philosophical schools.

original: thams cad rig bar nges pa'i gtan tshigs yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: thams cad rig bar nges pa'i gtan tshigs yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no reason for ascertaining all knowledge,

original: bdag cag gis ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag cag gis ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because we do not observe it.

original: mngon sum gyi nges par mi byed la phyogs gcig tu myong ba la nges pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi nges par mi byed la phyogs gcig tu myong ba la nges pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It does not ascertain by direct perception, nor does it ascertain by experience in one part,

original: rig byed la sogs pa la yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rig byed la sogs pa la yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it exists in the Vedas, etc.

original: shes bya thams cad mngon sum du byed par 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: shes bya thams cad mngon sum du byed par 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
translated: It does not make all objects of knowledge manifest,

original: da ltar byung ba dang rung ba'i yul ni mig la sogs pa'i stobs kyis 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba dang rung ba'i yul ni mig la sogs pa'i stobs kyis 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the present and suitable objects are apprehended by the power of the eye, etc.

original: gzhan yang dngos po thams cad mngon sum du byed pa thams cad mkhyen pa yin na /
analyzed: gzhan yang dngos po thams cad mngon sum du byed pa thams cad mkhyen pa yin na /
translated: Moreover, if all things were made manifest,

original: mi gtsang ba la sogs pa'i ro yang myong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi gtsang ba la sogs pa'i ro yang myong bar 'gyur te /
translated: the omniscient one would also experience the taste of filth, etc.

original: phrad pa 'dzin pa'i phyogs la yang //
analyzed: phrad pa 'dzin pa'i phyogs la yang //
translated: In the position that apprehends contact,

original: ji ltar dbang pas thams cad rig /'on te yid kyi rnam par shes pas thams cad shes na ni de yang dbang po'i shes pas gzung ba des 'dzin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ji ltar dbang pas thams cad rig /'on te yid kyi rnam par shes pas thams cad shes na ni de yang dbang po'i shes pas gzung ba des 'dzin pa'i phyir te /
translated: If it is by the mental consciousness that one knows all objects, then that mental consciousness would be apprehended by a sense consciousness, because it apprehends the object of the sense consciousness.

original: gzhan du na yid 'khrul par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na yid 'khrul par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would follow that the mental consciousness would be mistaken.

original: rjes su dpag pas gzung ba la yid 'jug pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas gzung ba la yid 'jug pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not that the mental consciousness engages its object through inference,

original: de ni yul dang dus nye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni yul dang dus nye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is proximate in terms of object and time.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa bstan bcos kyi yul la 'jug pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa bstan bcos kyi yul la 'jug pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The mental consciousness does not engage the object of the treatise,

original: de las phyin ci log gi don la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //üîΩshes bya thams cad mngon sum du byed pa yang rim gyis sam /
analyzed: de las phyin ci log gi don la 'jug pa'i phyir ro // shes bya thams cad mngon sum du byed pa yang rim gyis sam /
translated: because it engages objects that are contrary to that.

original: cig car yin par brtag @315a * //
analyzed: cig car yin par brtag @315a * //
translated: One should investigate whether all objects of knowledge are directly perceived by the mental consciousness in sequence orüîΩsimultaneously.

original: grang na / de la rim gyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: grang na / de la rim gyis ni ma yin te /
translated: In the first case, it is not in sequence,

original: shes bya dpag tu med pas yongs su mi rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes bya dpag tu med pas yongs su mi rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would not be complete, since objects of knowledge are limitless.

original: cig car mngon sum du byed pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: cig car mngon sum du byed pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not that all objects of knowledge are directly perceived simultaneously,üîΩbecause

original: rjes las thob pa'i shes pa gzung ba 'dzin pas tshad ma yin par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes las thob pa'i shes pa gzung ba 'dzin pas tshad ma yin par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the subsequent cognition that is obtained from that would be a valid cognition in regard to the apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: thams cad rig pa 'di yin no //
analyzed: thams cad rig pa 'di yin no //
translated: This is the cognition of all.

original: zhes bya bar nges pa'i thabs yod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya bar nges pa'i thabs yod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: There is no means of ascertaining that.

original: bdag cag la sogs pas shes bya ma lus pa 'dzin pa med na thams cad shes pa des pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag cag la sogs pas shes bya ma lus pa 'dzin pa med na thams cad shes pa des pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because we and others do not apprehend all objects of knowledge, it is not reasonable that there is a cognition of all.

original: thams cad rig pa ma grub na de'i sgrub pa nges pa med pa'i phyir 'jug par mi 'gyur ro snyam na /
analyzed: thams cad rig pa ma grub na de'i sgrub pa nges pa med pa'i phyir 'jug par mi 'gyur ro snyam na /
translated: If the cognition of all is not established, then there is no certainty in its establishment, so it is not reasonable to engage in it.

original: de la lan btab pa /üîΩmi shes ston par byed pa la //
analyzed: de la lan btab pa / mi shes ston par byed pa la //
translated: The response to that is:üîΩSome who are doubtfulüîΩabout the teaching of the unknown

original: 'khrul par dogs pa can rnams kyis //
analyzed: 'khrul par dogs pa can rnams kyis //
translated: seek to know

original: de bshad dogs par bya ba'i phyir //üîΩshes ldan kha cig tshol bar byed //üîΩces bya ba la /
analyzed: de bshad dogs par bya ba'i phyir // shes ldan kha cig tshol bar byed // ces bya ba la /
translated: in order to eliminate that doubt.

original: shes pa dang ldan pa kha cig shes pa dang ldan pa des brjod pa la ci'i phyir 'jug pa na rtogs par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: shes pa dang ldan pa kha cig shes pa dang ldan pa des brjod pa la ci'i phyir 'jug pa na rtogs par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: Some who possess knowledge, when they engage in the statements of those who possess knowledge, do so in order to understand.

original: ci zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: mi shes pa ston par byed pa la 'jug na 'khrul par dogs pa'i phyir ro zhes spyod de /
analyzed: mi shes pa ston par byed pa la 'jug na 'khrul par dogs pa'i phyir ro zhes spyod de /
translated: because if one engages in teaching what is not known, there is doubt about error.

original: de ltar dogs pa'i the tshom dang ldan pa rnams don du gnyer bar byed do zhes bya bar snyegs so //
analyzed: de ltar dogs pa'i the tshom dang ldan pa rnams don du gnyer bar byed do zhes bya bar snyegs so //
translated: Those who have doubt about that are made to strive for the object.

original: de'i don ni 'di yin te gang du 'jug par 'dod pa der ye shes don du gnyer bar byed kyi gzhan du mi shes pa la ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di yin te gang du 'jug par 'dod pa der ye shes don du gnyer bar byed kyi gzhan du mi shes pa la ma yin te /
translated: The meaning of that is this: One strives for the object of knowledge in order to engage in that which is desired, but not in order to know something else,

original: 'dod pa'i don la 'khrul pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i don la 'khrul pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because error with regard to the desired object is possible.

original: 'on kyang mngon par 'dod pa'i yul la yongs su shes par 'dod pa de tsam zhig tshad mar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on kyang mngon par 'dod pa'i yul la yongs su shes par 'dod pa de tsam zhig tshad mar 'gyur te /
translated: However, just that desire to know the object that is desired is valid knowledge,

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen pa'i phyir na tshad ma ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen pa'i phyir na tshad ma ma yin gyi /
translated: because the Bhagavat is not valid knowledge due to being omniscient.

original: 'on kyang slu bar mi byed pas tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang slu bar mi byed pas tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: However, he is not invalid because he does not deceive.

original: de'i thams cad mkhyen pa ni rjes su dpag par bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i thams cad mkhyen pa ni rjes su dpag par bya ba ste /
translated: His omniscience is to be inferred.

original: 'di ltar gtso bor gyur pa ni skyes bu'i don shes pa dang / tshad mas mthong ba'i don shes par 'gyur ba'i phyir gzhan du yang yongs su shes pa yod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar gtso bor gyur pa ni skyes bu'i don shes pa dang / tshad mas mthong ba'i don shes par 'gyur ba'i phyir gzhan du yang yongs su shes pa yod do //
translated: Thus, the principal thing is the knowledge of the meaning of the person, and the knowledge of the meaning seen by the valid means of knowledge. Therefore, there is also complete knowledge elsewhere.

original: gang yang tshad mas mthong ba'i don gtso bor gyur pa ma shes na /
analyzed: gang yang tshad mas mthong ba'i don gtso bor gyur pa ma shes na /
translated: And if one does not know the meaning seen by the valid means of knowledge,

original: de tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: de tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: that is not a valid means of knowledge.

original: ji ste tshangs pa la sogs pas bstan ce na /
analyzed: ji ste tshangs pa la sogs pas bstan ce na /
translated: If it is taught by BrahmƒÅ and so on,

original: rmongs pa gcig nas gcig tu bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rmongs pa gcig nas gcig tu bstan pa'o //
translated: it is the teaching of one ignorant person to another.

original: 'o na bcom ldan 'das kyang ji ltar mngon sum du byed pa rjes su dpag ce na /
analyzed: 'o na bcom ldan 'das kyang ji ltar mngon sum du byed pa rjes su dpag ce na /
translated: But how does the Blessed One make inference manifest?

original: tshad mas mthong ba gtso bor @315b gyur pa'i don ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad mas mthong ba gtso bor @315b gyur pa'i don ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he teaches the meaning seen by the valid means of knowledge.

original: gal te yang mngon sum du byed pa med na tshad mas mthong ba gtso bor gyur ba'i don la bcom ldan 'das mi slu bas /
analyzed: gal te yang mngon sum du byed pa med na tshad mas mthong ba gtso bor gyur ba'i don la bcom ldan 'das mi slu bas /
translated: And if there is no manifestation, since the Blessed One is non-deceptive with regard to the meaning seen by the valid means of knowledge,

original: dbang po las 'das pa la sogs pa 'jug par 'gyur ba na rtogs pa sngon du gtong ba yin no //
analyzed: dbang po las 'das pa la sogs pa 'jug par 'gyur ba na rtogs pa sngon du gtong ba yin no //

original: rig byed la ni don mngon du byed pa'i tshad ma ma mthong zhing /
analyzed: rig byed la ni don mngon du byed pa'i tshad ma ma mthong zhing /

original: gtso bor gyur pa'i don la mi slu ba med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gtso bor gyur pa'i don la mi slu ba med pa'i phyir /
translated: and the meaning of the Vedas is not undeceiving with regard to the principal object.

original: rnam pa thams cad du 'jug pa ma yin no //üîΩde phyir de la 'jug pa yi //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du 'jug pa ma yin no // de phyir de la 'jug pa yi //
translated: Therefore, it does not engage in any way.üîΩTherefore, it is appropriate to analyze

original: shes pa rnam par dpyad bya yi //üîΩsrin bu'i grangs ni yongs shes pa //
analyzed: shes pa rnam par dpyad bya yi // srin bu'i grangs ni yongs shes pa //
translated: the cognition that engages it.

original: de ni kho bo la ci mkho //
analyzed: de ni kho bo la ci mkho //
translated: What use is it for me to knowüîΩthe number of insects?

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: In response to this, the master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: gang gi phyir 'jug pa gang yin pa de nyid du yongs su shes pa tshol ba de bas na 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i yul la 'jug par gyur pa dang / las dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa yongs su shes pa dag bcom ldan 'das la dpyad par 'os kyi srin bu'i grangs yongs su shes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa de la kho po cag ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'jug pa gang yin pa de nyid du yongs su shes pa tshol ba de bas na 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i yul la 'jug par gyur pa dang / las dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa yongs su shes pa dag bcom ldan 'das la dpyad par 'os kyi srin bu'i grangs yongs su shes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa de la kho po cag ste /
translated: Since it is the case that the one who seeks to know the object of engagement is the one who seeks to know the object of disengagement, it is appropriate to analyze the object of engagement of the four noble truths and the object of disengagement of the four noble truths in the Bhagavat.

original: bdag cag mtho ris dang thar ba don du gnyer ba rnams la cung zad kyang nye bar mkho ba ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag cag mtho ris dang thar ba don du gnyer ba rnams la cung zad kyang nye bar mkho ba ma yin no //
translated: But the knowledge of the number of insects is not at all necessary for us who seek higher rebirth and liberation.

original: gal te gtso bor gyur pa'i don la slu ba med pas bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen par brjod na /
analyzed: gal te gtso bor gyur pa'i don la slu ba med pas bcom ldan 'das thams cad mkhyen par brjod na /
translated: If the Bhagavat is called omniscient because he is not deceived with respect to the principal object,

original: lo gcig khyud skor la zla ba bcu gnyis yod par mi slu bas rig byed kyang tshad mar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: lo gcig khyud skor la zla ba bcu gnyis yod par mi slu bas rig byed kyang tshad mar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then the Vedas would be valid cognition because they are not deceived with respect to the twelve months in a year.

original: 'dir smras pa /üîΩblang dang dor bya'i de nyid ni //üîΩthabs dang bcas par rig mdzad pa //
analyzed: 'dir smras pa / blang dang dor bya'i de nyid ni // thabs dang bcas par rig mdzad pa //
translated: Here we say:üîΩThe one who knows the reality of what is to be adopted and what is to be rejectedüîΩtogether with the means

original: gang yin de ni tshad ma ste //
analyzed: gang yin de ni tshad ma ste //
translated: is valid cognition,

original: thams cad rig mdzad ma yin no //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: thams cad rig mdzad ma yin no // zhes bya ba la /
translated: but not the one who knows everything.

original: dgos pa med pa'i phyogs gcig mkhyen pa las bcom ldan 'das tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: dgos pa med pa'i phyogs gcig mkhyen pa las bcom ldan 'das tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: The Bhagavat is not valid cognition because he knows one part of reality without purpose.

original: 'on kyang blang ba dang dor ba'i de kho na nyid ni sdug bsngal dang 'gog pa ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang blang ba dang dor ba'i de kho na nyid ni sdug bsngal dang 'gog pa ste /
translated: However, the reality of what is to be adopted and what is to be rejected is suffering and cessation,

original: de'i thabs ni rim pa bzhin kun 'byung dang / lam rig par mdzad pa gang yin pa de ni tshad mar 'dod kyi /
analyzed: de'i thabs ni rim pa bzhin kun 'byung dang / lam rig par mdzad pa gang yin pa de ni tshad mar 'dod kyi /
translated: and the means for that are the path and origin, respectively. The one who knows those is accepted as valid cognition,

analyzed: srin bu la sogs pa thams cad kyi grangs yongs su shes pa las ni ma yin no //
translated: but not from knowing the number of all insects and so on.

original: 'dis ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhin mngon du byed pa dang / mtho ris kyi lam bcom ldan 'das tshad ma yin par ston to //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhin mngon du byed pa dang / mtho ris kyi lam bcom ldan 'das tshad ma yin par ston to //
translated: This shows that the four noble truths are perceived and that the path to the higher realms is valid cognition.

original: ci thams cad rig pa mi srid dam yang na de yis gcig tu dgos pa med pas gtso bor gyur pa'i don yongs su shes pa'i tshad mar brtag ce na /üîΩsmras pa / ring por mthong @316a * //
analyzed: ci thams cad rig pa mi srid dam yang na de yis gcig tu dgos pa med pas gtso bor gyur pa'i don yongs su shes pa'i tshad mar brtag ce na / smras pa / ring por mthong @316a * //
translated: Is it impossible to know everything? Or is it that, since there is no need to know everything, it is enough to consider valid cognition to be the knowledge of the most important things?

original: ngam ma mthong yang //
analyzed: ngam ma mthong yang //
translated: Reply: Even if one does not see far,

original: 'dod pa'i de nyid mthong ba yin //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i de nyid mthong ba yin //
translated: one sees the truth of what one desires.

original: ring mthong tshad ma yin na ni //
analyzed: ring mthong tshad ma yin na ni //
translated: If seeing far were valid cognition,

original: tshur shog bya rgod bsten par gyis //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tshur shog bya rgod bsten par gyis // zhes bya ba la /
translated: then come and rely on the vulture!

original: thams cad rig pa med pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: thams cad rig pa med pa ni ma yin te /

original: 'on kyang tshad ma la phan 'dogs pa med do //
analyzed: 'on kyang tshad ma la phan 'dogs pa med do //

original: 'di ltar ring por mthong ba'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar ring por mthong ba'am /

original: thams cad ma mthong yang rung ste /
analyzed: thams cad ma mthong yang rung ste /
translated: or if one does not see everything,

analyzed: 'dod pa'i de kho na nyid 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi mthong ba'i phyir tshad ma'o //

original: 'on te ring du mthong ba tshad ma yin na skabs su bab pa'i don ma shes par de'i tshe grogs dag song ngam /
analyzed: 'on te ring du mthong ba tshad ma yin na skabs su bab pa'i don ma shes par de'i tshe grogs dag song ngam /

original: shog la thar ba 'dod pa la mtho ris don du gnyer ba khyed kyis ring du mthong ba'i bya rgod bsten par gyis shig /'di'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: shog la thar ba 'dod pa la mtho ris don du gnyer ba khyed kyis ring du mthong ba'i bya rgod bsten par gyis shig /'di'i don ni 'di yin te /

original: thams cad mkhyen pa rnam pa kun nas spong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa rnam pa kun nas spong ba ma yin te /

original: 'on kyang thabs dang bral bas kho bo cag yongs su shes pa'i lam du 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang thabs dang bral bas kho bo cag yongs su shes pa'i lam du 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
translated: However, since it is devoid of method, it is not that we enter the path of complete understanding.

original: gang zhig tshad mar gyur par 'dod pa des shes bya thams cad mngon sum du bya ba ste gzhan du na yongs su tshang ba'i don mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang zhig tshad mar gyur par 'dod pa des shes bya thams cad mngon sum du bya ba ste gzhan du na yongs su tshang ba'i don mi srid pa'i phyir ro //

original: ci ste don gyi gtso bo shes pa dang / thams cad rigs pa'i tshad ma nyid la rgyu ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: ci ste don gyi gtso bo shes pa dang / thams cad rigs pa'i tshad ma nyid la rgyu ci zhig yod ce na /

original: de'i phyir sgrub byed thugs rje zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sgrub byed thugs rje zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, the proof is stated: ‚Äúcompassion.‚Äù

original: pha rol sdug bsngal dang bral bar 'dod pa'i snying rje de yang rab kyi mthar phyin pa ste de ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i sgrub byed do //
analyzed: pha rol sdug bsngal dang bral bar 'dod pa'i snying rje de yang rab kyi mthar phyin pa ste de ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i sgrub byed do //
translated: And that compassion which is the desire to remove the suffering of others is the highest perfection. It is the means of accomplishing omniscience.

original: snying rje ni thabs ma shes na sdug bsngal gyi rgyu sgrub pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: snying rje ni thabs ma shes na sdug bsngal gyi rgyu sgrub pa ma yin nam /
translated: But if one does not know the means, is not compassion the cause of suffering?

original: 'di ltar ji srid du srog chags rnams la snying rje skyes pa de srid du sdug bsngal gyis nyon mongs par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar ji srid du srog chags rnams la snying rje skyes pa de srid du sdug bsngal gyis nyon mongs par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: For as long as compassion arises for living beings, for that long one is afflicted by suffering.

original: rang nyid sdug bsngal na /
analyzed: rang nyid sdug bsngal na /
translated: If one suffers,

original: ji ltar thams cad mkhyen pa 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar thams cad mkhyen pa 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: how can one accomplish omniscience?

original: sdug bsngal can la phan 'dogs pa dang bral pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal can la phan 'dogs pa dang bral pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: 'on te de'i thabs yongs su shes pa yod pas snying rjes sdug bsngal mi skyed na /

analyzed: 'o na ni lam nying sgrub byed yin na snying rjes ci zhig bya ste /
translated: then what is the use of compassion if the path is the means of accomplishment?

original: 'di ltar lam mngon du byas pas /
analyzed: 'di ltar lam mngon du byas pas /
translated: For in this way, by realizing the path,

original: sdug bsngal thams cad ldog go zhe na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal thams cad ldog go zhe na /
translated: all suffering is stopped.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: thams cad shes pa skyed pa snying rje ni ma yin te /
analyzed: thams cad shes pa skyed pa snying rje ni ma yin te /
translated: Compassion is not the generator of omniscience.

original: 'on kyang thabs goms pa nyid kyis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob bo //
analyzed: 'on kyang thabs goms pa nyid kyis thams cad mkhyen pa nyid thob bo //
translated: However, omniscience is attained by the practice of the method.

original: snying rjes kyang thams cad mkhyen pa'i thabs la skyes bu 'jug par byed pas sgrub byed du brjod do //
analyzed: snying rjes kyang thams cad mkhyen pa'i thabs la skyes bu 'jug par byed pas sgrub byed du brjod do //
translated: Compassion is also said to be the means of accomplishment because it causes beings to engage in the method of omniscience.

original: gal te yang srog chags @316b rnams la snying rje med na ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i thabs la 'jug pa ma yin la /
analyzed: gal te yang srog chags @316b rnams la snying rje med na ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i thabs la 'jug pa ma yin la /
translated: If there were no compassion for living beings, there would be no engagement in the method of omniscience.

original: bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa med na 'dod chags la sogs pa zad pa 'gyur ba'i phyir bdag med par mthong ba de ni gnyen po yin no //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa med na 'dod chags la sogs pa zad pa 'gyur ba'i phyir bdag med par mthong ba de ni gnyen po yin no //
translated: And since attachment and so on are exhausted when there is no grasping at ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine,‚Äù the view of selflessness is the antidote.

analyzed: de'i phyir yid snying rje dang ldan par gyur na sdug bsngal thams cad dang bral te /
translated: Therefore, when the mind is endowed with compassion, it is free from all suffering.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa nye bar skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa nye bar skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And omniscience arises.

original: rab kyi mthar phyin pa'i snying rje de nyid gang la skye bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: rab kyi mthar phyin pa'i snying rje de nyid gang la skye bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Where does that compassion, which is the highest, arise?

original: de'i phyir / goms ba la zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / goms ba la zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says, ‚Äúthrough cultivation.‚Äù

original: skye zhing skye ba thams cad du snying rje de nyid goms pa las rab kyi mthar phyin par 'gyur te /üîΩ'di ltar dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa'am /
analyzed: skye zhing skye ba thams cad du snying rje de nyid goms pa las rab kyi mthar phyin par 'gyur te / 'di ltar dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa'am /
translated: Through cultivation of just that compassion in all lives, one will reach the culmination of the process.üîΩThus, compassion arises for sentient beings through the great experience of being sustained by a spiritual masterüîΩor through one‚Äôs own experience. Then, having made that compassion manifest, one generates it in many lives and brings it to culmination.

original: rang nyid kyis nyams su myong ba chen pos sems can rnams la snying rje skyes te yang de nyid la mngon du byas nas skye ba du ma ru bskyed cing goms mthar phyin par gyur nas snying rjes skyes bu rnams la phan 'dogs pa'i shes pa 'jug pa'i
analyzed: rang nyid kyis nyams su myong ba chen pos sems can rnams la snying rje skyes te yang de nyid la mngon du byas nas skye ba du ma ru bskyed cing goms mthar phyin par gyur nas snying rjes skyes bu rnams la phan 'dogs pa'i shes pa 'jug pa'i
translated: Because compassion engages the knowledge of benefiting beings,

analyzed: phyir / de nyid thams cad rig pa'i sgrub byed do //

original: 'dir brjod pa /
analyzed: 'dir brjod pa /

original: blo ni lus la brten pa'i phyir //
analyzed: blo ni lus la brten pa'i phyir //

analyzed: goms pa grub pa med ce na //

analyzed: zhes bya ba la blo ni lus 'di la brten pa ste /
translated: Here, the mind depends on this body.

original: 'di ltar pha dang ma'i rjes su 'brang ba'i gzugs dang / yid dang snyan pa dang / tha snyad la sogs pa bu'i yul mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar pha dang ma'i rjes su 'brang ba'i gzugs dang / yid dang snyan pa dang / tha snyad la sogs pa bu'i yul mthong ngo //

analyzed: dper na ri mo mkhan gyis bris pa'i ri mo rtsig pa'i logs la gnas pa ni rtsig pa las gzhan du brten pa ma yin zhing /

analyzed: khang pa zhig na 'jig par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: ma du lung ga'i 'bras bu la brten pa'i gzugs la sogs pa ni de nyams na 'jig par 'gyur te /

analyzed: de'i yon tan yin pa'i phyir dang / 'bras bu gzhan la mi brten pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: mes skyed pa'i nges par gyur pa'i du ba yang de'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir de zhig na 'jig par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: chang gi nus pa yang chang gi rdzas la brten ba nyid de /

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin @317a * //üîΩte ; min te rten ni bkag phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin @317a * // te ; min te rten ni bkag phyir ro //

original: zhes bya ba la /

original: yon tan gyis sam /

analyzed: nus pa'i rang bzhin gyis rten du gyur pa'i dngos po bkag pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: ji ltar lus la brten pa med par de ltar yang bshad par bya'o //

analyzed: ji ste pha dang ma'i mig la sogs pa dang 'dra bar bu'i mig la sogs pa dmigs par gyur pas 'jig rten gzhan las 'ongs pa nyid ni ma yin na /

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /

analyzed: skye zhing skye ba len pa na //

analyzed: rang gi rigs la ltos med can //

original: 'byung rngub dbang po blo rnams ni //
analyzed: 'byung rngub dbang po blo rnams ni //
translated: The movement of the breath, the senses, and the mind

original: lus gcig pu las ma yin te //
analyzed: lus gcig pu las ma yin te //
translated: do not arise from a single body,üîΩbecause that would be absurd.

analyzed: thal ches phyir ro zhes bya ba la 'byung ba dang rngub pa dang / dbang po dang / blo de dag gi g-yo ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi khyad par las rang gi rigs la ltos pa med pa'i yul las skye ba ni ma yin te /
translated: The movement of the breath, the senses, and the mind do not arise from an object that is independent of one‚Äôs own kind, because of the particular nature of their movement, etc.

original: gang gi phyir mi srun pa ni bdag dang bdag gir goms pa'i rgyu can yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mi srun pa ni bdag dang bdag gir goms pa'i rgyu can yin gyi /
translated: For the wicked are caused by the habit of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: pha dang ma'i rang bzhin kho na'i rgyu can ma yin no //
analyzed: pha dang ma'i rang bzhin kho na'i rgyu can ma yin no //
translated: They are not caused by the nature of mother and father alone.

original: dam pa ma yin pa dang 'grogs na skye bo dam pa yin par snang ste /
analyzed: dam pa ma yin pa dang 'grogs na skye bo dam pa yin par snang ste /
translated: When one associates with the wicked, one appears to be wicked.

original: g-yo ba la sogs pa des sngon mi srun pa la goms pa'i rgyu can yin no //
analyzed: g-yo ba la sogs pa des sngon mi srun pa la goms pa'i rgyu can yin no //
translated: The movement, etc. are caused by the habit of wickedness in the past.

original: ma la sogs pa'i sems kyi dpyod pa la sogs pa bu la snang ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ma la sogs pa'i sems kyi dpyod pa la sogs pa bu la snang ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it the case that the mother and so on appear to the son as a result of the son‚Äôs mental analysis?

original: ma yin te pha dang ma'i rang bzhin 'dod pa'i stobs nyid las /
analyzed: ma yin te pha dang ma'i rang bzhin 'dod pa'i stobs nyid las /
translated: No, it is not. The son‚Äôs grasping of the mother and so on as his mother and so on is due to the power of his own desire for the nature of mother and so on.

original: der pha dang ma dag yongs su 'dzin te dper na mkhan pos chos bshad pa'i lugs slob ma de la goms pa'i khyad par nyid sna ba ste /
analyzed: der pha dang ma dag yongs su 'dzin te dper na mkhan pos chos bshad pa'i lugs slob ma de la goms pa'i khyad par nyid sna ba ste /
translated: For example, the student‚Äôs grasping of the teacher‚Äôs way of explaining the Dharma is due to the power of his own habituation to the teacher‚Äôs way of explaining the Dharma.

original: mkhan po'i blo las slob ma shes pa skye ba can du khas len pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mkhan po'i blo las slob ma shes pa skye ba can du khas len pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not that the student‚Äôs consciousness arises from the teacher‚Äôs consciousness.

original: slob dpon ni gcig tu bdag po tsam nyid do //üîΩslob dpon gyis bshad pa la /
analyzed: slob dpon ni gcig tu bdag po tsam nyid do // slob dpon gyis bshad pa la /
translated: The teacher is merely the dominant condition.üîΩThe student grasps the Dharma that the teacher explains

original: rang 'dod pa goms pa'i stobs kyis chos 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: rang 'dod pa goms pa'i stobs kyis chos 'dzin par byed do //
translated: through the power of his own habituation to what he desires.

original: de bzhin du ma la sogs pa'i chos 'dzin pa 'di yang rang 'dod pa la goms pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin du ma la sogs pa'i chos 'dzin pa 'di yang rang 'dod pa la goms pa nyid do //
translated: In the same way, the grasping of the mother and so on as mother and so on is due to the power of one‚Äôs own habituation to desire for the mother and so on.

original: gang ma la sogs pa'i rang bzhin 'dod pa tsam ni pha la sogs pa'i spyod pa 'dzin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang ma la sogs pa'i rang bzhin 'dod pa tsam ni pha la sogs pa'i spyod pa 'dzin pa ma yin no //
translated: The mere desire for the nature of the mother and so on is not the grasping of the conduct of the father and so on.

original: de'i phyir lus 'ba' zhig las srog chags rnams skye ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir lus 'ba' zhig las srog chags rnams skye ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, living beings are not born from the body alone.

original: 'on te srog chags rnams kyi skye ba ni lus 'ba' zhig @317b las 'byung bar khas len te /
analyzed: 'on te srog chags rnams kyi skye ba ni lus 'ba' zhig @317b las 'byung bar khas len te /
translated: If you accept that living beings are born from the body alone,

original: goms pa las mi srun pa la sogs pa mthong ba las ni gnod pa dang bral ba'i phyir srog chags rnams ni lus las skyes pa la gnod pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: goms pa las mi srun pa la sogs pa mthong ba las ni gnod pa dang bral ba'i phyir srog chags rnams ni lus las skyes pa la gnod pa med do zhe na /
translated: then the body is not harmed by seeing the harm done to the wicked, etc. because of the absence of harm.

original: de lta na yang skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa la thal ches te /
analyzed: de lta na yang skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa la thal ches te /
translated: Even so, there is the absurdity of the acceptance of birth,

original: da ltar byung ba'i dus su mi srun pa la sogs pa la goms par 'jug par mi 'gyur ba de bas na /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i dus su mi srun pa la sogs pa la goms par 'jug par mi 'gyur ba de bas na /
translated: because in the present time one does not engage in the practice of the wicked, etc. Therefore,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po thams cad nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po thams cad nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: all the principles of causality are destroyed.

original: de lta bas na 'bras bu'i chos gang yin pa de ni rgyu med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'bras bu'i chos gang yin pa de ni rgyu med pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, any resultant dharma is not without a cause.

original: gal te yang sngon byis pa'i gnas skabs na mi srun pa la sogs pa ma gtogs par mi srun pa la sogs pa la goms pa dang 'brel par da ltar yang snang ngo //
analyzed: gal te yang sngon byis pa'i gnas skabs na mi srun pa la sogs pa ma gtogs par mi srun pa la sogs pa la goms pa dang 'brel par da ltar yang snang ngo //
translated: If you are not accustomed to seeing a ghost, you do not see one even when you are close to it.

original: du ba ni du ba las kyang skye zhing me las kyang byung ba dang / de bzhin du 'bras s'a lu ni s'a lu nyid dang res 'ga' ba lang gi lci ba las 'byung ba dang / ri mo ni ri mo mkhan gyis byas pa dang /
analyzed: du ba ni du ba las kyang skye zhing me las kyang byung ba dang / de bzhin du 'bras s'a lu ni s'a lu nyid dang res 'ga' ba lang gi lci ba las 'byung ba dang / ri mo ni ri mo mkhan gyis byas pa dang /
translated: Smoke arises from smoke and also arises from fire, and likewise rice arises from rice and sometimes from cow dung, and a painting arises from a painter,

original: ri mo mkhan ma gtogs par bya'i gshog pa la snang ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: ri mo mkhan ma gtogs par bya'i gshog pa la snang ba de bzhin du /
translated: and apart from the painter, it arises from the wings of a parrot.

original: goms pa ma gtogs pa nyid du mig la g-yo ba la sogs pa mthong ba'i ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: goms pa ma gtogs pa nyid du mig la g-yo ba la sogs pa mthong ba'i ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: In the same way, apart from being accustomed to it, why wouldn‚Äôt movement and so on be seen in the eye?

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /üîΩgang gi phyir du bas bskyed pa'i du ba'i rnam pa bzhin du /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te / gang gi phyir du bas bskyed pa'i du ba'i rnam pa bzhin du /
translated: That is not logical.

original: me las 'byung ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: me las 'byung ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Because it is not the case that what arises from smoke, such as the color of smoke,üîΩarises from fire.

original: me yis bskyed pa'i du ba ni rgyun 'jug pa yin la /
analyzed: me yis bskyed pa'i du ba ni rgyun 'jug pa yin la /
translated: Smoke generated by fire is continuous.

original: du bas bskyed pa'i du ba ni skad cig re re la 'jig cing 'jug par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: du bas bskyed pa'i du ba ni skad cig re re la 'jig cing 'jug par shes par bya'o //
translated: The smoke produced by the fire is to be understood as being momentary, as it is produced and destroyed at every moment.

original: 'di ni byis pa'i dus su goms pa ma gtogs par goms pa las byung ba'i g-yo ba la sogs pa ji lta ba de bzhin g-yo ba la sogs pa shes par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ni byis pa'i dus su goms pa ma gtogs par goms pa las byung ba'i g-yo ba la sogs pa ji lta ba de bzhin g-yo ba la sogs pa shes par bya ste /
translated: This is to be understood as the movement, etc. of consciousness, which is the result of habit, just as the movement, etc. of the body is the result of habit.

original: des na sngon rang gi rigs la goms pa sngon du 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: des na sngon rang gi rigs la goms pa sngon du 'gro ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the prior habit of one‚Äôs own kind is a prerequisite.

original: yang na thal ches par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na thal ches par 'gyur te /
translated: Or else, it is an overextension.

original: gal te lus 'ba' zhig las 'byung 'jug la sogs pa 'byung ba de'i chos la sogs pa las dbugs 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te lus 'ba' zhig las 'byung 'jug la sogs pa 'byung ba de'i chos la sogs pa las dbugs 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: If the arising, entering, etc. occur only from the body, then the arising of the breath would occur from the elements, etc.

original: 'byung ba nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no difference in the elements.

original: de lta bas na sa'i steng thams cad srog chags kyi rang bzhin du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na sa'i steng thams cad srog chags kyi rang bzhin du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, it follows that the entire surface of the earth would be of the nature of living beings.

original: 'on te 'byung ba yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par nyid srog chags su skye na yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par de yang /
analyzed: 'on te 'byung ba yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par nyid srog chags su skye na yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par de yang /
translated: But if the arising of living beings occurs from the transformation of the elements, then that transformation would be a living being.

original: yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par gzhan las yin pas yongs su gyur pa gzhan dang gzhan du mtha' med par 'gyur ro //üîΩji ste yongs @318a * //
analyzed: yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par gzhan las yin pas yongs su gyur pa gzhan dang gzhan du mtha' med par 'gyur ro // ji ste yongs @318a * //
translated: The difference of transformation would be from another, and so on to infinity.

original: su gyur pa de mthong du rung ngam mi rung /
analyzed: su gyur pa de mthong du rung ngam mi rung /
translated: If the transformation is visible or invisible?

original: gal te mthong du rung na ni med de mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te mthong du rung na ni med de mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is visible, it does not exist, because it is not perceived.

original: 'on te mthong du mi rung na ni yod par ji ltar shes /
analyzed: 'on te mthong du mi rung na ni yod par ji ltar shes /
translated: If it is invisible, how can it be known to exist?

original: 'byung ba ma gtogs pa gang yang yongs su gyur pa'i rgyu med de /
analyzed: 'byung ba ma gtogs pa gang yang yongs su gyur pa'i rgyu med de /
translated: There is no cause of transformation apart from the elements.

original: gal te gyur pa rang gi nye bar len pa tsam dang 'brel pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te gyur pa rang gi nye bar len pa tsam dang 'brel pa yin na /
translated: If the transformation is related to the mere appropriation of the self,

original: yul dang dus thams cad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul dang dus thams cad par 'gyur ro //
translated: it would be everywhere and always.

original: ji ste 'byung 'jug la sogs pa rnams 'bras bur 'gyur pa'i dbang po la sogs pa skye ba gzhan du 'jug pa ni grub tu chug na ma 'ongs pa'i skye bar 'jug par ji ltar grub /
analyzed: ji ste 'byung 'jug la sogs pa rnams 'bras bur 'gyur pa'i dbang po la sogs pa skye ba gzhan du 'jug pa ni grub tu chug na ma 'ongs pa'i skye bar 'jug par ji ltar grub /
translated: If the arising of the sense faculties, etc., which are the effects of the transformation, is admitted to occur in another birth, how can the arising of the future be established?

original: 'chi ba'i gnas skabs kyi mig la sogs pa'i 'jig rten gzhan gyi shes pa'i 'bras bu ma yin pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i gnas skabs kyi mig la sogs pa'i 'jig rten gzhan gyi shes pa'i 'bras bu ma yin pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But the eyes and so on of the dying person are not the effect of the consciousness of another world.

original: de ni bden pa ma yin te //
analyzed: de ni bden pa ma yin te //
translated: This is not true.

original: gang gi phyir na mthong ba gang //
analyzed: gang gi phyir na mthong ba gang //
translated: Because whatever is seen

original: nying mtshams sbyor bar nus pa ni //
analyzed: nying mtshams sbyor bar nus pa ni //
translated: Is able to link with the intermediate state.

original: de cir 'gyur na phyis gang med //
analyzed: de cir 'gyur na phyis gang med //
translated: What would happen if it did not exist later?

original: gang gis mtshams sbyor ldan med yin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /üîΩsrog chags la sogs pa sngon gyi dus su nying mtshams sbyor bar nus pa dang ldan pa gnas skabs bar mar mthong ba gang yin pa'am /
analyzed: gang gis mtshams sbyor ldan med yin // zhes bya ba la / srog chags la sogs pa sngon gyi dus su nying mtshams sbyor bar nus pa dang ldan pa gnas skabs bar mar mthong ba gang yin pa'am /
translated: By what would it be linked if it did not exist earlier?

original: 'jig rten gzhan du 'jug pa'i srog chags la sogs pa de ni sngar yod pa la lhag pa ci zhig yod na /
analyzed: 'jig rten gzhan du 'jug pa'i srog chags la sogs pa de ni sngar yod pa la lhag pa ci zhig yod na /
translated: Whatever is seen as able to link with the intermediate state of an animal and so on in a previous time, or whatever is seen as an animal and so on entering another world, what additional thing exists there?

original: rgyu gang zhig med pa yin /
analyzed: rgyu gang zhig med pa yin /
translated: What cause is absent?

original: phyi nas 'chi ba'i gnas skabs su gang gi de lhag pa'i rgyu ba dang bral bas /
analyzed: phyi nas 'chi ba'i gnas skabs su gang gi de lhag pa'i rgyu ba dang bral bas /
translated: Later, at the time of death, what additional thing is absent that is the cause of its existence?

original: phyis 'chi ba'i dus su 'jig rten gzhan du 'byung ba'i srog la sogs pas srog la sogs pa nyid mtshams sbyor ba ni ma yin zhing /
analyzed: phyis 'chi ba'i dus su 'jig rten gzhan du 'byung ba'i srog la sogs pas srog la sogs pa nyid mtshams sbyor ba ni ma yin zhing /
translated: At the time of death, life and so on do not link with life and so on in another world.

original: de'i rgyu med pa yin /
analyzed: de'i rgyu med pa yin /
translated: They have no cause.üîΩThrough the practice of non-movement and so on, life and so on are not generated from weak and so on, which are characterized by weakness and so on.
