original: g-yo ba la sogs pas ni mi g-yo ba goms pa las ste nyam chung ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid las nyam chung ba ni lus la brten pa des na skye ba snga ma ma grub pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: g-yo ba la sogs pas ni mi g-yo ba goms pa las ste nyam chung ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid las nyam chung ba ni lus la brten pa des na skye ba snga ma ma grub pa ma yin nam /
translated: Since they are dependent on the body, is not prior birth not established?üîΩTherefore, since the continuum of beginningless birth is not established, beginninglessness does not exist.

original: de bas na skye ba thog ma med pa brgyud pa ma grub pas thog ma med pa nyid med kyang dper na du ba du ba gzhan gyis bskyed pa rgyun chad pa de bzhin du rigs mthun pas bskyed pa'i srog la sogs pa yang kun du mi 'jugüîΩpa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bas na skye ba thog ma med pa brgyud pa ma grub pas thog ma med pa nyid med kyang dper na du ba du ba gzhan gyis bskyed pa rgyun chad pa de bzhin du rigs mthun pas bskyed pa'i srog la sogs pa yang kun du mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Just as smoke is not generated by another smoke, so life and so on, generated by a homogeneous cause, do not continue.

original: srog chags rnams thog ma med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: srog chags rnams thog ma med pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, living beings are not beginningless.

original: snga ni med pa'i sems can gyi skye ba yang sngon gyi rgyun 'chad pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: snga ni med pa'i sems can gyi skye ba yang sngon gyi rgyun 'chad pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Also, the birth of a sentient being who did not exist previously is not established because the prior continuum is severed.

original: 'dir smras pa skye ba rnams nyam chung ba la sogs pa rang bzhin nyid kyis ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa skye ba rnams nyam chung ba la sogs pa rang bzhin nyid kyis ma yin te /
translated: Here we say: The arising of the eyes, etc. is not due to their own nature, such as weakness, etc.

original: 'on kyang rang gi rigs goms pa @318b las so //
analyzed: 'on kyang rang gi rigs goms pa @318b las so //
translated: but rather from the habituation of their own type.

original: ji ltar g-yo ba la sogs pa de goms pa las yin pa de bzhin du nyam chung ba la sogs pa yang le lo goms pa las te /
analyzed: ji ltar g-yo ba la sogs pa de goms pa las yin pa de bzhin du nyam chung ba la sogs pa yang le lo goms pa las te /
translated: Just as movement, etc. is due to habituation, so too weakness, etc. is due to the habituation of laziness.

original: 'di ltar gnyid goms pa las mig rdib par 'gyur zhing sad na ni mi g-yo ba'i phyir log pa dang sad pa bzhin mngon du gyur ba'i bag chags las sad pa dang po skye ba'i tshe mig la sogs pa dang ldan no //
analyzed: 'di ltar gnyid goms pa las mig rdib par 'gyur zhing sad na ni mi g-yo ba'i phyir log pa dang sad pa bzhin mngon du gyur ba'i bag chags las sad pa dang po skye ba'i tshe mig la sogs pa dang ldan no //
translated: Thus, from the habituation of sleep, the eyes sink and, when awake, they do not move. Therefore, at the time of the first arising of the manifest latent potentialities of sleep and waking, the eyes, etc. are possessed.

original: lus gzhan la gnas pa lus gzhan du ji ltar 'pho bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: lus gzhan la gnas pa lus gzhan du ji ltar 'pho bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does the mind that abides in one body move to another body?

original: ji ltar rdzas gzhan la gnas pa'i nus pa sngags la sogs pa'i mthus rdzas gzhan la 'pho ba ste /
analyzed: ji ltar rdzas gzhan la gnas pa'i nus pa sngags la sogs pa'i mthus rdzas gzhan la 'pho ba ste /
translated: Just as the potency that abides in another substance moves to another substance through the power of mantra, etc.

original: 'di ltar dug gi nus pa sngags kyi stobs kyis kha ra la sogs pa la 'pho ba de bzhin du las kyi mthus lus la gnas pa'i mig la sogs pa lus gzhan la 'phen par byed pas de bas na mig la sogs pa thog ma med pa grubüîΩpa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar dug gi nus pa sngags kyi stobs kyis kha ra la sogs pa la 'pho ba de bzhin du las kyi mthus lus la gnas pa'i mig la sogs pa lus gzhan la 'phen par byed pas de bas na mig la sogs pa thog ma med pa grub pa yin no //
translated: Just as the power of a mantra transfers the potency of a poison to something like molasses, in the same way, by the power of karma, the eyes and so on that exist in the body are transferred to another body. Therefore the eyes and so on are established as beginningless.

original: snyi ba la sogs pa'i khyad par bzhin 'byung po'i chogs  gang yang rung ba'i srog la sogs pa yang ma yin nam zhe na /üîΩ'dir smras pa /
analyzed: snyi ba la sogs pa'i khyad par bzhin 'byung po'i chogs  gang yang rung ba'i srog la sogs pa yang ma yin nam zhe na / 'dir smras pa /
translated: But aren‚Äôt the eyes and so on the life of a collection of elements such as earth?

original: gang la drod gsher sogs skye bas //üîΩskye bo skye par mi 'gyur ba'i //
analyzed: gang la drod gsher sogs skye bas // skye bo skye par mi 'gyur ba'i //
translated: In response to this, Aryadeva says:üîΩThere is no part of earth and so on

original: sa sogs cha ste 'ga' yang med //
analyzed: sa sogs cha ste 'ga' yang med //
translated: in which a living being does not arise.

original: de'i phyir thams cad sa bon bdag / ces bya ba la sa la sogs pa'i cha 'am /üîΩbye brag 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad sa bon bdag / ces bya ba la sa la sogs pa'i cha 'am / bye brag 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, everything is the seed of everything.üîΩThere is no part of earth and so on

original: sa la sogs pa'i cha gang zhig tu srog chags skye ba ma yin pa'o /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa'i cha gang zhig tu srog chags skye ba ma yin pa'o /
translated: in which a living being does not arise.

original: tha ma na drod gsher las skye ba ni mthong ba ste sogs pa'i sgras ni sgo nga las skye ba la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: tha ma na drod gsher las skye ba ni mthong ba ste sogs pa'i sgras ni sgo nga las skye ba la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The last, birth from heat and moisture, is seen, and the words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù include birth from an egg.

original: 'di ltar ras la gtums pa'i chu yang zhag cung zad cig gnas pa na der sems can gnas te rgya mtsho chen po na ni srog chags cha byad sna tshogs pa thams cad snang ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar ras la gtums pa'i chu yang zhag cung zad cig gnas pa na der sems can gnas te rgya mtsho chen po na ni srog chags cha byad sna tshogs pa thams cad snang ba yin no //
translated: Thus, water wrapped in cloth remains for a short time, and sentient beings live there. In the great ocean, all kinds of living beings appear.

original: de'i phyir de bas na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: 'byung ba'i skyed pa thams cad srog chags dang ldan pa de'i phyir srog la sogs pa ni cha shas med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i skyed pa thams cad srog chags dang ldan pa de'i phyir srog la sogs pa ni cha shas med pa yin no //
translated: all that is generated from the elements is endowed with living beings. Therefore, life and so on are partless.

original: 'o na khyod kyi lugs kyis kyang thams cad srog chags dang ldan pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'o na khyod kyi lugs kyis kyang thams cad srog chags dang ldan pa ma yin nam /
translated: But in your system, is it not the case that everything is endowed with living beings?

original: sa la sogs pa thams cad la srog chags skye ba med ce na /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa thams cad la srog chags skye ba med ce na /
translated: Do living beings not arise from all earth and so on?

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: de ltar dbang po sogs rigs las //
analyzed: de ltar dbang po sogs rigs las //
translated: Thus, the sense faculties and so on

original: ltos med rnams ni 'byung ba na //
analyzed: ltos med rnams ni 'byung ba na //
translated: arise from the elements without dependence.

original: ji ltar gcig ni 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: ji ltar gcig ni 'gyur ba yin //
translated: How can they be one?

original: kun 'gyur khyad par med phyir @319a * //
analyzed: kun 'gyur khyad par med phyir @319a * //
translated: because there is no difference in the transformation of all.

original: ro ; / zhes bya ba la 'byung ba rnams las su rung yang rigs mthun pa la ma ltos par shes pa skye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: ro ; / zhes bya ba la 'byung ba rnams las su rung yang rigs mthun pa la ma ltos par shes pa skye ba ma yin te /
translated: Even though the elements are pliable, consciousness does not arise without relying on a homogeneous cause.

original: 'on kyang las bdag por gyur pa las srog chags rnams 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang las bdag por gyur pa las srog chags rnams 'byung ba yin no //
translated: However, living beings arise from karma that is their master.

original: des na bag chags sad pa skye ba gang yin pa der srog chags rnams skye ba yin no //
analyzed: des na bag chags sad pa skye ba gang yin pa der srog chags rnams skye ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, living beings are born in that birth in which the latent impressions are awakened.

original: khyod la ni 'byung ba las ma gtogs pa'i las khas mi len pa'i phyir 'byung tsam dang 'brel pa'i mig la sogs pa rnams 'dod do //
analyzed: khyod la ni 'byung ba las ma gtogs pa'i las khas mi len pa'i phyir 'byung tsam dang 'brel pa'i mig la sogs pa rnams 'dod do //
translated: You accept that the eye, etc., are related to the mere elements, because you do not accept karma apart from the elements.

original: de bas na dbang po la sogs pa rnams rigs mthun pa la ma ltos par 'byung na ni dper na 'byung ba'i tshogs gcig la srog chags kyi gzugs su gyur pa de bzhin du 'byung ba rnams thams cad la yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na dbang po la sogs pa rnams rigs mthun pa la ma ltos par 'byung na ni dper na 'byung ba'i tshogs gcig la srog chags kyi gzugs su gyur pa de bzhin du 'byung ba rnams thams cad la yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, if the eye, etc., arise without relying on a homogeneous cause, then just as one collection of elements becomes the form of a living being, so all the elements would.

original: nur nur po la sogs pa'i rim gyis lus kyi mngal du mig la sogs pa dmigs pa grub pa'i mthas gzhag pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: nur nur po la sogs pa'i rim gyis lus kyi mngal du mig la sogs pa dmigs pa grub pa'i mthas gzhag pa ma yin nam /
translated: The eye faculty and so on are established by philosophical tenets as the basis for the observation of the body in the womb, which is gradually formed from the kalala and so on.

original: der yang mig la sogs pa'i shes pa rnams skye ba ste /
analyzed: der yang mig la sogs pa'i shes pa rnams skye ba ste /
translated: And the eye consciousness and so on arise from that.

original: de ji ltar 'jig rten pha rol gyi dbang po las yin par brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar 'jig rten pha rol gyi dbang po las yin par brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: How can it be said that the eye faculty and so on of the next world arise from the faculties of this world?

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: dbang rnams so so la gnod kyang //
analyzed: dbang rnams so so la gnod kyang //
translated: Even though the faculties are impaired,

original: yid blor gnod pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: yid blor gnod pa yod ma yin //
translated: the mental faculty is not impaired.üîΩWhen this is destroyed, the destruction of those

original: 'di 'jig na ni de dag gi /'jig pa dag kyang mthong bar 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di 'jig na ni de dag gi /'jig pa dag kyang mthong bar 'gyur // zhes bya ba la /
translated: is also seen.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pas 'phangs pa nyid kyi mig la sogs pa ni rang gi bya ba byed pa ste /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pas 'phangs pa nyid kyi mig la sogs pa ni rang gi bya ba byed pa ste /
translated: The eye faculty and so on, which are projected by the mental consciousness, perform their own function.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa dbang po la brten pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa dbang po la brten pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The mental consciousness does not depend on the faculties.

original: 'jig rten pha rol gyi yid de nyid las yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol gyi yid de nyid las yin te /
translated: The mental faculty of the next world arises from that very mental faculty.

original: 'byung ba'i tshogs la brten pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i tshogs la brten pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It does not depend on a collection of elements.

original: so so pa ni re re ba'i mig la sogs pa la gnod kyang de yid kyi blo la ni gnod pa ma yin te 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: so so pa ni re re ba'i mig la sogs pa la gnod kyang de yid kyi blo la ni gnod pa ma yin te 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: The individual is the eye, etc. , each separately. When they are damaged, the mental cognition is not damaged.

original: yid kyi blo de la ni mya ngan la sogs pas 'jig pa ste gyur na /
analyzed: yid kyi blo de la ni mya ngan la sogs pas 'jig pa ste gyur na /
translated: But when the mental cognition is destroyed by grief, etc.,

original: mig la sogs pa de rnams 'jig pas te nyams pa 'am 'gyur bar mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa de rnams 'jig pas te nyams pa 'am 'gyur bar mthong ba yin no //
translated: it is seen that they are destroyed, i.e., damaged or changed.

original: de gyur pas 'gyur ba ni 'bras bu nyid yin pa de bas na yid kyi rnam par shes pa dbang po la rten pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de gyur pas 'gyur ba ni 'bras bu nyid yin pa de bas na yid kyi rnam par shes pa dbang po la rten pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Since the change is the result of that, the mental consciousness does not have a faculty as its basis.

original: 'on kyang de nyid de la brten pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang de nyid de la brten pa yin no //
translated: But it has that very mental faculty as its basis.

original: gal te yid kyi rnam par shes pa la mig la sogs pa brten na 'o na ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa rten med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te yid kyi rnam par shes pa la mig la sogs pa brten na 'o na ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa rten med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: If the mental consciousness has the eye, etc., as its basis, then the mental consciousness would be without a basis,

original: rnam par shes pa drug ni rten dang bcas par khas blangs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa drug ni rten dang bcas par khas blangs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: because it is accepted that the six consciousnesses have a basis.

original: 'dir smras @319b pa ;
analyzed: 'dir smras @319b pa ;
translated: Here it is said:

original: de phyir blo gnas pa yi rten //
analyzed: de phyir blo gnas pa yi rten //
translated: Therefore, the basis of the abiding of cognition

original: blo nyid 'ga' zhig la brten te //
analyzed: blo nyid 'ga' zhig la brten te //
translated: is just cognition itself, which is based on something.

original: dbang po rnams kyi rgyu mtshan yin //
analyzed: dbang po rnams kyi rgyu mtshan yin //
translated: The reason for the existence of the faculties is the mind.üîΩTherefore, the faculties are prior to the mind.

original: de phyir blo las dbang po yin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de phyir blo las dbang po yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The reason for the existence of the faculties is the mind.

original: dbang po'i gnas pa'i rten ni 'phen par byed pa'i las yin te /
analyzed: dbang po'i gnas pa'i rten ni 'phen par byed pa'i las yin te /
translated: The support of the faculties is the projecting karma.

original: 'di ltar dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i las kyis 'phangs pa'i yid kyi blo so sor nges pa'i dus su yod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i las kyis 'phangs pa'i yid kyi blo so sor nges pa'i dus su yod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the mind that is projected by virtuous and nonvirtuous karma exists at the time of the determination of the individual.

original: dbang po rnams kyi rgyu mtshan 'phen phar byed pa'i las ni blo gnas pa'i rten yin no //
analyzed: dbang po rnams kyi rgyu mtshan 'phen phar byed pa'i las ni blo gnas pa'i rten yin no //
translated: The projecting karma is the reason for the existence of the faculties.

original: las de ni las zhes bya ba nyid de dbang po'i rten yin te sngon gyi blo nyid la brten pa yin no //
analyzed: las de ni las zhes bya ba nyid de dbang po'i rten yin te sngon gyi blo nyid la brten pa yin no //
translated: That karma is called karma because it is the support of the faculties. It is the support of the mind.

original: de ltar yang sems kyi las ni sems nyid kyis byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar yang sems kyi las ni sems nyid kyis byed pa yin te /
translated: Thus, the karma of the mind is done by the mind itself.

original: 'dis ni las ni yid kyi blo'i rten yin par bstan te /
analyzed: 'dis ni las ni yid kyi blo'i rten yin par bstan te /
translated: This shows that karma is the support of the mind.

original: las kyang yid kyi blo snga ma nyid yin no //
analyzed: las kyang yid kyi blo snga ma nyid yin no //
translated: Karma is the mind that is prior to the mind.

original: de lta bas na thog ma med pa'i las ni sems la nye bar sbyar ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na thog ma med pa'i las ni sems la nye bar sbyar ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, because karma is applied to the mind, it is beginningless.

original: de'i phyir dbang po ni blo las yin te dbang po las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dbang po ni blo las yin te dbang po las ni ma yin te /
translated: Therefore the sense faculties arise from the mind, not from the mind‚Äôs sense faculties.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi nga dang bdag gi rnam pa yid kyi rnam par shes pa las da ltar byung ba'i skye ba yongs su 'dzin gyi ma 'ongs ba'i skye ba ji ltar 'dzin ce na /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi nga dang bdag gi rnam pa yid kyi rnam par shes pa las da ltar byung ba'i skye ba yongs su 'dzin gyi ma 'ongs ba'i skye ba ji ltar 'dzin ce na /
translated: But how does the present mind that is associated with ignorance and craving in the form of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine‚Äù take up future birth?

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: ci ste 'phen byed yod gyur na //
analyzed: ci ste 'phen byed yod gyur na //
translated: If there were a projecting force,

original: phyis kyang de dang 'dra bar 'gyur //
analyzed: phyis kyang de dang 'dra bar 'gyur //
translated: then later it would be like that.

original: zhes bya ba la 'jig rten pha rol 'das par gyur pa'i blo la ma rig pa dang sred par ldan pa de lta bu yod par gyur na tshe 'di'i dmig la sogs pa rnams la 'phen par byed pa yod pa'am /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la 'jig rten pha rol 'das par gyur pa'i blo la ma rig pa dang sred par ldan pa de lta bu yod par gyur na tshe 'di'i dmig la sogs pa rnams la 'phen par byed pa yod pa'am /
translated: If the mind that has transmigrated to the next world were to exist in that way, associated with ignorance and craving, then the projecting force would exist for the eyes and so on of this life.

original: da ltar gyi dus su yid kyi blo 'phen pa yang rung ste /
analyzed: da ltar gyi dus su yid kyi blo 'phen pa yang rung ste /
translated: Or the projecting force of the mind would exist in the present.

original: de bzhin du 'chi ba'i gnas skabs su yang dbang po la sogs pa rnams 'jig rten pha rol tu 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i 'phen par byed pa yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'chi ba'i gnas skabs su yang dbang po la sogs pa rnams 'jig rten pha rol tu 'gro bar 'gyur ba'i 'phen par byed pa yod pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, the projecting force would exist for the sense faculties and so on at the time of death that transmigrate to the next world.

original: de lta bus ni gsung rab las bstan pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa phyi ma'i 'jig rten pha rol du 'gro bar nus pa yin la /
analyzed: de lta bus ni gsung rab las bstan pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa phyi ma'i 'jig rten pha rol du 'gro bar nus pa yin la /
translated: Thus the mental consciousness taught in the scriptures is capable of going to a later world.üîΩThe earlier one is the seeing, etc.

original: sngon gyi ni mthong ba gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste g-yo ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin dang ldan pa mig la sogs pa 'jig rten pha rol po yin par mthong ba gang zhes pas bstan to //
analyzed: sngon gyi ni mthong ba gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste g-yo ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin dang ldan pa mig la sogs pa 'jig rten pha rol po yin par mthong ba gang zhes pas bstan to //
translated: The seeing, etc. of the nature of movement, etc. of the eye, etc. is the later world.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang lus la brten par gsung rab las gsungs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang lus la brten par gsung rab las gsungs pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it said in the scriptures that the mental consciousness is supported by the body?

original: de dang ji ltar mi 'gal zhe na /
analyzed: de dang ji ltar mi 'gal zhe na /
translated: How is this not contradictory?

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: shes pa de yis phan 'dogs @320a * //üîΩphyir // yid ni lus la brten par bshad //
analyzed: shes pa de yis phan 'dogs @320a * // phyir // yid ni lus la brten par bshad //
translated: Because it benefits it,

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: the mind is said to be supported by the body.

original: de'i shes pa ni lus kyi shes pa ste /
analyzed: de'i shes pa ni lus kyi shes pa ste /
translated: The consciousness of that is the consciousness of the body,

original: mig la sogs pa las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa las skyes pa'o //
translated: arisen from the eye, etc.

original: phan 'dogs phyir te phan par byed pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis yid ni lus la brten par bshad kyi /
analyzed: phan 'dogs phyir te phan par byed pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis yid ni lus la brten par bshad kyi /
translated: Because it benefits it, because it benefits the body, the BhagavƒÅn said that the mind is supported by the body.

original: don dam par ni yid lus la brten pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par ni yid lus la brten pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But in reality, it is not based on the mental body.

original: de'i phyir ngar 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid kyis yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni dbang po dang lus la brten par gnas pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir ngar 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid kyis yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni dbang po dang lus la brten par gnas pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the mental consciousness, which is characterized by the grasping of the self, is not based on the sense faculties and the body.

original: yang bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa'i yid don dam par lus la brten pa nyid du ci'i phyir khas mi len te /üîΩlus dang bral pa'i rtsig pa la yid ma mthong ba'i phyir ma yin nam zhen de ni bden pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yang bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa'i yid don dam par lus la brten pa nyid du ci'i phyir khas mi len te / lus dang bral pa'i rtsig pa la yid ma mthong ba'i phyir ma yin nam zhen de ni bden pa ma yin te /
translated: Why do you not accept that the mind, which grasps the self and that which belongs to the self, is ultimately based on the body?üîΩIs it not because you have never seen a mind in a wall, which is devoid of a body?

original: ma mthong ba tsam gyi 'bras bu nyid ma yin gyi /
analyzed: ma mthong ba tsam gyi 'bras bu nyid ma yin gyi /
translated: This is not true, because the mere fact of not seeing something is not a reason.

original: 'on kyang yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Rather, it is because of the fact that the mind follows the existence or nonexistence of the body.

original: de yang lus yid kyi rnam par shes pa la brten pa ni mthong ste /
analyzed: de yang lus yid kyi rnam par shes pa la brten pa ni mthong ste /
translated: Moreover, the body is seen to be based on the mental consciousness.

original: 'di ltar mya ngan la sogs pa yid gyur na /
analyzed: 'di ltar mya ngan la sogs pa yid gyur na /
translated: Thus, when the mind is afflicted with grief,

original: lus rid par gyur ba dang / yid dga' bar gyur na lus tshon por gyur zhing chen por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus rid par gyur ba dang / yid dga' bar gyur na lus tshon por gyur zhing chen por 'gyur ro //
translated: the body becomes emaciated, and when the mind is happy, the body becomes plump and strong.

original: yang na ji ltar dbang po med blo min //
analyzed: yang na ji ltar dbang po med blo min //
translated: Or else, how could there be cognition without a sense faculty?

original: de med par ni de dag kyang //üîΩde ltar phan tshun rgyu nyid yin //
analyzed: de med par ni de dag kyang // de ltar phan tshun rgyu nyid yin //
translated: And without that, those also would not exist.üîΩThus they are mutual causes.

original: de phyir phan tshun rgyu can no //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de phyir phan tshun rgyu can no // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Therefore they are mutually caused.

original: gal te yang dbang po med na rtsig pa la sogs pa la blo mi 'byung ba de ltar mig la sogs pa de yang yid kyi mtshan nyid kyi blo med na 'byung ba ma yin pa des na ji ltar mig la sogs pa dang 'brel pa can gyi
analyzed: gal te yang dbang po med na rtsig pa la sogs pa la blo mi 'byung ba de ltar mig la sogs pa de yang yid kyi mtshan nyid kyi blo med na 'byung ba ma yin pa des na ji ltar mig la sogs pa dang 'brel pa can gyi
translated: Here, if cognition does not occur in regard to a wall, etc. without a sense faculty, then those eyes, etc. also would not occur without the cognition that is the characteristic of the mental faculty.üîΩTherefore, just as cognition is related to the eyes, etc.,

original: blo 'am / lus dang 'brel pa can de bzhin du mig la sogs pa'i blo dang 'brel pa can rnams yin no ;
analyzed: blo 'am / lus dang 'brel pa can de bzhin du mig la sogs pa'i blo dang 'brel pa can rnams yin no ;
translated: so the eyes, etc. are related to the cognition of the mental faculty.

original: / de lta na yang phan tshun rgyu nyid yin te /
analyzed: / de lta na yang phan tshun rgyu nyid yin te /
translated: Even so, they are mutual causes.

original: phan tshun rgyur 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: phan tshun rgyur 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: They become mutual causes.

original: de lta bur gyur ba la skyon ci yod ce na /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur ba la skyon ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the error in that?

original: de dag phan tshun rgyu yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de dag phan tshun rgyu yin pa'i phyir //
translated: Because they are mutual causes,

original: dus da ltar bzhin du skye ba dang 'chi ba'i tshe lus dang yid phan tshun rgyu nyid du 'gyur bas 'jig rten pha rol med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dus da ltar bzhin du skye ba dang 'chi ba'i tshe lus dang yid phan tshun rgyu nyid du 'gyur bas 'jig rten pha rol med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Just as now, at the time of birth and death, the body and mind are mutually causal, therefore the world beyond does not not exist.

original: mig la sogs pa dang 'brel pa la gnod pa can brjod kyi lus dang 'brel pa la ni gnod pa med pa ma yin nam thal ches phyir ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa dang 'brel pa la gnod pa can brjod kyi lus dang 'brel pa la ni gnod pa med pa ma yin nam thal ches phyir ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro zhe na ma yin te /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it the case that the refutation of the harm to the connection with the eye, etc. is not the harm to the connection with the body, because it is too much?

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa rang brgyud pa 'jig rten pha rol du 'gro bas skabs su bab pa'i @320b phyir ro //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa rang brgyud pa 'jig rten pha rol du 'gro bas skabs su bab pa'i @320b phyir ro //
translated: No, because the mental consciousness of one‚Äôs own continuum goes to the world beyond.

original: de yang g-yo ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad rang gi rigs la goms pa sngon du 'gro bar bstan to zhe na /
analyzed: de yang g-yo ba la sogs pa'i tha snyad rang gi rigs la goms pa sngon du 'gro bar bstan to zhe na /
translated: And it is taught that the conventions of movement, etc. are preceded by familiarity with one‚Äôs own type.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: rim pa min las rim can min //
analyzed: rim pa min las rim can min //
translated: Not in order, not in sequence,

original: khyad par can min ltos pa'ang min //
analyzed: khyad par can min ltos pa'ang min //
translated: Not special, not dependent,

original: lus la rim pas blor 'gyur na //
analyzed: lus la rim pas blor 'gyur na //
translated: If the mind were in sequence in the body,

original: de yang rim pa gsal bar byed //
analyzed: de yang rim pa gsal bar byed //
translated: That would also make the sequence clear.

original: ces bya ba la yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang 'brel pa'i lus bstan na /
analyzed: ces bya ba la yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang 'brel pa'i lus bstan na /
translated: If the body associated with mental consciousness is taught,

original: lus dbang po dang bcas ba yang bstan pa nyid de /
analyzed: lus dbang po dang bcas ba yang bstan pa nyid de /
translated: then the body together with the sense faculties is taught,

original: yid kyi blo dang 'brel pa'i rigs pa mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid kyi blo dang 'brel pa'i rigs pa mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the reasoning associated with mental cognition is similar.

original: de ltar yang smras pa /
analyzed: de ltar yang smras pa /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: rgyu lus te rtag pa yin nam mi rtag pa yin //
analyzed: rgyu lus te rtag pa yin nam mi rtag pa yin //
translated: Is the cause of the body permanent or impermanent?

original: de la mi rtag pa yin na gang gi phyir rim min las te rim pa yod pa ma yin pa'i lus las rim pa can gyi rnam par shes pa skye ba yod pa ni ma yin te /üîΩrnam par shes pa rim gyis skye pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la mi rtag pa yin na gang gi phyir rim min las te rim pa yod pa ma yin pa'i lus las rim pa can gyi rnam par shes pa skye ba yod pa ni ma yin te / rnam par shes pa rim gyis skye pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is impermanent, then consciousness would not arise from the body in a definite order, because consciousness arises in a definite order.

original: lus rtag pa las yin na ni /
analyzed: lus rtag pa las yin na ni /
translated: If it is permanent,

original: dus rtag tu 'bras bu cig car byed par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus rtag tu 'bras bu cig car byed par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: then the effect would be produced at all times.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi lus rtag pa'i grogs byed pa la ltos pa rgyu nyid yin gyi yan gar ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi lus rtag pa'i grogs byed pa la ltos pa rgyu nyid yin gyi yan gar ba ni ma yin no //
translated: This is so, but the permanent body is a cause that depends on assisting factors, but not by itself.

original: grogs byed pas kyang 'bras bu rim gyis skyed do zhe na 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: grogs byed pas kyang 'bras bu rim gyis skyed do zhe na 'dir smras pa /
translated: If you say that the effect is generated gradually by the friend, here we say:

original: phan 'dogs pa'i yul la rtag pa ste ltos pa ma yin te /
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa'i yul la rtag pa ste ltos pa ma yin te /
translated: The object of benefit is not permanent, i.e., not dependent.

original: de lta bu yin na khyad par can ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: de lta bu yin na khyad par can ma yin pa ste /
translated: If it were, it would not be special, i.e.,

original: 'di la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di la khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it would not be different.

original: 'di'i dgongs pa ni rtag pa'i lus la grogs byed pa ni don gcig byed pas yin nam phul du byung bas 'jog pas yin /
analyzed: 'di'i dgongs pa ni rtag pa'i lus la grogs byed pa ni don gcig byed pas yin nam phul du byung bas 'jog pas yin /
translated: The intended meaning is this: If the friend benefits the permanent body, is it because they perform the same function or because it is the best?

original: de la rtag pa'i grogs byed pa don gcig byed pas yin na /
analyzed: de la rtag pa'i grogs byed pa don gcig byed pas yin na /
translated: If the friend benefits the permanent body because they perform the same function,

original: tshogs pa'i dus bzhin sngar yang dus so sor 'byung pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshogs pa'i dus bzhin sngar yang dus so sor 'byung pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then, like at the time of the collection, it would occur at other times as well.

original: des na de dang 'brel pa'i 'bras bu de'i tshe 'thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na de dang 'brel pa'i 'bras bu de'i tshe 'thob par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, the effect connected with it would be obtained at that time.

original: de ltar tshogs pa nyid kyis skyed ba yin /
analyzed: de ltar tshogs pa nyid kyis skyed ba yin /
translated: In that case, it would be generated by the collection itself.

original: 'on te lhag par gzhag pa yin pa de'i tshe yang rtag par mi 'gyur ba nyid kyis yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on te lhag par gzhag pa yin pa de'i tshe yang rtag par mi 'gyur ba nyid kyis yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But if it is posited as the best, then it would not exist because it would not be permanent.

original: 'gyur na ni mi rtag pa nyid do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: 'gyur na ni mi rtag pa nyid do zhes bshad do //
translated: If it changed, it would be impermanent.

original: 'o na te lus sngar gyi blo la ltos nas rnam par shes pa rim gyis skyed pa de lta na yang lus kyang skad cig ma nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na te lus sngar gyi blo la ltos nas rnam par shes pa rim gyis skyed pa de lta na yang lus kyang skad cig ma nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: But if the body is produced gradually in dependence on the prior cognition, then the body is momentary.

original: de lta bas na lus blo dang lhan cig pa snga ma snga ma'i lus ni blo dang lhan cig skye ba thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na lus blo dang lhan cig pa snga ma snga ma'i lus ni blo dang lhan cig skye ba thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the prior body that is simultaneous with the cognition obtains the body that is simultaneous with the cognition.

original: de lta na ni /
analyzed: de lta na ni /
translated: But if that is so,

original: skad cig snga ma snga ma ni /
analyzed: skad cig snga ma snga ma ni /
translated: then the prior moment

original: so @321a * //üîΩso'i skad cig sngar med de'i //
analyzed: so @321a * // so'i skad cig sngar med de'i //
translated: of the body

original: rgyur 'gyur de yi phyir na rgyu //
analyzed: rgyur 'gyur de yi phyir na rgyu //
translated: is not the cause of the subsequent moment.

original: thams cad du ni mthong bar 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: thams cad du ni mthong bar 'gyur // zhes bya ba la /
translated: If the prior moment of the body were not the cause of the subsequent moment, then the body would not be seen in all its parts.

original: skad cig ma so so snga na med pa ni shes pa dang bcas pa'i lus de'i shes pa dang bcas pa'i lus nyid snga ma snga ma lus kyi skad cig ma rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma so so snga na med pa ni shes pa dang bcas pa'i lus de'i shes pa dang bcas pa'i lus nyid snga ma snga ma lus kyi skad cig ma rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: The prior moment of each momentary body, which is simultaneous with cognition, is the cause of the subsequent moment of the body that is simultaneous with cognition.

original: de bas na dus dbu ma bzhin mthong ba nyid rgyu yin te /
analyzed: de bas na dus dbu ma bzhin mthong ba nyid rgyu yin te /
translated: Therefore, the cause is just what is seen in the middle of the two moments.

original: shes pa dang bcas pa'i lus bskyed ba skye ba dang 'chi ba dag la yod de /
analyzed: shes pa dang bcas pa'i lus bskyed ba skye ba dang 'chi ba dag la yod de /
translated: The body that is simultaneous with cognition is produced in birth and death.

original: 'dis ni lus nyid rgyu yin yang 'jig rten pha rol 'grub po zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni lus nyid rgyu yin yang 'jig rten pha rol 'grub po zhes bstan to //
translated: This shows that even though the body itself is the cause, the establishment of the next world is still possible.

original: 'chi ba'i sems gang yin pa de yang sems gzhan dang nyid mtshams sbyor ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i sems gang yin pa de yang sems gzhan dang nyid mtshams sbyor ba ni ma yin no //
translated: And the mind at death does not link up with another mind.

original: dper na tha ma'i sems bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na tha ma'i sems bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the final mind.

original: 'chi ba'i sems kyang 'chi //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i sems kyang 'chi //
translated: The mind at death dies.

original: 'pho ba'i dus su bdag la sogs pas rnam par shes pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'pho ba'i dus su bdag la sogs pas rnam par shes pa ma yin nam /
translated: At the time of transmigration, is the consciousness not the self and so on?

original: ji ltar 'jig rten pha rol grub ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'jig rten pha rol grub ce na /
translated: How can the next world be established?

original: de'i phyir smras ba tha ma'i sems ni sems gzhan dang mtshams sbyor ba la 'gal ba ci yod ces bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras ba tha ma'i sems ni sems gzhan dang mtshams sbyor ba la 'gal ba ci yod ces bya ba la /
translated: Therefore it is said: What is the contradiction in the final mind linking up with another mind?

original: 'chi ba'i sems ni sems gzhan te /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i sems ni sems gzhan te /
translated: The mind at death is another mind.

original: 'jig rten pha rol por gyur ba dang mtshams sbyor ba la 'gal ba ci zhig yod de /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol por gyur ba dang mtshams sbyor ba la 'gal ba ci zhig yod de /
translated: What is the contradiction in it linking up with the next world?

original: 'di ltar 'chi ba'i sems su 'ang 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'chi ba'i sems su 'ang 'gyur la /
translated: In this way, it is the mind at death.

original: sems gzhan dang mtshams sbyor ba yod par 'gyur ba 'di la 'gal ba ci yod /
analyzed: sems gzhan dang mtshams sbyor ba yod par 'gyur ba 'di la 'gal ba ci yod /
translated: What is the contradiction in its linking up with another mind?

original: 'dis ni the tshom za ba'i ma nges pa nyid bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni the tshom za ba'i ma nges pa nyid bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows that it is uncertain, since it is doubtful.

original: 'on te 'chi ba'i sems gzhan dang nyid mtshams sbyor ba dgra bcom pa la 'gal par mthong ngo zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te 'chi ba'i sems gzhan dang nyid mtshams sbyor ba dgra bcom pa la 'gal par mthong ngo zhe na /
translated: But if you see a contradiction in the mind of death linking with another mind in an arhat,

original: 'dir smras pa /üîΩdgra bcom sems gang de yang ni //
analyzed: 'dir smras pa / dgra bcom sems gang de yang ni //
translated: then here we say:üîΩThe mind of an arhat

original: gang phyir mtshams sbyor med par 'dod//üîΩces bya ba la /
analyzed: gang phyir mtshams sbyor med par 'dod// ces bya ba la /
translated: is not linked with another mind.

original: dgra bcom pa'i tha ma'i sems sems gzhan dang mtshams mi sbyor bar tshad ma gang gis shes pa yin te /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa'i tha ma'i sems sems gzhan dang mtshams mi sbyor bar tshad ma gang gis shes pa yin te /
translated: What valid cognition knows that the final mind of an arhat is not linked with another mind?

original: 'dis ni dpe la bsgrub bya ma tshang bar ston to //
analyzed: 'dis ni dpe la bsgrub bya ma tshang bar ston to //
translated: This shows that the example lacks the property being proven.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is so,

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i 'chi ba'i sems sems gzhan dang mtshams sbyor bar 'gyur pa ma yin par grub pa'i mtha' nyid kyis ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i 'chi ba'i sems sems gzhan dang mtshams sbyor bar 'gyur pa ma yin par grub pa'i mtha' nyid kyis ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: but the treatise itself teaches that the mind of death of one free of attachment is not linked with another mind.üîΩAs it says:

original: ji ltar / sems ni rnam par thar ba na //
analyzed: ji ltar / sems ni rnam par thar ba na //
translated: The mind is liberated

original: mar me bzhin du mya ngan 'da' //üîΩzhes gsungs so zhe na /
analyzed: mar me bzhin du mya ngan 'da' // zhes gsungs so zhe na /
translated: like a flame blown out.üîΩIf you say that this is so,

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: then here we say:

original: tshad mas ma grub don can gyi //
analyzed: tshad mas ma grub don can gyi //
translated: And the meaning of which is not established by valid knowledge.üîΩ

original: grub mtha' don du rtogs sam @321b ci ;üîΩ/ zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: grub mtha' don du rtogs sam @321b ci ; / zhes bya ba la /
translated: ‚ÄúBut how can one understand a tenet system whose content is not established by a valid cognition?‚Äù

original: tshad mas ma grub pa'i don can ni yongs su ma grub pa'i don can gyi grub pa'i mtha'o //
analyzed: tshad mas ma grub pa'i don can ni yongs su ma grub pa'i don can gyi grub pa'i mtha'o //
translated: The content of a tenet system is not established if it is not established by a valid cognition.

original: des ji ltar rtogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: des ji ltar rtogs par 'gyur /
translated: How can one understand a tenet system whose content is not established by a valid cognition?

original: 'di'i don ni grub pa'i mtha' tshad ma yin nam tshad ma ma yin /üîΩde la gal te tshad ma ma yin pa de lta na yang /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni grub pa'i mtha' tshad ma yin nam tshad ma ma yin / de la gal te tshad ma ma yin pa de lta na yang /
translated: The point of this argument is this: Is a tenet system a valid cognition or not?üîΩIf it is not a valid cognition, then how can it be that, as you accept, a mind free from attachment is not connected to another mind?

original: ji ltar grub pa'i mtha' bstan pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems gzhan dang mtshams sbyor bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bzung ba de bzhin du grub pa'i mtha' brjod pa'i bdag la sogs pa'i sems sems gzhan dang mtshams sbyor ro zhes bstan pa 'di yang ci'i phyir gzungüîΩbar mi bya /
analyzed: ji ltar grub pa'i mtha' bstan pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems gzhan dang mtshams sbyor bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bzung ba de bzhin du grub pa'i mtha' brjod pa'i bdag la sogs pa'i sems sems gzhan dang mtshams sbyor ro zhes bstan pa 'di yang ci'i phyir gzung bar mi bya /
translated: In the same way, why do you not accept that the self, etc., expressed in the tenet systems connect to another mind?

original: 'on te de tshad ma ma yin pa de'i tshe 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems mtshams sbyor med do zhes ji ltar shes par bya /
analyzed: 'on te de tshad ma ma yin pa de'i tshe 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems mtshams sbyor med do zhes ji ltar shes par bya /
translated: But if it is not a valid cognition, then how do you know that a mind free from attachment is not connected to another mind?

original: de la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems ni bdag nyid thams cad kyi rgyun chad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems ni bdag nyid thams cad kyi rgyun chad pa ma yin te /
translated: The mind free from attachment is not the cessation of the continuum of all of its own entities.

original: 'on kyang nyon mongs pa rgyun 'chad pa nyid kyi yongs su dag pa'i sems yod do //
analyzed: 'on kyang nyon mongs pa rgyun 'chad pa nyid kyi yongs su dag pa'i sems yod do //
translated: However, the mind that is completely pure, due to the cessation of the continuum of afflictions, exists.

original: mar me bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin gyi thar ba ni phyi rol gyi tshul la yin gyi /üîΩdon dam par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mar me bzhin du mya ngan las 'das pa'i rang bzhin gyi thar ba ni phyi rol gyi tshul la yin gyi / don dam par ni ma yin no //
translated: Like a lamp, nirvana is liberation by the external mode, but not in reality.

original: zhes bshad par bya'o /
analyzed: zhes bshad par bya'o /
translated: This is what should be explained.

original: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa las //
analyzed: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa las //
translated: Commentary on Valid Knowledge

original: bam po bzhi pa /
analyzed: bam po bzhi pa /
translated: Fourth chapter

original: 'dir rgol ba'i lan ni /
analyzed: 'dir rgol ba'i lan ni /
translated: Here, the response to the opponent is:

original: de rgyu ma tshang phyir yin na //
analyzed: de rgyu ma tshang phyir yin na //
translated: If it is because its causes are incomplete,

original: de nyid 'dir ni cis mi brjod //
analyzed: de nyid 'dir ni cis mi brjod //
translated: why is that not stated here?

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: Here, it is said:

original: de ltar 'gyur mod kyi rgyu ni ma rig pa dang sred pa'i mtshan nyid de ma tshang ba'i phyir na 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems de sems gzhan dang mtshams sbyor bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur mod kyi rgyu ni ma rig pa dang sred pa'i mtshan nyid de ma tshang ba'i phyir na 'dod chags dang bral ba'i sems de sems gzhan dang mtshams sbyor bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Although that is so, the mind free from attachment does not link with another mind because its causes are incomplete, those characterized by ignorance and craving.

original: de lta na yang rgyu ma tshad ba de nyid 'dir te bdag cag la sogs pa 'chi ba'i sems la ci'i phyir mi brjod de /
analyzed: de lta na yang rgyu ma tshad ba de nyid 'dir te bdag cag la sogs pa 'chi ba'i sems la ci'i phyir mi brjod de /
translated: But why do you not state that very incomplete cause here, i.e., in the mind at death of us and others?

original: 'chi ba'i sems nyid yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i sems nyid yin pa'i phyir //
translated: Because the mind at death is itself the cause.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ma des pa'i gtan tshigs ci ste 'god par byed /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ma des pa'i gtan tshigs ci ste 'god par byed /
translated: Why do you state a reason that is not established?

original: 'o na rgyu lus kyi mtshan nyid 'chi ba'i dus su ma tshang ba'i phyir rgyur len par byed pa yin no zhe na de yang 'dir lhag par bkod pas ci bya ste /
analyzed: 'o na rgyu lus kyi mtshan nyid 'chi ba'i dus su ma tshang ba'i phyir rgyur len par byed pa yin no zhe na de yang 'dir lhag par bkod pas ci bya ste /
translated: But if you say that the cause is incomplete because the body, which is the cause, is incomplete at the time of death, what can be done if that is stated here?

original: 'on kyang 'chi ba'i sems kho na 'god par bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'chi ba'i sems kho na 'god par bya'o //
translated: But the mind at death alone should be stated.

original: 'on te de ni ma nges pa'i phyir mi 'god na /
analyzed: 'on te de ni ma nges pa'i phyir mi 'god na /
translated: But if you do not state it because it is not ascertained,

original: de lta na yang rgyu ma tshang ba yang ma grub pa'i phyir mtshungs par gtan tshigs ltar snang ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang rgyu ma tshang ba yang ma grub pa'i phyir mtshungs par gtan tshigs ltar snang ba yin no //
translated: then the reason is fallacious because the cause is not established.

original: rgyu ma tshang ba la @322a * //
analyzed: rgyu ma tshang ba la @322a * //
translated: The cause is incomplete.

original: sogs pa gtan tshigs ma grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sogs pa gtan tshigs ma grub pa ma yin te /
translated: The reason is not unestablished.

original: 'di ltar lus nyid dbang po dang bcas pa las sam /
analyzed: 'di ltar lus nyid dbang po dang bcas pa las sam /
translated: Thus, the body itself, together with the faculties, is the cause.

original: dbang po med pa las yin te /üîΩsen mo la sogs pa bzhin yid kyi shes pa skye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po med pa las yin te / sen mo la sogs pa bzhin yid kyi shes pa skye ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not from a sense faculty,üîΩbecause the mental consciousness does not arise from nails, etc.,

original: gang gi phyir snying ga'i phyogs su sems pa rtogs pa'i rnam pa dmigs so zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir snying ga'i phyogs su sems pa rtogs pa'i rnam pa dmigs so zhe na /
translated: You may say that the mental consciousness is perceived in the region of the heart.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: dbang po bcas la yid shes min //
analyzed: dbang po bcas la yid shes min //
translated: The mental consciousness does not arise from a sense faculty,

original: de blo bzhin 'dzin thob phyir ro //üîΩshes bskyed nus pa tha dad phyir //
analyzed: de blo bzhin 'dzin thob phyir ro // shes bskyed nus pa tha dad phyir //
translated: because it is like the intellect and because it is obtained through the obtainment of the mind.

original: thams cad las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: thams cad las ni ma yin no //
translated: It does not arise from all, because the potentials that generate consciousness are different.

original: sems nyid med phyir gzhan las min //
analyzed: sems nyid med phyir gzhan las min //
translated: It does not arise from another, because there is no other mind.

original: rgyu dbyer med pas lhan cig gnas //
analyzed: rgyu dbyer med pas lhan cig gnas //
translated: It coexists with the sense faculties, because the cause is undifferentiated.

original: dbang bzhin gzugs dang ro bzhin no //
analyzed: dbang bzhin gzugs dang ro bzhin no //
translated: It is like a sense faculty and like form and taste.

original: don gyi sgo nas 'gyur pa yin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: don gyi sgo nas 'gyur pa yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is transformed by its object.

original: yid kyi blo'i rgyu mtshan dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus yin nam /
analyzed: yid kyi blo'i rgyu mtshan dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus yin nam /
translated: Here, is the body with sense faculties the cause of mental consciousness?

original: dbang po med pa yin /
analyzed: dbang po med pa yin /
translated: Or is it without sense faculties?

original: re zhig dbang po dang bcas pa ni ma yin no //üîΩde bzhin de dbang po'i blo bzhin no //
analyzed: re zhig dbang po dang bcas pa ni ma yin no // de bzhin de dbang po'i blo bzhin no //
translated: First, it is not with sense faculties.üîΩIt is like the sense consciousnesses.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa nyid 'dzin par 'gyur phyir te /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa nyid 'dzin par 'gyur phyir te /
translated: Because the mental consciousness itself is the appropriator.

original: snang ba thob par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //üîΩdbang po dang bcas pa ni dbang po dang ldan par 'jug pas /
analyzed: snang ba thob par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // dbang po dang bcas pa ni dbang po dang ldan par 'jug pas /
translated: because it would follow that it would be a perception.

original: dbang po'i lus so //
analyzed: dbang po'i lus so //
translated: The body with faculties is the body that is engaged with faculties.

original: de'i phyir yid kyi rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir yid kyi rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the mental consciousness does not arise from the body with faculties.

original: ji ltar mig gi stobs kyis skyes par gyur pa gsal bar snang ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar mig gi stobs kyis skyes par gyur pa gsal bar snang ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the eye consciousness arises from the power of the eye and is clear and manifest,

original: mig las skyes pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa gsal bar snang bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mig las skyes pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa gsal bar snang bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: in the same way, the mental consciousness that arises from the eye is clear and manifest. This is the meaning.

original: rgyu gcig nyid las mtshan nyid mi mthun pas 'bras bu nye bar bskyed pa ni mthong ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: rgyu gcig nyid las mtshan nyid mi mthun pas 'bras bu nye bar bskyed pa ni mthong ba ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it seen that a single cause produces effects that are not similar in type?

original: dper na me ni du ba dang thal ba skyed par byed pa na tshogs de'i dbye bas yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na me ni du ba dang thal ba skyed par byed pa na tshogs de'i dbye bas yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, fire produces smoke and ash, but it is not seen that it produces water.

original: de la gzugs kyis phan 'dogs pa'i mig gsal bar so sor snang ba'i shes pa skye la mig gzugs dang bral ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa skyed par byed do //
analyzed: de la gzugs kyis phan 'dogs pa'i mig gsal bar so sor snang ba'i shes pa skye la mig gzugs dang bral ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa skyed par byed do //
translated: The eye consciousness arises clearly and distinctly, assisted by the form. The mental consciousness arises when the eye is separated from the form.

original: de bzhin du rna ba la yang blta bar bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba la yang blta bar bya'o zhe na /
translated: The same should be said of the ear.

original: de ni bden pa ma yin te mig gi rjes su 'brangs pa'i shes pa dbang po las skyes pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni bden pa ma yin te mig gi rjes su 'brangs pa'i shes pa dbang po las skyes pa yin te /
translated: This is not true. The consciousness that follows the eye is born from the faculty.

original: dbang po la ni yid kyi shes pa'i byed pa med na /
analyzed: dbang po la ni yid kyi shes pa'i byed pa med na /
translated: The mental consciousness has no function in the faculty.

original: de ji ltar yid kyi rnam par shes pa dbang pos skyed pa yin /
analyzed: de ji ltar yid kyi rnam par shes pa dbang pos skyed pa yin /
translated: How can the mental consciousness be born from the faculty?

original: de'i blo bzhin du 'dzin pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i blo bzhin du 'dzin pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is said that it obtains the object as the eye consciousness does.

original: dbang po'i byed pa'i rjes su 'brang ba la ni mig @322b gi blo yis don 'dzin pa yin no zhes tha snyad 'dogs so //
analyzed: dbang po'i byed pa'i rjes su 'brang ba la ni mig @322b gi blo yis don 'dzin pa yin no zhes tha snyad 'dogs so //
translated: It is said that the consciousness that follows the faculty apprehends the object with the eye consciousness.

original: gal te yid kyi blo yang dbang po las skye na /
analyzed: gal te yid kyi blo yang dbang po las skye na /
translated: If the mental consciousness is born from the faculty,

original: mig gi shes pa bzhin du dbang po la brten nas don rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: mig gi shes pa bzhin du dbang po la brten nas don rtogs pa yin no //
translated: it would apprehend the object in dependence on the faculty, as does the eye consciousness.

original: dbang po'i bya ba dang bral na /
analyzed: dbang po'i bya ba dang bral na /
translated: If it is devoid of the activity of the sense faculty,

original: ji ltar yid kyi shes pa dbang po las skyes zhes brjod par bya /
analyzed: ji ltar yid kyi shes pa dbang po las skyes zhes brjod par bya /
translated: how can it be said that the mental consciousness arises from the sense faculty?

original: mig gi byed pa yang yid la mi dmigs te /
analyzed: mig gi byed pa yang yid la mi dmigs te /
translated: The activity of the eye is not perceived in the mental faculty.

original: des na dbang po la skyes pa ni yid kyi shes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na dbang po la skyes pa ni yid kyi shes pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the mental consciousness does not arise from the sense faculty.

original: de dag gis ni so sor dbang po las skyes pa ma yin no zhes bya bar bstan to //
analyzed: de dag gis ni so sor dbang po las skyes pa ma yin no zhes bya bar bstan to //
translated: This shows that it does not arise from each sense faculty.

original: de ltar 'gyur mod kyi mig la sogs pa'i tshogs pa las yid kyi rnam par shes pa skye par 'gyur ro zhe na thams cad las kyang ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur mod kyi mig la sogs pa'i tshogs pa las yid kyi rnam par shes pa skye par 'gyur ro zhe na thams cad las kyang ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: If you say that the mental consciousness arises from the collection of the eye and so on, then it would arise from everything, because it does not arise from the collection of the sense faculties and so on.

original: dbang po la sogs pa'i tshogs 'dus pa las kyang yid kyi shes pa skye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa'i tshogs 'dus pa las kyang yid kyi shes pa skye ba ma yin no //
translated: The mental consciousness does not arise from the collection of the sense faculties and so on.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: shes pa skyed pa'i nus pa tha dad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: shes pa skyed pa'i nus pa tha dad pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the capacity to generate consciousness is distinct.

original: shes pa skyed pa'i nus pa so sor tha dad pa ste /
analyzed: shes pa skyed pa'i nus pa so sor tha dad pa ste /
translated: The capacity to generate consciousness is distinct for each.

original: phan tshun ltos pa med par mig la sogs pa la mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun ltos pa med par mig la sogs pa la mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the eye and so on are seen to be mutually independent.

original: gang du sa la sogs pa'i tshogs pa las 'bras bu skyed pa de nyid du rgyu gcig dang bral na 'bras bu 'byung ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang du sa la sogs pa'i tshogs pa las 'bras bu skyed pa de nyid du rgyu gcig dang bral na 'bras bu 'byung ba ni ma yin no //
translated: In whatever place an effect is produced from an assemblage of earth, etc., if one cause is absent, the effect does not occur.üîΩIf consciousness arises from the mere assemblage of eye, etc., it would not arise if any one of them were absent.

original: mig la sogs pa 'dus pa nyid las shes pa skye na ni re re dang bral bas mi skye ba'i phyir dbang po re re ba dang bral yang /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa 'dus pa nyid las shes pa skye na ni re re dang bral bas mi skye ba'i phyir dbang po re re ba dang bral yang /
translated: Even though one sense faculty is absent, consciousness arises from another sense faculty.

original: dbang po gzhan las shes pa dang // yid kyi blo mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: dbang po gzhan las shes pa dang // yid kyi blo mthong ba yin no //
translated: The mind and mental activities are seen to arise from the mind.

original: des na tshogs pa las kyang mi skye'o //
analyzed: des na tshogs pa las kyang mi skye'o //
translated: Therefore, consciousness does not arise from an assemblage.

original: kyang gi sgras ni gtan tshigs snga ma gzung ngo //
analyzed: kyang gi sgras ni gtan tshigs snga ma gzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúeven‚Äù is meant to include the previous reason.

original: 'on te yid kyi rnam par shes pa sems med pa'i lus las 'byung ba de'i tshe sems med pa'i phyir rgyu mtshan gzhan las yid kyi rnam par shes pa skye ba ma yin no zhes zer na /
analyzed: 'on te yid kyi rnam par shes pa sems med pa'i lus las 'byung ba de'i tshe sems med pa'i phyir rgyu mtshan gzhan las yid kyi rnam par shes pa skye ba ma yin no zhes zer na /
translated: If mental consciousness arises from a body that is without mind, then mental consciousness does not arise from another condition, because it is without mind.

original: 'o na te sems med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don ni gal te dbang po'i shes pa dang bral ba'i phyir yin na /
analyzed: 'o na te sems med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don ni gal te dbang po'i shes pa dang bral ba'i phyir yin na /
translated: If the meaning of ‚Äúbecause it is without mind‚Äù is that it is because it is without sense consciousness,üîΩthen that is not so.

original: de ni 'dod pa nyid de /
analyzed: de ni 'dod pa nyid de /
translated: That is the thesis.

original: 'di ltar dbang po'i shes pa dang bral par gyur na /
analyzed: 'di ltar dbang po'i shes pa dang bral par gyur na /
translated: If the tactile faculty is absent,

original: de'i shes pa sgra dang sen mo la sogs pa mi skye ste /
analyzed: de'i shes pa sgra dang sen mo la sogs pa mi skye ste /
translated: the tactile consciousness does not arise in relation to sound, nails, etc.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni skye'o //
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni skye'o //
translated: But the mental consciousness does arise.

original: 'o na te yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang bral ba'i phyir yin na /
analyzed: 'o na te yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang bral ba'i phyir yin na /
translated: If you maintain that the tactile faculty is absent because the mental consciousness is absent,

original: de lta na yang skra la sogs pa la yid kyi shes pa med pa ni bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta na yang skra la sogs pa la yid kyi shes pa med pa ni bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: then you must prove that the mental consciousness does not exist in relation to hair, nails, etc.

original: yid kyi shes pa dang bral ba ni gtan @323a * //
analyzed: yid kyi shes pa dang bral ba ni gtan @323a * //
translated: But if you maintain that the mental consciousness is absent because the tactile faculty is absent,

original: tshigs yin pa'i phyir dam bca' pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig gis ma grub bo zhe na /
analyzed: tshigs yin pa'i phyir dam bca' pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig gis ma grub bo zhe na /
translated: then the reason is not established in one part of the proposition.

original: 'dir smras pa ji ltar sems pa po reg pa la sogs pas dmigs pa na de shes pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa ji ltar sems pa po reg pa la sogs pas dmigs pa na de shes pa yin te /
translated: Here we say: When the thinker is perceived by contact, etc., he is known.

original: de bzhin du yid kyi rnam par shes pas /
analyzed: de bzhin du yid kyi rnam par shes pas /
translated: In the same way, the mental consciousness

original: skra dang / sen mo la sogs pa la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: skra dang / sen mo la sogs pa la ni ma yin te /
translated: is not in relation to hair, nails, etc.

original: de dang 'brel pa nyid kyis de med na yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dang 'brel pa nyid kyis de med na yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of the connection, if that is absent, the mental consciousness is also absent.

original: sen mo btab na yid 'khrugs par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: sen mo btab na yid 'khrugs par 'gyur bas /
translated: If you cut your nails, your mind becomes disturbed.

original: gal te yid kyi rnam par shes pa lus la brten pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te yid kyi rnam par shes pa lus la brten pa ma yin na /
translated: If mental consciousness does not depend on the body,

original: ji ltar lus dang / sems dag lhan cig par 'gyur ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar lus dang / sems dag lhan cig par 'gyur ba yin zhe na /
translated: how can the body and mind be simultaneous?

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, the opponent might say,

original: las zhes bya ba'i rgyu de dang lhan cig gnas pa nges pa'i rgyu tha dad pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: las zhes bya ba'i rgyu de dang lhan cig gnas pa nges pa'i rgyu tha dad pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: the cause called karma and the cause that definitely endures simultaneously are not different.

original: lus dang sems lhan cig gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: lus dang sems lhan cig gnas pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the body and mind endure simultaneously.

original: dbang po bzhin dang / gzugs dang ro bzhin te /
analyzed: dbang po bzhin dang / gzugs dang ro bzhin te /
translated: This is like the case of the sense faculties and form and taste.

original: ji ltar dbang po rnams dang / gzugs dang / ro dag ni phan tshun bsten pa ma yin yang /
analyzed: ji ltar dbang po rnams dang / gzugs dang / ro dag ni phan tshun bsten pa ma yin yang /
translated: Just as the sense faculties and form and taste do not mutually rely on each other,

original: rgyu tha dad med pas dus cung zad cig lhan cig gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu tha dad med pas dus cung zad cig lhan cig gnas pa yin no //
translated: but because they are not different causes, they endure for a short time simultaneously.

original: de la gal te yid kyi blor gyur pas dbang po'i 'gyur ba de'i 'gyur ba de ni /
analyzed: de la gal te yid kyi blor gyur pas dbang po'i 'gyur ba de'i 'gyur ba de ni /
translated: If the mental consciousness is the transformation of the sense faculty, that transformation of the sense faculty

original: mig la sogs pa de la brten pa yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa de la brten pa yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: depends on the eye and so on.

original: bad kan la sogs pas lus gyur ba na /
analyzed: bad kan la sogs pas lus gyur ba na /
translated: When the body is transformed by phlegm and so on,üîΩthe eye and so on are transformed.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang 'gyur ba'i phyir yid de la brten par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang 'gyur ba'i phyir yid de la brten par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: and the mental consciousness also changes, so the mental faculty is supported by that.

original: de'i phyir don gyi sgo nas zhes bya ba smos te don ni gzung ba ste /üîΩmtshon cha la sogs pa btab pa'i sgo nas te /
analyzed: de'i phyir don gyi sgo nas zhes bya ba smos te don ni gzung ba ste / mtshon cha la sogs pa btab pa'i sgo nas te /
translated: Therefore, the root text states, ‚Äúin terms of object.‚Äù The object is the object of apprehension.üîΩIt is the object of the mental faculty, which is the object of the mental consciousness.

original: lus 'gyur ba byed pa brten pa med na yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus 'gyur ba byed pa brten pa med na yang 'gyur ro //
translated: The body changes when it is struck by a weapon, etc., even though the support does not change.

original: 'di'i dgongs pa ni ral gri la sogs pas btab pa'i lus gyur pas yid 'gyur bar yang dmigs so //üîΩyid 'gyur ba tsam gyis ni brten par 'jog pa ma yin nam / khrag la sogs pa mthong ba tsam gyis kyang rang bzhin gyis sngar ma'i yid 'gyur bar mthong ba'i phyir yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di'i dgongs pa ni ral gri la sogs pas btab pa'i lus gyur pas yid 'gyur bar yang dmigs so // yid 'gyur ba tsam gyis ni brten par 'jog pa ma yin nam / khrag la sogs pa mthong ba tsam gyis kyang rang bzhin gyis sngar ma'i yid 'gyur bar mthong ba'i phyir yin gyi /
translated: The intended meaning is that the mental faculty changes when the body changes when it is struck by a sword, etc.üîΩBut is it not the case that the mental faculty is not posited as supported by the body merely because it changes?

original: phyi rol gyi khrag tsam la yid brten pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi khrag tsam la yid brten pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The mental faculty is seen to change naturally when blood, etc., is seen, but the mental faculty is not supported by external blood, etc.

original: gzhan yang lus gyur na rnam par shes pa 'gyur ba ni rgyur gyur pa yin nam phan 'dogs pas yin grang na /
analyzed: gzhan yang lus gyur na rnam par shes pa 'gyur ba ni rgyur gyur pa yin nam phan 'dogs pas yin grang na /
translated: Moreover, if the mental faculty changes when the body changes, is it the cause of the change or is it supported by the body?

original: de la rgyu nyid kyis ni lus yid kyi rnam par shes pa zlog par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la rgyu nyid kyis ni lus yid kyi rnam par shes pa zlog par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The cause itself does not stop the body and mental consciousness.

original: rgyu nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not the cause.

original: de nyid smras pa /
analyzed: de nyid smras pa /
translated: He says just that:

original: gang zhig yod nyid @323b phan 'dogs byed //
analyzed: gang zhig yod nyid @323b phan 'dogs byed //
translated: If the cause of existence assists existence,

original: rtag tu de ni rjes 'jug phyir //üîΩde rgyu bdun pa dang da las //
analyzed: rtag tu de ni rjes 'jug phyir // de rgyu bdun pa dang da las //
translated: because it always follows it,üîΩit is said to be the cause of

original: skye ba zhes ni brjod pa yin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: skye ba zhes ni brjod pa yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: the arising of the sevenfold effect.

original: gal te rgyu ldog par byed pa po gang zhig yod pa nyid phan 'dogs par byed pa'i 'bras bu de ldog pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: gal te rgyu ldog par byed pa po gang zhig yod pa nyid phan 'dogs par byed pa'i 'bras bu de ldog pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: If the cause of cessation is the cause of the cessation of the effect, then the cause of existence is the cause of the existence of the effect.üîΩIf the cause of existence assists existence, because it always follows it,

original: ji ltar yod pa nyid phan 'dogs pa yin zhe na rtag tu de'i rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir te 'bras bu'i rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar yod pa nyid phan 'dogs pa yin zhe na rtag tu de'i rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir te 'bras bu'i rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it follows the effect.

original: rjes su 'jug pa ni 'brang ba'o //üîΩrtag tu ni rgyu na du'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'jug pa ni 'brang ba'o // rtag tu ni rgyu na du'o //
translated: Following means pursuing.üîΩAlways means while the cause exists.

original: rgyu gang zhig yod pa nyid phan 'dogs pa na rtag tu 'bras bu'i rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ni rgyu yin no //
analyzed: rgyu gang zhig yod pa nyid phan 'dogs pa na rtag tu 'bras bu'i rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ni rgyu yin no //
translated: That cause which assists existence is the cause because it always follows the effect.

original: de log na 'bras bu yang ldog par byed de /
analyzed: de log na 'bras bu yang ldog par byed de /
translated: If that is stopped, the effect is also stopped.

original: gang zhig res 'ga' phan 'dogs pa de med na /
analyzed: gang zhig res 'ga' phan 'dogs pa de med na /
translated: If that which sometimes benefits were not to exist,

original: gzhan du res 'ga' phan 'dogs nus pa der 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gzhan du res 'ga' phan 'dogs nus pa der 'gyur gyi /
translated: then something else would sometimes be able to benefit.

original: de nyid ldog par byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid ldog par byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not that very thing that is stopped.

original: dper na phul du byung ba'i rgyu 'bras s'a lu la sogs pa'i rgyu sa bon log par byed pa ma yin pa de bzhin du ;üîΩlus rnam par shes pa'i 'bras bu med pa ni lus kyi 'gyur ba med na yang sngar gyi sems tsam 'gyur ba las /
analyzed: dper na phul du byung ba'i rgyu 'bras s'a lu la sogs pa'i rgyu sa bon log par byed pa ma yin pa de bzhin du ; lus rnam par shes pa'i 'bras bu med pa ni lus kyi 'gyur ba med na yang sngar gyi sems tsam 'gyur ba las /
translated: For example, the seed that is the cause of the most excellent result, such as rice, is not stopped.

original: res 'ga' 'gyur ba mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: res 'ga' 'gyur ba mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In the same way, the body is not the result of consciousness, because even when the body does not change, sometimes a change is seen due to a change in the mind alone.

original: de lta bas na lus kyi yod pa nyid yid kyi rnam par shes pa las phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na lus kyi yod pa nyid yid kyi rnam par shes pa las phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the existence of the body does not benefit mental consciousness.

original: 'di ltar lus yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu nyid yin na /
analyzed: 'di ltar lus yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu nyid yin na /
translated: In this way, if the body were the cause of mental consciousness,

original: shes pa skyes nas shes sam /üîΩde las ma skyes par yin /
analyzed: shes pa skyes nas shes sam / de las ma skyes par yin /
translated: would consciousness arise from it or not?

original: de las ma skyes pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de las ma skyes pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not that it does not arise from it.

original: rnam par shes pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because consciousness itself does not exist.

original: shes pa skyes nas kyang rgyu lus las yid kyi rnam par shes pa can skye bar shes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa skyes nas kyang rgyu lus las yid kyi rnam par shes pa can skye bar shes pa ma yin no //
translated: Even if consciousness were produced, it would not be consciousness that arises from the cause, the body, and possesses mental consciousness.

original: da 'am bdag gi rang bzhin la rang la dmigs nas /
analyzed: da 'am bdag gi rang bzhin la rang la dmigs nas /
translated: Now, having observed the nature of the self,

original: rnam par rtog gi de la ma dmigs pa'i shes pa gzhan 'dzin pa ma yin te thal ches pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog gi de la ma dmigs pa'i shes pa gzhan 'dzin pa ma yin te thal ches pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is conceptual, but it is not another consciousness that apprehends it without observing it, because that is absurd.

original: 'on te mi gzhan gyi rnam par shes pa las sngar gyi lus shes pa nas /
analyzed: 'on te mi gzhan gyi rnam par shes pa las sngar gyi lus shes pa nas /
translated: If it is said that the consciousness of the body of another person is prior to the consciousness of one‚Äôs own body,

original: de las lus la shes pa so sor nges pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de las lus la shes pa so sor nges pa yin no zhe na /
translated: then the consciousness of the body is individually ascertained from that.

original: gang du skyes bu gzhan gyis pha rol gyi lus dmigs pa de ru pha rol gyi shes pa dmigs na yang pha rol gyi shes pa las the tshom za ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gang du skyes bu gzhan gyis pha rol gyi lus dmigs pa de ru pha rol gyi shes pa dmigs na yang pha rol gyi shes pa las the tshom za ba ma yin nam /
translated: If the body of another person is observed in a place where another person is born, and if the consciousness of another person is observed there, is the consciousness of another person doubted?

original: dper na gnyid log pa'i 'bras bu lus ni mthong ba las /
analyzed: dper na gnyid log pa'i 'bras bu lus ni mthong ba las /
translated: For example, from seeing the body of a sleeping person,

original: gnyid log pa'i shes pa la @324a * //
analyzed: gnyid log pa'i shes pa la @324a * //
translated: the consciousness of a sleeping person

original: the tshom za ba bzhin no //
analyzed: the tshom za ba bzhin no //
translated: is doubted.

original: de bas na pha rol gyis kyang shes pa lus kyi 'bras bur mi rtogs so //
analyzed: de bas na pha rol gyis kyang shes pa lus kyi 'bras bur mi rtogs so //
translated: Therefore, the other party does not understand consciousness to be the effect of the body.üîΩRice grows from heavy

original: lci ba las s'a lu skye ba yang /
analyzed: lci ba las s'a lu skye ba yang /
translated: nutriment.

original: lci ba'i yod pa nyid phan 'dogs par byed pas s'a lu'i rjes su 'brang ba ma yin te /
analyzed: lci ba'i yod pa nyid phan 'dogs par byed pas s'a lu'i rjes su 'brang ba ma yin te /
translated: But the existence of heavy nutriment is not the cause of rice, because it is not a condition that is concomitant with rice.

original: de lta na yang lci ba med par s'a lu'i dngos po yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na yang lci ba med par s'a lu'i dngos po yod pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it the case that rice exists without heavy nutriment?

original: de ni mi bden te /
analyzed: de ni mi bden te /
translated: That is not so.

original: ji ltar lci ba las s'a lu skye ba de bzhin du de nyid las s'a lu skye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar lci ba las s'a lu skye ba de bzhin du de nyid las s'a lu skye ba ma yin no //
translated: Just as rice grows from heavy nutriment, it does not grow from that itself.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni g-yer bag dang ldan pa /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni g-yer bag dang ldan pa /
translated: Mental consciousness is fickle.

original: skye ba 'di dang phyi ma la nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skye ba 'di dang phyi ma la nges pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not certain in this life or the next.

original: 'di yod pas 'di yod pa 'di skyes pas 'di skye ba rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'di yod pas 'di yod pa 'di skyes pas 'di skye ba rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt the characteristic of cause and effect that when this exists, that exists, and when this arises, that arises?

original: de'i ji ltar 'gal ba med pa'i mtshan nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: de'i ji ltar 'gal ba med pa'i mtshan nyid yin zhe na /
translated: How can it be a characteristic that is not contradictory?

original: smras pa / rtag tu phan 'dogs par byed pas bdun par brjod de /
analyzed: smras pa / rtag tu phan 'dogs par byed pas bdun par brjod de /
translated: We say: It is called the seventh because it always benefits.

original: 'di yod pas 'di yod cing /
analyzed: 'di yod pas 'di yod cing /
translated: When this exists, that exists.

original: 'di skyes ba las 'di skye zhes lnga pas rtag tu 'jug par brjod do //
analyzed: 'di skyes ba las 'di skye zhes lnga pas rtag tu 'jug par brjod do //
translated: The fifth [link] is said to be the constant engagement of the fourth [link], the karmic forces, in the production of the sixth [link], consciousness.

original: de bas na lnga pa bdun pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'gal ba med de don gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bas na lnga pa bdun pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'gal ba med de don gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, there is no contradiction in the fifth [link] having the characteristic of the seventh [link], because they have the same meaning.

original: 'on te yid kyi rnam par shes pa la phan 'dogs par byed pas lus ldog par byed pa po yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te yid kyi rnam par shes pa la phan 'dogs par byed pas lus ldog par byed pa po yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the body is the agent that turns back the mental consciousness because it helps it,

original: de la smras pa /
analyzed: de la smras pa /
translated: we reply:

original: bum sogs la ni me sogs bzhin //üîΩ'ga' zhig tshe na sems rgyun la //
analyzed: bum sogs la ni me sogs bzhin // 'ga' zhig tshe na sems rgyun la //
translated: Like fire, etc., with respect to a pot, etc.üîΩIt is easy to see that sometimes

original: phan 'dogs byed pa'ang yin sla ste //
analyzed: phan 'dogs byed pa'ang yin sla ste //
translated: the body helps the stream of consciousness.

original: de tsam gyis ni ldog ma yin //
analyzed: de tsam gyis ni ldog ma yin //
translated: But that alone does not turn back the consciousness.

original: zhes bya ba la shes pa la phan 'dogs par byed pa lus yin mod kyi /üîΩde lta na yang lus la sogs pa de tsam gyis te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la shes pa la phan 'dogs par byed pa lus yin mod kyi / de lta na yang lus la sogs pa de tsam gyis te /
translated: The body does help the consciousness, but

original: phan 'dogs btsam gyis rnam par shes pa ldog pa ni ma yin no //
