analyzed: phan 'dogs btsam gyis rnam par shes pa ldog pa ni ma yin no //
translated: even so, the consciousness is not turned back by the body, etc., by that alone,üîΩby mere help.

original: dper na bum pa la sogs phan 'dogs par byed pa me yin pas dmar po la sogs pa'i yon tan 'jog par byed pa de lta na yang ldog par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na bum pa la sogs phan 'dogs par byed pa me yin pas dmar po la sogs pa'i yon tan 'jog par byed pa de lta na yang ldog par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: For example, fire is beneficial to a pot, etc., and it is the cause of the qualities of redness, etc., but it is not the cause of their cessation.

original: 'di la brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di la brjod par bya ste /
translated: Here we say:

original: lus la gnas pa yin na sems /
analyzed: lus la gnas pa yin na sems /
translated: If the body is the cause of consciousness,

original: ldog pa med par thal phyir ro //
analyzed: ldog pa med par thal phyir ro //
translated: then consciousness would not cease.üîΩBecause it would exist as long as the body exists,

original: de yod yod dang dbang 'gyur phyir //üîΩde las 'byung rngub de ma yin //
analyzed: de yod yod dang dbang 'gyur phyir // de las 'byung rngub de ma yin //
translated: and because it would be controlled by the body.

original: zhes bya ba la /üîΩgal te rnam par shes pa'i rgyu lus yin pa de lta na yang lus la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la / gal te rnam par shes pa'i rgyu lus yin pa de lta na yang lus la gnas pa ste /
translated: Exhalation and inhalation do not arise from that.

original: rten yin yang sems ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rten yin yang sems ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the body is the cause of consciousness, then consciousness would not cease even if the body is the basis, i.e., the support.

original: 'byung ba dang rngub ba ni sems kyi rgyu ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang rngub ba ni sems kyi rgyu ma yin nam /
translated: Are not exhalation and inhalation the cause of consciousness?

original: de'i phyir 'chi ba'i lus la 'byung ba dang rngub pa ma @324b tshang na /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'chi ba'i lus la 'byung ba dang rngub pa ma @324b tshang na /
translated: Therefore, if exhalation and inhalation do not exist in the body of one who is dying,

original: rnam par shes pa ldog pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ldog pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: then consciousness ceases.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: 'byung ba dang 'jug pa ni sems de nyid las yin pa de bas na /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'jug pa ni sems de nyid las yin pa de bas na /
translated: Exhalation and inhalation arise from that very consciousness. Therefore,

original: 'jug pa la sogs pa sems de med na ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jug pa la sogs pa sems de med na ma yin no //
translated: and the other mental activities do not occur without mind.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: de yod na yod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de yod na yod pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they exist when mind exists.

original: sems yod na 'byung ba dang rngub pa yod pa dang / sems med na med pa de bas na 'byung ba dang rngub pa de ni sems dang 'brel pa'o zhes bya bar nges pa yin no //
analyzed: sems yod na 'byung ba dang rngub pa yod pa dang / sems med na med pa de bas na 'byung ba dang rngub pa de ni sems dang 'brel pa'o zhes bya bar nges pa yin no //
translated: Exhalation and inhalation occur when mind exists and do not occur when mind is absent. Therefore, it is certain that exhalation and inhalation are associated with mind.

original: dbang du gyur pa'i yang phyir te /
analyzed: dbang du gyur pa'i yang phyir te /
translated: They are also under the control of mind.

original: 'byung ba dang 'jug pa sems kyis ma bskyed na ni de'i tshe dbang du mi 'gyur ba las 'byung ba dang 'jug pa dag sems kyi dbang du gyur par dmigs so //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'jug pa sems kyis ma bskyed na ni de'i tshe dbang du mi 'gyur ba las 'byung ba dang 'jug pa dag sems kyi dbang du gyur par dmigs so //
translated: If exhalation and inhalation were not generated by mind, they would not be under the control of mind. But it is observed that exhalation and inhalation are under the control of mind.

original: gal te yang 'byung ba dang 'jug pa dag rgyu gzhan dag las skye ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te yang 'byung ba dang 'jug pa dag rgyu gzhan dag las skye ba yin na /
translated: If exhalation and inhalation were generated by other causes,

original: sems la rag las par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems la rag las par mi 'gyur te /
translated: they would not depend on mind.

original: sems kyi dngos po ni rgyu gzhan dang 'brel pa la dbang du byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sems kyi dngos po ni rgyu gzhan dang 'brel pa la dbang du byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The nature of mind does not control something that is related to another cause.

original: 'on te 'byung ba dang 'jug pa rgyu gzhan las skye bas sems las nges pa ma yin te /üîΩdper na jo bos khol po bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te 'byung ba dang 'jug pa rgyu gzhan las skye bas sems las nges pa ma yin te / dper na jo bos khol po bzhin no zhe na /
translated: But if you think that since the arising and entering of the mind arise from other causes, it is not certain that they are mental factors,

original: de ni bden pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bden pa ma yin te /
translated: like a master and his servant, that is not so.

original: khol por gyur pa'i skye ba ni /
analyzed: khol por gyur pa'i skye ba ni /
translated: Because the birth of a servant

original: rgyu gzhan las skyes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu gzhan las skyes pa'i phyir /
translated: arises from other causes.

original: jo pos bskyed pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: jo pos bskyed pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not generated by a master.

original: 'byung ba dang 'jug pa ni sems ma gtogs par mi skye ba'i phyir sems dang 'brel pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'jug pa ni sems ma gtogs par mi skye ba'i phyir sems dang 'brel pa nyid do //
translated: But because the arising and entering of the mind do not arise without the mind, they are related to the mind.

original: gnyid lag pa'i tshe yang 'byung ba dang / 'jug pa yod na de la sems med pa'i phyir de dag ji ltar sems dang 'brel par 'gyur snyam du sems na /
analyzed: gnyid lag pa'i tshe yang 'byung ba dang / 'jug pa yod na de la sems med pa'i phyir de dag ji ltar sems dang 'brel par 'gyur snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that when there is arising and entering of the mind during sleep and fainting, since there is no mind, how could they be related to the mind,

original: de ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: sdur pa drag po la sogs pa'i 'gyur ba thams cad sngon gyi rnam par shes pa'i bag chags kyi khyad par gyi rjes su 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: sdur pa drag po la sogs pa'i 'gyur ba thams cad sngon gyi rnam par shes pa'i bag chags kyi khyad par gyi rjes su 'gro ba ste /
translated: All changes such as intense pain are the result of the specific latent propensities of previous consciousness.

original: 'di ltar dbugs gzhan pa la goms pas rmi lam du gzhan par rgyu zhing /
analyzed: 'di ltar dbugs gzhan pa la goms pas rmi lam du gzhan par rgyu zhing /
translated: Thus, through habituation to other breathing, one dreams of moving to another place.

original: shin tu ring ba la goms pas dbugs ring bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shin tu ring ba la goms pas dbugs ring bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Since one is accustomed to the very long, the breath becomes long.

original: de la smras pa /
analyzed: de la smras pa /
translated: In response to that, it is said:

original: dbugs 'byin pa dang 'dren pa de'i //
analyzed: dbugs 'byin pa dang 'dren pa de'i //
translated: Exhalation and inhalation

original: 'bad rtsol med par gang las 'byung //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'bad rtsol med par gang las 'byung // zhes bya ba la /
translated: arise without effort.

original: gal te srog dang rtsol ba'i 'bras bu sems yin na de'i tshe 'byung ba dang rngub pa dang spro ba dang / 'dren pa dag de'i 'bad rtsol med par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te srog dang rtsol ba'i 'bras bu sems yin na de'i tshe 'byung ba dang rngub pa dang spro ba dang / 'dren pa dag de'i 'bad rtsol med par 'gyur na /
translated: If the result of the prƒÅ·πáa and ƒÅyƒÅma is the mind, then at that time exhalation and inhalation, expansion and contraction would be without effort.

original: de ltar rtsol ba med par 'byin pa dang / 'dren pa ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar rtsol ba med par 'byin pa dang / 'dren pa ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because exhalation and inhalation without effort are not seen.

original: 'on te spro ba dang / @325a * //
analyzed: 'on te spro ba dang / @325a * //
translated: Or, if expansion and contraction depend on effort,

original: 'dren pa'i 'byung ba dang / rngub pa dag rtsol ba la rag lus kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dren pa'i 'byung ba dang / rngub pa dag rtsol ba la rag lus kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin te /
translated: the inhalation and exhalation are not of the nature of effort,

original: de rgyu gzhan las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rgyu gzhan las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they arise from another cause.

original: de'i phyir 'byung ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid ni sems la ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'byung ba la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid ni sems la ma yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the nature of inhalation and so on is not the mind,

original: sems la 'dren pa dang spro ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: sems la 'dren pa dang spro ba yin no zhe na /
translated: but the mind is expanded and contracted.

original: rlung rten pa rgyu yin nam /
analyzed: rlung rten pa rgyu yin nam /
translated: Is the support of the wind the cause?

original: ma yin par brtag na /
analyzed: ma yin par brtag na /
translated: If you imagine that it is not so,

original: gal te rgyu ma yin na de'i tshe rnam par shes pa mi 'ga' par 'gyur te lus yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te rgyu ma yin na de'i tshe rnam par shes pa mi 'ga' par 'gyur te lus yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: if it is not the cause, then consciousness would not be interrupted, because the body exists.

original: 'on te rlung rten pa shes pa'i rgyu yin na /
analyzed: 'on te rlung rten pa shes pa'i rgyu yin na /
translated: But if the wind that is the support is the cause of consciousness,

original: de lta na yang shi pa'i lus la yang rlung rten pa'i rang bzhin yod pas /
analyzed: de lta na yang shi pa'i lus la yang rlung rten pa'i rang bzhin yod pas /
translated: then even in the dead body, the nature of the wind that is the support exists,

original: 'byung 'jug ni rlung rten pa'i 'bras bu ste ;
analyzed: 'byung 'jug ni rlung rten pa'i 'bras bu ste ;
translated: and the inhalation and exhalation are the effect of the wind that is the support.

original: des na de dang 'brel pa'i sems ldog pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na de dang 'brel pa'i sems ldog pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the mind that is connected with that is not interrupted.

original: de'i phul byung 'grib pa las //üîΩphul byung 'grib pa dag tu 'gyur //
analyzed: de'i phul byung 'grib pa las // phul byung 'grib pa dag tu 'gyur //
translated: From the increase and decrease of that,üîΩthere is the increase and decrease of the mind.

original: phul du byung ba dang 'grib pa las sems kyang 'phel zhing 'grib pa thob par 'gyur te /üîΩ'byung ba dang 'jug pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir gdon mi za bar 'grib par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: phul du byung ba dang 'grib pa las sems kyang 'phel zhing 'grib pa thob par 'gyur te / 'byung ba dang 'jug pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir gdon mi za bar 'grib par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: From the increase and decrease of the mind, the mind also obtains increase and decrease,üîΩbecause it is the effect of inhalation and exhalation.üîΩTherefore, without a doubt, there is the decrease or increase of the effect,

original: 'phel par 'gyur ba ste 'bras bu nyams pa dang skye bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'phel par 'gyur ba ste 'bras bu nyams pa dang skye bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: and the decrease or increase of the cause.

original: gzhan du na ji ltar rgyu ru 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan du na ji ltar rgyu ru 'gyur //
translated: Otherwise, how could it be the cause?

original: de dag gis ni 'byung ba dang 'jug pa dag ni sems dang 'brel pa bkag nas snga ma'i shes pa dang 'brel par bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: de dag gis ni 'byung ba dang 'jug pa dag ni sems dang 'brel pa bkag nas snga ma'i shes pa dang 'brel par bstan pa yin la /
translated: These passages refute the connection of primary elements and minds and teach that they are connected to prior minds.

original: da ni 'byung ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu sems yin na /
analyzed: da ni 'byung ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu sems yin na /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that if the effect of primary elements and so on is mind,üîΩthen it would not cease,

original: 'gag par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'gag par mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: he says,

original: de dag thal bar mtshungs na yang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de dag thal bar mtshungs na yang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: if they are similar in consequence.

original: de dag 'byung ba dang 'jug pa dag dgag pa med par thal bar mtshungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag 'byung ba dang 'jug pa dag dgag pa med par thal bar mtshungs pa yin no //
translated: They are similar in consequence in that the arising and engaging of primary elements and so on would not be stopped.

original: lus la brten par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: lus la brten par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: If they are connected to the body,

original: rlung rten pa la 'brel pa'i 'byung ba dang 'jug pa dag ni 'gag pa med par 'das ma thag pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //üîΩlus dang 'brel pa nyid yin yang lus yod na 'gag pa ni ma yin pa bzhin du sems kyi rgyu sems yin nam /
analyzed: rlung rten pa la 'brel pa'i 'byung ba dang 'jug pa dag ni 'gag pa med par 'das ma thag pa nyid du bstan pa yin no // lus dang 'brel pa nyid yin yang lus yod na 'gag pa ni ma yin pa bzhin du sems kyi rgyu sems yin nam /
translated: then it would be taught that the arising and engaging of primary elements and so on that are connected to the support of wind are not stopped immediately after they arise.üîΩIf the cause of mind is mind,

original: 'byung ba la sogs pa yin na sems 'gag pa med par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'byung ba la sogs pa yin na sems 'gag pa med par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: or if it is primary elements and so on, then it follows that mind would not cease, just as it does not cease when the body exists even though it is connected to the body.

original: sngon bzhin du yod pa'i phyir ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: sngon bzhin du yod pa'i phyir ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But it is not, because it exists as before.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we reply:

original: sems rgyu yin yang mtshungs ma yin //üîΩgnas pa 'phen par byed pa yi //
analyzed: sems rgyu yin yang mtshungs ma yin // gnas pa 'phen par byed pa yi //
translated: The mind is the cause, but it is not the same.

original: rgyu gzhan yin par 'dod pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan yin par 'dod pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it is asserted that another cause

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: projects the abiding.

original: skyon mtshungs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: skyon mtshungs pa ma yin te /
translated: Here, the fault is not the same.

original: gang la zhe na /
analyzed: gang la zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: sems ni sems @325b kyi rgyu can yin yang ngo //
analyzed: sems ni sems @325b kyi rgyu can yin yang ngo //
translated: The mind is the cause of the mind, but it is not the same.üîΩWhy is it not the same?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na rgyu mtshan gang gi gnas pa zhes bya ba dus cung zad cig sdud pa'o //üîΩ'phen par byed pa'i rgyu las sam /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na rgyu mtshan gang gi gnas pa zhes bya ba dus cung zad cig sdud pa'o // 'phen par byed pa'i rgyu las sam /
translated: Because the cause of the abiding of the mind is the cause of the projection of the mind.

original: ma rig pa zhes bya ba sems las gzhan pa yang khas blangs pa yin no //
analyzed: ma rig pa zhes bya ba sems las gzhan pa yang khas blangs pa yin no //
translated: Or, because ignorance, which is other than the mind, is asserted to be the cause of the projection of the mind.

original: de'i dgongs pa'i 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i dgongs pa'i 'di yin te /
translated: This is the intention.

original: dper na rmi lam ni gnyid dang rjes su 'brel ba yin kyang gnyid la rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i snang ba 'byung ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: dper na rmi lam ni gnyid dang rjes su 'brel ba yin kyang gnyid la rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i snang ba 'byung ba nyid yin te /
translated: For example, in a dream, although it is related to sleep, various appearances arise in sleep.

original: 'di ltar gnyid du mtshungs pa yin yang /
analyzed: 'di ltar gnyid du mtshungs pa yin yang /
translated: Thus, although sleep is the same,

original: gang la la kha cig tu rmi lam mthong ba ni bag chags sad pa'i rgyu nyid kyi /
analyzed: gang la la kha cig tu rmi lam mthong ba ni bag chags sad pa'i rgyu nyid kyi /
translated: Some people dream of various things in some places, because the causes of the awakening of the latent impressions are there.

original: rmi lam gyi shes pa de dag sna tshogs pa yin pa'i phyir sna tshogs pa mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi shes pa de dag sna tshogs pa yin pa'i phyir sna tshogs pa mthong ba yin no //
translated: Because those dream cognitions are various, various things are seen.

original: de bzhin du shes pa ni sems kyis bskyed pa yin yang /
analyzed: de bzhin du shes pa ni sems kyis bskyed pa yin yang /
translated: In the same way, although cognition is produced by the mind,

original: las skyi bag chags kyi cha yis byas pas srog chags rnams 'tsho ba'i dus su tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: las skyi bag chags kyi cha yis byas pas srog chags rnams 'tsho ba'i dus su tha dad pa yin no //
translated: because it is produced by the aspect of the latent impressions of karma, the lives of sentient beings are different.

original: nyes pas nyams pas lus rgyu min //
analyzed: nyes pas nyams pas lus rgyu min //
translated: The body is not a cause because it is impaired by faults,

original: sdong bu la sogs bzhin zhe na //
analyzed: sdong bu la sogs bzhin zhe na //
translated: like a stalk, etc.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa bad kan dang mkhris pa la sogs pa'i nyes pas nyams par ni gyur pa'i lus rgyur mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa bad kan dang mkhris pa la sogs pa'i nyes pas nyams par ni gyur pa'i lus rgyur mi 'gyur te /
translated: The body that is impaired by faults such as phlegm and bile does not become a cause.

original: dper na chu la sogs pas bslad pa'i sdong bu ni mar me skyed par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na chu la sogs pas bslad pa'i sdong bu ni mar me skyed par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: For example, a stalk spoiled by water, etc. does not produce a lamp.

original: des ni ldog pa mad par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa de bsal ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: des ni ldog pa mad par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes brjod pa de bsal ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Didn't you say that it follows that the negation is not established?

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: shi ba'i nyes pas nyams gyur tshe //
analyzed: shi ba'i nyes pas nyams gyur tshe //
translated: And when the body is impaired by the fault of death,

original: slar yang skye ba nyid du 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: slar yang skye ba nyid du 'gyur // zhes bya ba la /
translated: it will be born again.

original: shing ba'i lus la nyes pa rims dang dug la sogs pa'i skyon mnyam pas 'gag par 'gyur na /
analyzed: shing ba'i lus la nyes pa rims dang dug la sogs pa'i skyon mnyam pas 'gag par 'gyur na /
translated: In this regard, if the body of a living person is impaired by the fault of a disease such as a fever or poison,

original: slar yang dus phyis lus ma tshang ba med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir slar 'tsho ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: slar yang dus phyis lus ma tshang ba med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir slar 'tsho ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then it will be born again, because later on it will become a complete body.

original: ji ltar rlung la sogs pa'i nyes pas nyes pa'i lus la rnam par shes pa skye bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar rlung la sogs pa'i nyes pas nyes pa'i lus la rnam par shes pa skye bar mi 'gyur /
translated: But how can consciousness arise in a body impaired by the fault of wind, etc.?

original: gang gi tshe shi ba'i lus la skyon dang bral ba de lta na yang ci'i phyir rnam par shes pa skyed par mi byed /
analyzed: gang gi tshe shi ba'i lus la skyon dang bral ba de lta na yang ci'i phyir rnam par shes pa skyed par mi byed /
translated: Even when the dead body is free from those faults, why doesn‚Äôt consciousness arise?

original: dper na ling tog gis nyams pa'i mig gzugs kyi rkyen mi byed kyi /
analyzed: dper na ling tog gis nyams pa'i mig gzugs kyi rkyen mi byed kyi /
translated: For example, an eye impaired by cataracts does not act as a condition for form,

original: ling tog dang bral bar gyur na mig gis mthong bar 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: ling tog dang bral bar gyur na mig gis mthong bar 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
translated: but when it is free from cataracts, the eye sees.

original: 'dir brtsad pa /üîΩgal te me ni ldog na yang //
analyzed: 'dir brtsad pa / gal te me ni ldog na yang //
translated: Here, the opponent argues:üîΩEven when the fire is extinguished,

original: shing gi 'gyur ba mi ldog bzhin //
analyzed: shing gi 'gyur ba mi ldog bzhin //
translated: the change in the fuel is not extinguished.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: shing 'gyur bar byed pa'i rgyu me log par gyur kyang me yis byas pa'i shing 'gyur ba thal ba ni /
analyzed: shing 'gyur bar byed pa'i rgyu me log par gyur kyang me yis byas pa'i shing 'gyur ba thal ba ni /
translated: even though the cause of the transformation of the wood, the fire, is reversed, the wood that is made by the fire does not revert to its former state.

original: slar ldog pa ma yin pas shing gi dngos por khas len pa med pa ji lta ba de @326a * //
analyzed: slar ldog pa ma yin pas shing gi dngos por khas len pa med pa ji lta ba de @326a * //
translated: Just as there is no claim that the wood has the nature of a thing,

original: bzhin du shi ba'i lus la sems 'gyur ba'i rgyu rims la sogs pa log kyang sems de ldog pa ni med do zhe na /
analyzed: bzhin du shi ba'i lus la sems 'gyur ba'i rgyu rims la sogs pa log kyang sems de ldog pa ni med do zhe na /
translated: in the same way, even though the cause of the transformation of the mind, the fever, etc., is reversed, the mind does not revert.

original: ma yin gso sbyor yod phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin gso sbyor yod phyir ro //
translated: No, because there is the application of healing.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te //
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te //
translated: that is not logical,

original: gso ba'i sbyor ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gso ba'i sbyor ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is the application of healing.

original: des ni 'di skad du ston par 'gyur te /üîΩgal te rlung la sogs pa'i nyes pa nyams na'ang /
analyzed: des ni 'di skad du ston par 'gyur te / gal te rlung la sogs pa'i nyes pa nyams na'ang /
translated: This teaches the following.

original: shing 'gyur ba bzhin na de'i tshe me yis cung zad tsam bskyur bas shing mi ldog pa de bzhin du rims la sogs pa'i skyon gyis byas pa shin tu chung dus kyang ldog par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: shing 'gyur ba bzhin na de'i tshe me yis cung zad tsam bskyur bas shing mi ldog pa de bzhin du rims la sogs pa'i skyon gyis byas pa shin tu chung dus kyang ldog par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: If, like the transformation of the wood, the mind were to revert when the faults of wind, etc., are healed, then just as the wood does not revert when a little fire is added, in the same way, it would not revert when the faults created by fever, etc., are very slight.

original: gso bas skyon sel bam yin par 'gyur ba las gso ba las skyon nyams bar mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: gso bas skyon sel bam yin par 'gyur ba las gso ba las skyon nyams bar mthong ba yin no //
translated: It is not that healing removes faults, but rather that healing is seen to diminish faults from the transformation.

original: 'chi ba'i 'gyur ba las snga ru nye par cung zad 'gyur ba nyid de nyes pas gzhag pa'i 'chi ba sel bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i 'gyur ba las snga ru nye par cung zad 'gyur ba nyid de nyes pas gzhag pa'i 'chi ba sel bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: From the transformation of death, there is no slight transformation earlier, and thus death is not removed by faults.

original: des na rlung la sogs pa'i nyes pa 'gyur bar byed pas ldog pa dang ldog pa med pa yod ci na /
analyzed: des na rlung la sogs pa'i nyes pa 'gyur bar byed pas ldog pa dang ldog pa med pa yod ci na /
translated: Therefore, since faults such as wind cause transformation, there is both reversal and non-reversal.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: slar yang mi 'byung phyir la la //
analyzed: slar yang mi 'byung phyir la la //
translated: Because it does not arise again,

original: kha cig 'gyur ba skyed par byed /
analyzed: kha cig 'gyur ba skyed par byed /
translated: some produce transformation,

original: kha cig bzlog pa yin phyir dper //
analyzed: kha cig bzlog pa yin phyir dper //
translated: and some stop it, like

original: shing dang gser la me lta bu'o //
analyzed: shing dang gser la me lta bu'o //
translated: fire for wood and gold.

original: dang po chung yang ldog pa min //
analyzed: dang po chung yang ldog pa min //
translated: First, even if small, it is not reversed,

original: phyir ldog rung ba'i 'gyur ba gang //
analyzed: phyir ldog rung ba'i 'gyur ba gang //
translated: but what transformation can be reversed?

original: de ni slar 'byung pa yin te //
analyzed: de ni slar 'byung pa yin te //
translated: That is what arises again,

original: gser gyi sra ba nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: gser gyi sra ba nyid bzhin no //
translated: like the hardness of gold.

original: zhes bya ba la 'di'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la 'di'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows:

original: chos can la la la slar yang mi 'byung ba yis 'gyur ba kha cig skyed par byed de /
analyzed: chos can la la la slar yang mi 'byung ba yis 'gyur ba kha cig skyed par byed de /
translated: For some subjects, transformation is produced by not arising again.

original: dper na shing la me yis slar mi 'byung ba'i 'gyur ba rtsam par byed la /
analyzed: dper na shing la me yis slar mi 'byung ba'i 'gyur ba rtsam par byed la /
translated: For example, fire causes a transformation in wood that prevents its re-arising.

original: chos can kha cig la ni bzlog nas slar 'byung pa yis 'gyur pa kha cig skyed par byed de /
analyzed: chos can kha cig la ni bzlog nas slar 'byung pa yis 'gyur pa kha cig skyed par byed de /
translated: But in some cases, a transformation is produced in a phenomenon by its re-arising.

original: dper na me nyid kyis gser la slar 'byung ba'i 'gyur bkyed do //
analyzed: dper na me nyid kyis gser la slar 'byung ba'i 'gyur bkyed do //
translated: For example, fire causes a transformation in gold that allows its re-arising.

original: 'di ltar gser zhu bar gyur nas yang sra bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gser zhu bar gyur nas yang sra bar 'gyur la /
translated: Thus, gold is melted and then becomes hard again.

original: dang po ste shing chung ba ste bag tsam cig tshig pa yang ldog pa min te /
analyzed: dang po ste shing chung ba ste bag tsam cig tshig pa yang ldog pa min te /
translated: But a small piece of wood, a mere chip, is not reversed,

original: slar rnal mor mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: slar rnal mor mi 'gyur te /
translated: because it does not return to its former condition.üîΩThus, even though a small piece of wood is burned by fire, it does not re-arise.

original: 'di ltar mes shing chung du cig bsregs kyang slar 'byung bar mi 'gyur la gser cung zad bzhu ba'i mtshan nyid ni bskyar te /
analyzed: 'di ltar mes shing chung du cig bsregs kyang slar 'byung bar mi 'gyur la gser cung zad bzhu ba'i mtshan nyid ni bskyar te /
translated: But the characteristic of a small amount of melted gold is that it can be re-melted and become gold again.

original: gser du 'gyur pas gang zhig 'gyur ba da ni slar 'byung zhing sngon gyi rang bzhin du 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: gser du 'gyur pas gang zhig 'gyur ba da ni slar 'byung zhing sngon gyi rang bzhin du 'gro ba ste /
translated: Thus, that which is transformed can now re-arise and return to its former nature.

original: dper na gser gyi sra ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na gser gyi sra ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, the hardness of gold.

original: de bas na rims la sogs pa'i nyes pas byas pa'i 'gyur ba chung du la ldog par nus pa'i phyir @326b 'chi ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gyur ba chen po yang ldog pa ste /
analyzed: de bas na rims la sogs pa'i nyes pas byas pa'i 'gyur ba chung du la ldog par nus pa'i phyir @326b 'chi ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gyur ba chen po yang ldog pa ste /
translated: Therefore, since it is possible to reverse the small changes produced by the faults of fever, etc., it is also possible to reverse the great change characterized by death.

original: slar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: slar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: It will happen again.

original: 'di ltar gnyid kyis byas pa'i sems 'gags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gyur ba ni gnyid med na ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar gnyid kyis byas pa'i sems 'gags pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gyur ba ni gnyid med na ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the change characterized by the cessation of the mind produced by sleep will be reversed when one is not asleep.

original: 'on te gnyid gyi gnas skabs su shes pa mi 'gag na de bzhin du nyams su ma myong ba'i rang bzhin shes pa yin par 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te gnyid gyi gnas skabs su shes pa mi 'gag na de bzhin du nyams su ma myong ba'i rang bzhin shes pa yin par 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But if consciousness does not cease during sleep, then it would be contradictory to say that consciousness is by nature not experienced.

original: gal te gnyid log pa'i shes pa myong ba med pa yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te gnyid log pa'i shes pa myong ba med pa yin na ni /
translated: If the consciousness of one who is asleep is not experienced,

original: shi ba'i rol rig pa med par gsal bar yang 'dra bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: shi ba'i rol rig pa med par gsal bar yang 'dra bar 'gyur te /
translated: then it would be clear that the dead body is without consciousness.

original: ro dang gnyid log pa dag la khyad par cung zad kyang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ro dang gnyid log pa dag la khyad par cung zad kyang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: There would be no difference whatsoever between a dead body and one who is asleep.

original: de bas na ji ltar gnyid log bsad par nus pa bzhin du ro yang smon gyi sbyor ba las 'tsho bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de bas na ji ltar gnyid log bsad par nus pa bzhin du ro yang smon gyi sbyor ba las 'tsho bar 'gyur //
translated: Therefore, just as one can be killed while asleep, so too one can live while dead.

original: 'on te gnyid log pa la myong ba med kyang /
analyzed: 'on te gnyid log pa la myong ba med kyang /
translated: But if, although there is no experience in sleep,

original: nus pa'i rang bzhin gyis yod na ni nus zhes bya ba 'di ci yin /
analyzed: nus pa'i rang bzhin gyis yod na ni nus zhes bya ba 'di ci yin /
translated: the nature of the potential exists, then what is this ‚Äúpotential‚Äù?

original: gal te sems nyid yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te sems nyid yin na ni /
translated: If it is the mind itself,

original: de'i tshe sems nyid yod pas ji ltar myong ba med pa yin /
analyzed: de'i tshe sems nyid yod pas ji ltar myong ba med pa yin /
translated: then since the mind itself exists, how can there be no experience?

original: 'on te sems las nus pa gzhan yin na ni /
analyzed: 'on te sems las nus pa gzhan yin na ni /
translated: But if the potential is something other than the mind,

original: 'on lus nyid nus par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on lus nyid nus par 'gyur te /
translated: then the body itself is the potential,

original: gnyid log dus su gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyid log dus su gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because at the time of sleep there is nothing else.

original: de ltar na ni lus nus par gnas pas ro'i dus su yang sems mi ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na ni lus nus par gnas pas ro'i dus su yang sems mi ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, since the body exists as the potential, the mind would not cease at the time of death.

original: de bas ni de'i tshe nus pa'i lus zhig nas gzhan pa'i nus pa med pa skyes so zhe na nus pa med pa'i 'di ci yin /
analyzed: de bas ni de'i tshe nus pa'i lus zhig nas gzhan pa'i nus pa med pa skyes so zhe na nus pa med pa'i 'di ci yin /
translated: Therefore, at that time, the body that is the potential ceases and another body without potential is born. But what is this body without potential?

original: shes pa dang bral ba nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: shes pa dang bral ba nyid do zhe na /
translated: It is devoid of consciousness.

original: gnyid log pa na yang shes pa dang bral pa'i phyir sad pa'i tshe myong ba skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyid log pa na yang shes pa dang bral pa'i phyir sad pa'i tshe myong ba skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And when one is asleep, consciousness is absent, so the experience of waking would not arise.

original: 'on te gnyid log pa'i tshe 'byung ba dang 'jug pa yod pa de bas na gnyid log pa'i tshe lus la shes pa skyed pa'i nus pa yod do zhe na 'o na ni shes pa skyed pa'i phyir sad pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te gnyid log pa'i tshe 'byung ba dang 'jug pa yod pa de bas na gnyid log pa'i tshe lus la shes pa skyed pa'i nus pa yod do zhe na 'o na ni shes pa skyed pa'i phyir sad pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: But if the arising and entering of the elements exists when one is asleep, then the body has the ability to produce consciousness when one is asleep. But if it produces consciousness, then one would be awake.

original: 'on te 'byung ba dang / 'jug pa'i grogs las gnyid sad par byed pa las sems skye'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te 'byung ba dang / 'jug pa'i grogs las gnyid sad par byed pa las sems skye'o zhe na /
translated: But if the mind arises from the cause of sleep, which is a condition for the arising and entering of the elements,

original: gnyid ces bya ba ni ci yin /
analyzed: gnyid ces bya ba ni ci yin /
translated: then what is this thing called sleep?

original: sems med pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: sems med pa'o zhe na /
translated: If it is a state without mind,

original: shes pa med pa'i ro la yang sems yod bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes pa med pa'i ro la yang sems yod bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then even a corpse would have a mind.

original: 'on te dbugs med pas lus 'ba' zhig las mi skye na ni brgyal bal sogs pa 'gyur pa na /
analyzed: 'on te dbugs med pas lus 'ba' zhig las mi skye na ni brgyal bal sogs pa 'gyur pa na /
translated: But if the mind does not arise from the body alone, because there is no breath, then when one faints,

original: dbyugs la sogs pa med pa'i phyir sems med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dbyugs la sogs pa med pa'i phyir sems med par 'gyur ro //
translated: because there is no breath, etc., there would be no mind.

original: des na dbugs la sogs pa ni shes pa'i rgyu ma yin te 'byung ba dang 'jug pa ni sems kyi rgyu ma yin no zhes sngar bstan to //üîΩgzhan yang lus @327a * //
analyzed: des na dbugs la sogs pa ni shes pa'i rgyu ma yin te 'byung ba dang 'jug pa ni sems kyi rgyu ma yin no zhes sngar bstan to // gzhan yang lus @327a * //
translated: Therefore, the breath and so on are not the cause of consciousness, because the arising and entering are not the cause of the mind. This has been explained above.üîΩMoreover,

original: las skye bar mtshungs kyang /
analyzed: las skye bar mtshungs kyang /
translated: although arising from the body is the same,

original: gnyid log pa sad pa'i tshe sngar goms pa bzhin du myong bar snang ste /
analyzed: gnyid log pa sad pa'i tshe sngar goms pa bzhin du myong bar snang ste /
translated: when one awakens from sleep, it appears as if one experiences according to previous habituation.

original: des na lus sam /
analyzed: des na lus sam /
translated: Therefore, the body

original: 'byung 'jug ni rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: 'byung 'jug ni rgyu ma yin no //
translated: or the arising and entering are not the cause.

original: sngar goms pa'i grogs byed pa yod na lus las shes pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: sngar goms pa'i grogs byed pa yod na lus las shes pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If there is the assistance of previous habituation, is consciousness not produced from the body?

original: de ni mi bden te /
analyzed: de ni mi bden te /
translated: That is not true.

original: sad pa'i tshe goms pa nyid yod pa ma yin pas lus kyi grogs byed pa med de /
analyzed: sad pa'i tshe goms pa nyid yod pa ma yin pas lus kyi grogs byed pa med de /
translated: When one awakens, habituation itself does not exist, so there is no assistance from the body.

original: lhan cig byed pas stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhan cig byed pas stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is empty of a co-originating cause.

original: yod pa dang med pa lhan cig pa ni med pa'i phyir sngar gyi shes pa nyid sad pa'i rgyu yin gyi lus ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa lhan cig pa ni med pa'i phyir sngar gyi shes pa nyid sad pa'i rgyu yin gyi lus ni ma yin no //
translated: Because existence and nonexistence do not exist together, the previous consciousness itself is the cause of awakening, not the body.

original: thun la sogs pa sad pa'i rgyu yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: thun la sogs pa sad pa'i rgyu yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is the cause of awakening the session and so on?

original: gdon mi za bar brtsangs pa la sogs pa kho nas sad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gdon mi za bar brtsangs pa la sogs pa kho nas sad pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not that one necessarily awakens from sleep by stretching and so on,

original: ma brtsangs par yang rang nyid sad par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma brtsangs par yang rang nyid sad par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because one is seen to awaken without stretching.

original: sad pa'i tshe mthong ba'i dngos po dang 'brel pas dang po dngos po'i blo skye ba ma yin nam /üîΩde la da ltar ba mthong ba dang / sngar gyi shes pa dag la /
analyzed: sad pa'i tshe mthong ba'i dngos po dang 'brel pas dang po dngos po'i blo skye ba ma yin nam / de la da ltar ba mthong ba dang / sngar gyi shes pa dag la /
translated: When one awakens, does the cognition of an entity not arise first, in connection with the entity that is seen?üîΩHow is it tenable that the present is seen and that the prior cognitions

original: ji ltar grogs byed pa 'thad ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar grogs byed pa 'thad ce na /
translated: are its companions?

original: 'di la yang nges pa med de /
analyzed: 'di la yang nges pa med de /
translated: There is no certainty here.

original: sad par gyur na gang dmigs pa de dang 'brel pas dus nye bar rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sad par gyur na gang dmigs pa de dang 'brel pas dus nye bar rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: When one awakens, one realizes the time by the connection with that which is observed.

original: 'di ltar 'jungs pas phangs nas gnyid log pa gang yin pa de bzhin du de nyid la sad pa'i tshe yang skye bas nang gi reg bya myong ba ni sad pa'o //üîΩgang sngar goms pa'i rkyen ci 'dra ba de dang mthun par sad pa'i tshe /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jungs pas phangs nas gnyid log pa gang yin pa de bzhin du de nyid la sad pa'i tshe yang skye bas nang gi reg bya myong ba ni sad pa'o // gang sngar goms pa'i rkyen ci 'dra ba de dang mthun par sad pa'i tshe /
translated: Thus, when one falls asleep out of miserliness, having cherished something, one awakens in the same way, and so one experiences an internal tactile object.

original: lus kyi bde pa goms par 'gyur te /
analyzed: lus kyi bde pa goms par 'gyur te /
translated: When one awakens, one becomes accustomed to bodily pleasure in accordance with whatever conditions one was accustomed to previously.

original: 'di ltar bred par gyur pa'i yid 'bras pa'i rnam pa'i rgyu mtshan myong ba na sad pa'i dus su yang /
analyzed: 'di ltar bred par gyur pa'i yid 'bras pa'i rnam pa'i rgyu mtshan myong ba na sad pa'i dus su yang /
translated: Thus, when the mind experiences the signs of the results of fear, it is also afraid at the time of waking.

original: sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du shin tu gdug pa'i yid can gzhan la gnod pa dang mthun pa'i ral gri 'don pa la sogs pa'i bde ba sad ba na 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du shin tu gdug pa'i yid can gzhan la gnod pa dang mthun pa'i ral gri 'don pa la sogs pa'i bde ba sad ba na 'byung ba ste /
translated: In the same way, when the mind is very cruel, the pleasure of drawing a sword and so on, which is conducive to harming others, arises at the time of waking.

original: de bas na sems ni lus dang 'byung 'jug gi rgyu can ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de bas na sems ni lus dang 'byung 'jug gi rgyu can ma yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the mind is not caused by the body and the elements.

original: 'on kyang sngar goms pa'i shes pa'i rgyu can no //
analyzed: 'on kyang sngar goms pa'i shes pa'i rgyu can no //
translated: However, it is caused by the consciousness that was previously habituated.

original: gal te lus rgyu yin na ldog pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te lus rgyu yin na ldog pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the body were the cause, there would be no cessation.

original: 'on te skyon gyis bskyur bas rgyur mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te skyon gyis bskyur bas rgyur mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if it is not the cause because it is discarded by faults,

original: skyon rnams slar mi 'byung ba'i 'gyur pa rtsom bar byed na ni des byas pa'i 'gyur ba chung du rid pa la sogs pa dang / brgyal ba la sogs pas shes pa rgyun chad pa'i tshe na ldog pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyon rnams slar mi 'byung ba'i 'gyur pa rtsom bar byed na ni des byas pa'i 'gyur ba chung du rid pa la sogs pa dang / brgyal ba la sogs pas shes pa rgyun chad pa'i tshe na ldog pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: if one undertakes a transformation in which the faults do not arise again, then the transformation produced by that would be without cessation when the mind is interrupted by emaciation and so on, which are small transformations produced by that, and fainting and so on.

original: rid pa la sogs pa gang gis byas pa'i 'gyur bde gso bar rung na /
analyzed: rid pa la sogs pa gang gis byas pa'i 'gyur bde gso bar rung na /
translated: If it is possible to cure the changes in the body, such as emaciation,

original: de nyid kyis byas pa'i 'chi ba'i @327b mtshan nyid kyi 'gyur ba yang gso bar rung ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyis byas pa'i 'chi ba'i @327b mtshan nyid kyi 'gyur ba yang gso bar rung ste /
translated: then it is also possible to cure the changes in the body that are characterized by death.

original: gser gyi sra ba bzhin no //
analyzed: gser gyi sra ba bzhin no //
translated: This is just like the hardness of gold.

original: gang gi phyir gser spa bar gyur  kyang 'gyur ba'i rgyus 'ju zhing slar yang sra bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gser spa bar gyur  kyang 'gyur ba'i rgyus 'ju zhing slar yang sra bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Even though gold becomes soft, it becomes hard again through the cause of change.üîΩBut it is not the case that the change is cured by the application of a cure, and that it does not occur again, like the internal organs of someone who is incurable.

original: gso ba'i sbyor bas 'gyur ba gso bar rung ba dang / gso bar mi rung ba'i nang kyis slar mi 'byung bar bsgyur ba ma yin nam des na skyon med do zhe na /
analyzed: gso ba'i sbyor bas 'gyur ba gso bar rung ba dang / gso bar mi rung ba'i nang kyis slar mi 'byung bar bsgyur ba ma yin nam des na skyon med do zhe na /
translated: Therefore there is no fault.

original: 'dir smras pa/ cung zad gsor mi rung brjod pa //üîΩ'o  byed rnyed dka' nyid phyir ram //
analyzed: 'dir smras pa/ cung zad gsor mi rung brjod pa // 'o  byed rnyed dka' nyid phyir ram //
translated: Here we say: It is said that it is not at all curable.üîΩBecause it is difficult to find a kiss,

original: tshe zad phyir ro nyes pa ni //
analyzed: tshe zad phyir ro nyes pa ni //
translated: or because life is exhausted.

original: gcig tu gsor mi rung ba med /
analyzed: gcig tu gsor mi rung ba med /
translated: There is no single incurable fault.
